description: Loren W. Shores, chairman of the foreign languages department at Scarsdale (N.Y.) High School, where he had also been president of the Scarsdale Teachers Association, died Saturday in a nursing home in Yonkers. He was 56 years old and lived at 80 Edgemont Road in Scarsdale.

title: Father Dies in Rescue of Daughter After Ice Breaks at a Coast Lake
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 10 (UPI)A father died yesterday while saving the life of his 7yearold daughter after she fell through thin ice at Steele Lake.

title: Business, Labor and Some U.S. Allies Criticize Carter Package to Stimulate Economic Recovery
description: The package of measures outlined by Presidentelect Carter to stimulate the nation's economic recovery has run into criticism, of varying intensity and for varying reasons, from business leaders, labor and some of America's allies overseas.

title: Ichabod Crane's Alter Ego Comes To Terms With Tommy Tune
description: He was tall, but exceedingly lank, with narrow shoulders, long arms and legs, hands that dangled a mile out of his sleeves. feet that might have served for shovels, and his whole form most loosely hung together.

title: Hughes Attendants Say the Billionaire Was Used by Aides
description: The two personal attendants for the late Howard R. Hughes, who have disclosed a tragic story of his last secretive, ailing years said yesterday that they did so because their allegiance had been to him and because they considered that aides who directed the billionaire's empire had manipulated himoften without his knowledge.

title: Poll of Republican Committeemen Shows Purcell Leads Caso and Dunne in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 10Francis T. Purcell, who is in a threeway race for the Republican nomination for Nassau County Executive, is apparently heavily favored by the party's county committeemen, although the actual nominee will be chosen by the electorate in the primary, which is months away.

title: People in Sports
description: Derek Sanderson will be playing hockey in the minor leagues in the immediate futurebut he will be well paid for his efforts. Yesterday, after none of the other 17 National Hockey League teams claimed the flamboyant center, he was sent by the St. Louis Blues to their Kansas City farm club in the Central Hockey League.

title: ExBroadway Producer Is Now Producing Race Horses
description: OLD SNOWMASS, olo., Jan. 7One day in the not too distant future, a horse raised at the Abacus Ranch near here, perhaps named Mountain High or something similarly altitudinal, may sweep across the finish line first in the Belmont Stakes and prove Mary K. Frank's theory.

title: Mild Quakes Strike Philippines
description: MANILA, Jan. 10 (AP)Mild earthquakes struck opposite ends of the Philippines today, shaking the mountain resort city of Baguio, 115 miles north of Manila, for about five seconds and the southern province of Mindanao for nearly half a minute. There were no immediate reports of injuries or damage.

title: Ballet Will Cancel Year if Strike Is On Sunday
description: The New York City Ballet Company yesterday notified its striking musicians that if the company did not have a contract with the orchestra members by Sunday night, the remaining five weeks of the season would be canceled.

title: Printers Unions Strike in Italy
description: ROME, Jan. 10 (AP)Typographical workers staged a national strike today that will leave Italy without newspapers tomorrow. The three major unions called the strike to demand a new labor contract after negotiations with management ended in disagreement last week.

title: 43,000 Homes Lose Power in Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 10About 43,000 homes in Westchester county, lost their electricity for at least two hours tonight, a spokesman for the Consolidated Edison Company reported.

title: INSURGENT IN UNION ACCUSED BY MEANY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 (UPI) George Meany, president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., charged today that Ed Sadlowski, the insurgent candidate for president of the United Steelworkers, had accepted illegal and unethical campaign contributions.

title: Sheriff and Deputy Ordered Jailed For Balking at Evictions on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 10Sheriff Richard Hongisto and his deputy, Under Sheriff James Denman, were sentenced today to five days in jail and fined $500 each for their failure to evict tenants from a downtown hotel here last October.

title: Eden Is Said to Be Fairly Weak But Is Termed in Good Spirits
description: ALVEDISTON, England, Jan. 10 (AP)The Earl of Avon, who as Anthony Eden served as Prime Minister from 1955 to 1957, was fairly weak but in good spirits today after spending a comfortable night at his family home near this Wiltshire village, his family doctor said.

title: Cunningham Agency Gets Beefeater  Gin
description: Cunningham & Walsh, which has gone through a dry period since it lost Ballantine Scotch four years ago, dropped off the wagon yesterday with the help of Beefeater Gin and enough other brands from the Kobrand Corporation to bring the annual billings to over $5 million.

title: Village Transformed as Egypt Quickens Pace of Change
description: KAFR EL BATTIKH, Egypt  The noise of gasoline engines pumping irrigation water rings out over the countryside. In the village center, loudspeakers blare the price of meat at Mohammed the butcher's or vegetables at Abdulla the grocer's. The quiet of centuries is gone, but progress has come to Watermelon Village.

title: Central Bankers Vote $3 Billion to Aid British Pound
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Jan. 10 (Reuters) Central bankers from leading industrial nations set up a $3 billion plan today to help Britain cover any withdrawals of official sterling balances held by foreigners in London.

title: Miami Strike Spreads to 9th Hotel
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 10 (UPI)Hotel workers walked out at a ninth Miami area resort hotel today as another session of bargaining began in a 16dayold hotel strike. Maids, bellmen, restaurant employees, bartenders and elevator operators walked out of the Beau Rivage Resort at 4:30 P.M., a move that had been threatened for several days.

title: ABU DHABI IS SAID TO HAVE NO PLANS TO LIFT OIL OUTPUT
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates, Jan. 10The wealthy emirate of Abu Dhabi, which has copied Saudi Arabia's low oil price policy, does not intend to lift production ceilings and order major increases in oil output this year, wellplaced officials maintained here today.

title: DebtIssue Prices Swing Widely, With Utility Bonds Adding to Yield
description: The credit markets continued to move through unusually sharp price gyrations yesterday, with highgrade utility bonds priced to yield 8.23 percentalmost half a percentage point more than the return on similar bonds sold last week. Government bonds and notes dropped sharply in price early yesterday in a continuation of their steep decline last week and then recovered somewhat in late afternoon trading.

title: Sutton Names Two TeenAgers To Community Planning Boards
description: At least two community planning boards in Manhattan will have teenaged members this year to represent the youth of the community.

title: NEW HOSPITAL PLAN WOULD CURB LAYOFFS
description: A special financial committee that was set up by Mayor Beame has tentatively concluded that the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation can cut its financial deficit without imposing the wholesale job layoffs that were threatened last year.

title: HERALD ACQUIRES 99.8% OF BOOTH NEWSPAPERS
description: NEW YORK, Jan. 10 (AP)Acquisition of 99.3 percent of the shares of Booth Newspapers Inc., the biggest such acquisition in United States newspaper history, has been announced by the Herald Company, owned by newspaper publisher S. I. Newhouse.

title: Number Numbness
description: I have been trying to learn what number I am. It is very important in America. I am certain I am not Number One. There are too many other people who are Number One, or claim to be. You can't turn on the television without seeing somebody, and often several somebodies, jumping up and down with one finger pointed at the clouds to signify Number Oneness.

title: OLLIE ATKINS, 60, DEAD; NIXON'S PHOTOGRAPHER
description: WASHINGTON, Va., Jan. 10(AP) ollie F. Atkins, the personal photographer for President Nixon from 1969 to 1974, has died after a long illness. He was 60 years old.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator Carl T. Curtis plans to retire at the end of 1978 after spending 40 years in Congress. Mr. Curtis, who is 71 years old, said yesterday that he was making his plans known now so that Nebraskans will have ample time to nominate and elect a successor of their own choosing.

title: Sutton Appoints Two TeenAgers To Community Planning Boards
description: that he did.

title: Capitals Top Wings, 20; First Shutout for Wolfe
Ford's Choice for G.O.P. Chairman Says He Won't Be a Candidate
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 10 (AP)James A. Baker 3d, President Ford's choice for chairman of the Republican National Committee, said today that he would not be a candidate for the post.

title: After a Decade of Shag, the CloseCropped Rug Comes Back
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 10After a decade of tangling with everyone's toes, shag walltowall is out, and closecropped rugs with Oriental designs, folk motifs and geometric patterns are in.

title: Advertising
description: Florida is having its best orange crop and that should help keep the consumer prices down.

title: Dow Up 3.74 in Apparent Response To Carter EconomicStimulus Plan
description: The stock market advanced moderately yesterday in slower trading to post its third gain in a row.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an obituary of Dr. Harry Goldblatt in Saturday's Times, the name of his sister was incorrectly given. She is Alta Kahn of Montreal.

title: In Memoriam
Taxes & Accounting
description: The pro and con on accounting proposals to deal with the impact of inflation. Page 51.

title: Marilyn Horne Puts Prophecy to Test
description: Fifteen years ago, Henry Lewis checked out a score of Meyerbeer's Le Prophte from a Los Angeles library and brought it home to his wife, Marilyn Horne. Some day, Mr. Lewis declared after they had gone over the music at the piano, Fids will be a great part for you.

title: Carter's Economic Plans Please Europe and Japan
description: LONDON, Jan. 10Officials in major European capitals and Japan are openly pleased with Jimmy Carter's plans to stimulate the American economy with a proposed package of $30 billion in tax cuts and spending programs.

title: Blazers Are Ablaze as Knicks Pay Them a Visit
description: The Knicks arrived at Portland International Airport Sunday night after an eighthour flight, including a stopover in Seattle due to mechanical problems, and they were greeted by a skycap who said, The Blazers scored 150 points tonight, the most in the N.B.A. this season. A few hours later Doug Moe, the coach of the San Antonio Spurs, who had been beaten, 150113, said upon leaving the airport, Portland has a good club, but playing at home makes them a lot better.

title: U.S. Investigation of Lance Closed Day Before Carter Appointed Him
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10Just one day before Bert Lance was named by Presidentelect Carter to head the Office of Management and Budget, the United States Attorney in Atlanta decided to end an investigation into a possible campaignlaw violation by Mr. Lance and a bank that he controls, it was learned today.

title: Conference Standings
AUTO MAKER AGREES TO TRY PILOT CARS WITH AIR BAGS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 (AP)Transportation Secretary William T. Coleman Jr. said today that one major auto maker had tentatively agreed to market a fleet of cars equipped with air bags to acquaint the public with the controversial safety systems.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MUSIC, MUSIC, MUSIC One of last season's sleepers on the local cabaret scene was the surprise appearance and success of Jan Kiepura Jr. The son of the late tenor and Marta Eggerth turned out to be a personable entertainer with an exuberant manner and a ringing voice of his own. Continuing family tradition after a brief try at medicine, the young singer first drew acclaim at tile uptown club, the Bushes, when he shared the finale spotlight with his retired mother in a nostalgic reprise of The Merry Widow, the family trademark.

title: Pentagon Chief Bids U.S. Reverse Trend Toward Soviet Superiority
description: Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld said yesterday that the United States must act now to reverse what he described as the trends of the last 10 to 15 years toward Soviet military superiority.

title: Beame Seeks Rail Projects Aid
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that the city had asked the State Department of Transportation for $35 million for rail projects designed to improve the city's position as a major freight distribution center. The request, part of the city's plan for economic recovery, would he financed from an allocation the Legislature, had already appropriated to the city from the 1974 rail preservation bond issue. The projects call for track and rightofway improvements, new rail connections and modernization of rail car float operations in the city's harbor.

title: Snow, Rain, Thaws And Flooding Beset Much of Northeast
description: Rain early in the day and a 41degree January thaw of the remaining snow turned the New York City area yesterday into a land of slushy lakes dotted with stalled cars, squishyshoed pedestrians and saltypawed dogs.

title: Byrne Challenges Income Tax Foes To Come Up With Better Program
Cricket Referee Killed
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 11 (AP)Three college students have been arrested on charges of killing a referee during an exhibition cricket match at a Karachi school, the police reported today. The police said the students attacked Shandi Mushtaq after he refused to reverse a decision he made during a match yesterday.

title: Tanner Wins; 2 Americans Score Upsets
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Tan. 11 (UPI) Roscoe Tanner, despite an upset stomach, defeated a fellow American, Dick Bornstedt, 75, 63, in the second round of the $75,000 South Australian tennis tournament today.

title: Representation by Identity
description: Senator Roman Hruska may have started the movement some years ago when he suggested that mediocre people are entitled to be represented by governmental mediocrities. Inevitably, the Hruska doctrine has been reborn in an age which believes it an iron rule that one votes what one is.

title: Troy Reported Indicted in Queens On Larceny and Perjury Charges
description: A sealed indictment was handed up in Queens yesterday against Matthew J. Troy Jr. reportedly accusing the Queens City Councilman of grand larceny and perjury.

title: Jobless Claims Up
description: ALBANY, Tan. 11 (UPI)There were 57,479 new claims for unemployment compensation in the week ending Dec. 31, up 12,540 from the previous week, Commissioner Philip Ross of the State Labor Department said today. Mr. Ross said the increase was caused by temporary shutdowns for vacations and inventory in manufacturing, in private education and retail trades, postChristmas retail layoffs and seasonal filings in the construction and food processing industries.

title: G.E. Agrees to Repair 36,000 Ovens Free
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)The General Electric Company has agreed to repair 36,000 microwave ovens that may be leaking excessive radiation, the Food and Drug Administration announced today.

title: Israel's Political Battlefield
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 11During the three weeks since he dismantled his fragile majority government, Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin has been telling his audiences that his new minority administration is still a government empowered to act and not a caretaker presiding somnolently until the election in May.

title: 3 U.S. Women Advance
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 11 (AP)John Holladay of the United States was beaten by Rod Frawley of Australia, 60, 26, 64, in the second round of the Auckland open tennis tournament today.

title: Mugger Attacks Three Women In 10 Minutes
description: Three women were mugged and robbed, allegedly by the same man, within 10 minutes inside and outside an IND subway station on Central Park West Monday night. A suspect was arrested shortly afterward by the police.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 11, 1977

title: STATE SENATOR GOODMANGETS NEW ALBANY POST
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11The Republican majority in the State Senate completed its reorganization today by naming four new committee chairman.

title: BRITAIN'S LEADERS BUOYANT ON POUND
Carter in Capital For Foreign Policy And Defense Talks
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 11  Presidentelect Carter flew here tcday from Georgia to discuss foreign policy and defense policy in preparation for assuming office en Jan. 20.

title: PERES SAYS HE WILL SEEK POST OF ISRAELI PREMIER
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 11 (AP)  Defense Minister Shimon Peres today announced his candidacy for leadership of the goyerning Labor Party, and thus for Prime Minister, setting off a party power struggle between himself and Prime Minister Yitzhak Rahin four months before elections.

title: A Bankrupt Insurance Executive Is Ordered to Vacate His Estate
description: NEWARK, Jan. 11 (UPI)A bankrupt insurance executive, Charles Britchard, has been ordered to vacate his estate in two weeks to make room for a New York diamond merchant who bought the home last month on the public auction block.

title: Private Lives
description: MY DAUGHTER, for reasons that are nobody's business but my own, spends much of her time in Florida, which I imagine through a mythic mist to consist of hotels, marching bands, alligators and Cuban exiles with C.I.A. connections, under a boring sun. Who knows? I was in Boca Raton once, where it rained four days on the just and the unjust, the polo ponies and the putting green. We sat around listenine to our brains rot.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MARGIN FOR ERA A display and sale of posters at the new Ballet, Opera and Theater Gallery, 961 Madison Avenue at 75th Street, should interest browsers and buyers of nostalgia. Some 300 posters are turnofthecentury products of the Strobridge Company, known as the Tiffany of Lithographers for its prolific but quality output of wall bills heralding the performing artsfrom opera to circus. Except in museums and libraries, few Strobridge specimens have survived.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: NOSTALGIA IS DEFINED generally as wistful or sentimental, perhaps even abnormal, yearning for the past, and it is to this state of mind that Danny Stiles has dedicated himself, and not merely for the three hours a day, from 10 A.M. to I P.M., that he spins old records on WEVDFM.

title: All About: Filtering Your Drinking Water
description: NOTHING, it seems, is pure and simple anymore, not even the water from the kitchen tap. And the consumer searching for clear, odorfree, goodtasting water that is free of chemicals, pesticides and bacteria is not only faced with dozens of gadgets full of grandiose claims, but also with several purifying methods. He can filter it, distill it, deionize it or purify it through a complex process called reverse osmosis.

title: Palestinian Regulars Are Reported To Begin Evacuation of Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 11Palestinian regular forces were reported to be leaving Lebanon by land and sea last night for their bases in other Arab countries.

title: Carter and the Courts
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Presidentelect Carter's appointments to the Cabinet, the subCabinet and the White House staff are getting most of the attention these days, but in the long run, his selection of Federal judges may be equally or even more important. And here he has a problemseveral problems.

title: Iranian Is Accused of Defrauding Chase Manhattan of $2.7 Million
description: An Iranian citizen was charged yesterday with fraudulently withdrawing $2.7 million in personal checks from his account at the Chase Manhattan Bank in a scheme that was allegedly based on depositing worthless checks from other banks.

title: Mother's Chicken Soup
description: 1. Wash chicken thoroughly and singe to remove all pin feathers. Cut fowl in quarters. Wash giblets Reserve liver for other uses but do not add to soup.

title: Judge Will Not Disqualify Himself
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Jan. 11 (AP) A judge has refused to step down in the murder trial of Joanne Chesimard, which is scheduled to begin here Monday. Judge Theodore Appleby of Superior Court denied a motion by the chief defense lawyer, William M. Kunstler, that he disqualify himself because of bias by the court against the defendant and her counsel during pretrial proceedings.

title: New Assassination Panel Is Blocked
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Faced with growing objections to the proposed scope, budget and methods of the Select Committee on Assassinations, the leadership of the House leadership today withdrew from immediate consideration a resolution to reestablish the committee.

title: SCHULTZE DISCOUNTS FEAR THAT STIMULUS WILL SPUR INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Charles L. Schultze, chairman  designate of the Council of Economic Advisers, told Congress today that there was no substance to the fear that Presidentelect Carter's proposals to stimulate the economy might increase the rate of inflation.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Maxwell Hamilton doesn't think he's extraordinary; but nevertheless, policemen open traffic lanes for him, he's often saluted by goggleeyed pedestrians as he drives by, and he parks in reserved places. Mr. Hamilton has status and he achieved it overnight when he attached a licenseplate sized emblem to the grill of his car. The emblem has a white background and twoinchhigh black letters spelling out Official. Oh yes, there are two gold stars above the lettering. Now Mr. Hamilton has decided to make a limited number of his official plates for others who want instant status. He's working with a printer so that the lettering won't fade or wash off but he plans to restrict the number of plates he sells in any one neighborhood. The price, postpaid, is $5 and the address is 49 Rockville Avenue, Rockville Center, L.I., 11570. Mr. Hamilton's telephone number is (516) 5360693. And just for the record, the Department of Motor Vehicles says that Mr. Hamilton makes no attempt to copy an official city or state plate, his bit of fun is not illegal.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  The Metropolitan Opera and the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts announced today that they had entered the management booking and tour business together in the Sol Hurok tradition and would jointly present some of the leading performing companies of the world in both of their houses in addition to managing their tours.MIAMI, Jan. 11 (UPI)Because of, engine failure aboard the Monarch Star, a cruise liner bound for Haiti, 368 passengers were transferred to a sister ship today.CHICAGO, Jan. 11 (UPI)Joseph V. Karanganis, special Assistant State Attorney General, charged today that the city of Milwaukee literally constructed . . . a giant toilet by dumping raw sewage into Lake Michigan.SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 11 (UPI)Lawyers representing two persons on Utah's death row have taken over thefight to block the execution of Gary Gilmore.AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 11 (AP)The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals turned down today a request by Jerry Lane Jurek that his murder conviction be overturned and his execution delayed.

title: Israel Recalls Its Envoy
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 11Israel pecaled its ambassador from Paris tonight in an angry reaction to the French Government's release of Abu Daoud.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Threat Suspect Seized

title: Yeoman Gets New Pact
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 11 (UPI)The University of Houston's head football coach, Bill Yeoman, whose Cougars shared the Southwest Conference football title and beat Maryland in the Cotton Bowl in their first year in the league, was given a new fiveyear contract today by the school's Regents. Yeoman had five years remaining on his old contract. The new pact was made retroactive to Jan. 1 and increased his annual salary from $37,088 to $45,000.

title: Police Bar East Germans From West German Mission
description: EAST BERLIN, Jan. 11The East German police began today to bar citizens from entering the West German diplomatic mission here in an apparent effort to stop people from seeking advice on emigration.

title: Living Abroad: Vienna
description: AN EXTENDED folklore festival seems to be on right now in the placid, prosperous city of Vienna. It is an infatuation with loden and Alpine headgear that sprouts tufts of chamois hair or grouse feathers. And there 1s also a massive invasion of Russianstyle fur hats for men and women.

title: Daoud Arrives in Algiers
description: ALGIERS, Jan. 11 (Reuters)  Abu Daoud arrived here tonight after being released by French authorities earlier in the day, the Algerian Press Service reported.

title: International Paper Lists 36% Net Drop
description: Citing slower economic growth in the late 1976, the International Paper Company, the world's largest paper producer, reported yesterday a 36 percent decline in fourthquarter profits, despite higher sales. The sharply higher earnings of the three preceding quarters enabled International Paper to lift the 1976 net by 16.5 percent on record sales.

title: Fashion's Summer Frivolity
description: NEVER MIND the calendar. Summer has arrived on Seventh Avenue. In fashion, fall is the serious season, summer is the frivolous one, it's the time when people can get along with a minimum of clothes, when less is better than more. So the clothes themselves have to be infinitely appealing, to male women yearn for them. Designers have responded so far with infinite cheer and zest.

title: An Intact Union Ship Is Goal of Divers
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 11On Jan. 11, 1863, a notorious Confederate raider named the C.S.S. Alabama lured a Union blockade ship, the U.S.S. Hatteras, into open water 20 miles off Galveston and began pumping cannon shells into her fiveeighthsinchthick iron hull.

title: Suspect in Fire In Bronx Seized In Puerto Rico
description: The third suspect sought for complicity In setting the fire that killed 25 persons and injured 24 others last Oct. 24 in a Bronx social club was seized yesterday in Puerto Rico.

title: Child's World
description: ARACHMANINOFF piano concerto is playing in the background. The record's narrator, in the timeworn documentaryreader's tone, begins the story of the composer's life. He says that as a child Sergei once had a teacher who was so strange that, instead of having him stand in the corner when he was disobedient, she forced him to sit under the piano.

title: Trenton Strikes a Partisan Note As Feldman Heads Senate Again
description: TRENTON, JAN. 10The 198th annual session of the New Jersey Legislature opened today on a somber note of partisanship.

title: Rhodesian Civil War Is Reducing Tourism and Hurting the Economy
description: VICTORIA FALLS, Rhodesia, Jan. 11A group of tourists were peering through the mist at the cascade here the other day when two soldiers in camouflage fatigues burst upon them with tracker dogs, inquiring whether they had seen a black youth with manacles on his hands.

title: Olympic Games Captain Indicted
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 11 (AP)A Federal grand jury indicted the captain of the Olympic Games and a Panamanian shipping company today on charges stemming from the Dec. 27 spillage of 134,000 gallons of oil into the Delaware River. The defendants, Captain Vassilios Vlismas and the Red Bank Shipping Company of Panama, owner of the Liberianregistered vessel, were charged with violating an 1899 law that prohibits polluting navigable waters.

title: Giaimo Heads House Budget Unit
Looking for Love In a Laundry Room
description: IT IS NOT an easy matter to find a mate in the laundry room. Unless, of course, one happens to be a sock. Single people say relationships of a meaningful nature are much more likely to result from meetings in supermarkets than in laundry rooms.

title: Card of Chauks
description: HENKINAscher. Mrs. Tanya Henkin and family sincerely thank their friends and relatives for their kind expressions of sympathy In their recent bereavement.

title: Two Watergate Burglars Linked by a Hughes Aide To a Las Vegas Breakin
description: ELKO, Nev., Jan. 11 (UPI)Two of the Watergate burglers once approached officials of Howard Hughes's Summa Corporation about breaking into the safe of Hank Greenspun, publisher of the Las Vegas Sun, a Hughes official testified today.

title: And New Yorkers Thought It Was Cold?
GENESCO IS RULED LIABLE BY F.T.C. JUDGE ON CREDIT
description: An administrative law judge for the Federal Trade Commission ruled yesterday in Washington that four retail companies operated by Genesco Inc. had handled credit balances of charge accounts in an unfair and deceptive manner and must therefore inform their customers that they are entitled to $800,000 in refunds.

title: Suspect Is Accused of Murdering 4 Young Men in the Last 4 Years
description: A 31yearold unemployed man who came to New York City from Georgia six years ago and lives alone on the Upper West Side was charged yesterday with murdering four young men in the last four years.

title: Dirty Linen Sparkles In Wind of Laughter
description: DOES IT HURT to laugh? Well, sometimes it can particularly if you have broken ribs, an inflamed appendix or a monocle with a serrated edge. But normally laughter in the theater is a healthy exercise, and there is a lot of it to be exercised in Tom Stoppard's convoluted doublebill, Dirty Linen & NewFoundLand, which opened last night at the John Golden Theater. Mr. Stoppard is a very funny man.

title: Music: Exotica A La Mongolia
description: Lovers of aural exotica would do well to check out a new group called the Harmonics Choir, and they will have ample opportunities in coming weeks. The ensemble gave two performances Monday night at the Anthology Film Archives, and will appear next Tuesday and Wednesday at the Brook, 40 West 17th Street, and Feb. 13 at Franklin Furnace, 112 Franklin Street.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: SprucedUp Lagos Awaits Start Of Culture Festival on Saturday
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 11For the first time in years, the city of Lagos glitters, a Nigerian columnist wrote of preparations for the opening on Saturday of the World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture.

title: TIMES TO DEFEND POSITION AGAINST JUDGE'S ORDER
description: The New York Times said yesterday that it would take all appropriate legal steps to defend its position against the order of a Federal judge in Miami directing the publisher, an editor and a reporter for The Times to show cause why they should not be held in criminal contempt.

title: BELL DEFENDS ACTS AS GEORGIA ADVISER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Griffin B. Bell, whose nomination to he Attorney General is opposed by a number of civil rights groups but whose confirmation nonetheless seems assured, told the Senate Judiciary Committee today that his actions two decades ago as counsel to Gov. Ernest Vandiver of Georgia might have contributed to a delay of school desegregation, but did not defy the law.

title: RESULTS
description: (OTB Payoffs subjet to 5% State tax)

title: Byrd Transfers $160,000 Fund To Account in Trustees' Control
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 11Senator Robert C. Byrd of West Virginia, the Senate majority leader, who was unopposed in last fall's Democratic primary and general elections, said today that his campaign finance committee had placed $160,000 in surplus campaign funds in a trustee account over which he had no control.

title: HOW TO ASSIST THE FUND FOR THE NEEDIEST
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Career of a 29YearOld Is Beginning to Blossom
description: Doug Barrow has finally won the title that long eluded him.

title: Hearing on Oil Drilling
description: A United States Interior Department official, testifying in a suit seeking to block oil and natural gas drilling off the New Jersey coast, said that the Federal Government listened to state views when considering the environmental effects of offshore exploration. We cooperate with all of the states, James Batsley, assistant director for land resources of the Interior Department's United States Geologic Survey, told a hearing before Judge Jack B. Weinstein in Federal District Court in Brooklyn. Nassau and Suffolk Counties and environmental groups are seeking a permanent injunction to bar exploration in the Baltimore Canyon area off New Jersey until more comprehensive environmental

title: Kissinger Is Honored By U.S. Jewish Group
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger paid an emotional farewell to leaders of the American Jewish community yesterday at a luncheon given by the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations.

title: JOSEP PALLACH
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Jan. 11 (AP)Josep Pallach, secretary general of Catalonia's Socialist Party, died of a heart attack today, his family said. He was 57.

title: Oh, Those Grippes of Yesteryear! That Certain Soup... And Mom's T. L. C.
description: IN OUR family, every occasion, sad or happy, had its own special menu and illness was no exception. It would all begin when my mother declared me officially sicksick enough to stay home from school and, therefore, sick enough to stay in bed. Immediately the day took on a holiday air and I resigned myself to beddeddown luxury, helpless in the face of nature.

title: Some Serious Questions for Mr. Bell
description: We have had a difficult time in recent years choosing a good Attorney General, and the country has paid a price for the indulgence. For that reason, the Senate Judiciary Committee faces a special responsibility in weighing the qualifications of Griffin B. Bell to head the Department of Justice.

title: Kohout and Other Czechs Facing More Questions on Rights Petition
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 11Pavel Kohout, the Czech playwright, his wife and at least a dozen other intellectuals were interrogated again today by the political police and several were roughed up before being released for the night.

title: Job Statistics Revised
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics has found nearly half a million jobs through refinements in analyzing pay roll information from employers. Page D3.

title: CREDIT PRICES SHOW MODERATE DECLINE
description: The credit markets continued to gyrate yesterdayopening higher, falling sharply, recovering late in the day to end moderately lower than they closed on Monday. With this net decline, the credit markets have now dropped in six of the first seven trading days of 1977.

title: West Germany Deplores Decision
description: BONN, Jan. 11The West German Justice Ministry today officially deplored the French court's decision to free Abu Daoud.

title: FRENCH COURT FREES TERRORIST SUSPECT; HE FLIES TO ALGERIA
description: PARIS, Jan. 11After a swift and unexpected judicial hearing, French authorities today freed a prominent Palestinian militant who had been arrested by French intelligence agents on suspicion of having been responsible for the killing of members of the Israeli team at the 1972 Olympics in Munich.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: THE QUESTION IS, what makes a restaurant fashionable, a place where you go to see and be seen, as well as to eat? The answer is the other people who go there. They cannot be just any old people, however; they must be people with clat. Otherwise, they are only a crowd. As Yogi Berra once said about Mama Leone's, No one goes there anymore; it's too crowded. Mr. Berra meant that the place was full of the wrong people.

title: I.M.F. Makes First Vietnam Loan; U.S. Raises No Bar to $35 Million
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The International Monetary Fund announced today that it had made its first loan to Vietnam, apparently with the consent of the United States, which has twice vetoed admission of the country to the United Nations.

title: Change of Venue or Delay Is Denied in Hearing on Alleged Soviet Spy
description: NEWARK, Jan. 11A Federal grand jury opened an investigation here today into espionage charges against Ivan N. Rogalsky, a Soviet citizen who has lived in this country since 1971, after a United States District Court judge denied the defense lawyer's motion for a long delay or a change of venue.

title: Mrs. Moser Is Victor in Skiing; Cindy Nelson Breaks an Ankle
description: GARMISCHPARTENKIRCHEN, West Germany, Jan. 11 (AP)Annemarie ProellMoser scored her'third downhill skirace victory of the season today, increasing her World Cup lead. Cindy Nelson, the United States star, was knocked out of competition when she fell and broke her left ankle.

title: TV: Civil War Spies, Loves and Schemes
description: BEFORE IT WAS REVIVED last year by the Phoenix Theater, William Gillette's Secret Service hadn't had a Broadway production since 1915. Judging from tonight's television adaptation of the Phoenix version on public television's Theater in America series, at 9 o'clock, another 60 years might pass safely without urgent demand for a second revival. The historical spy drama is an embarrassing reminder of how impossibly silly and melodramatic much of American theater was before Eugene O'Neill.

title: Msgr. Thomas K. Fenarty, 94, Oldest Priest in Brooklyn Diocese
description: Msgr. Thomas K. Fenarty, the oldest priest in the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, died Sunday at the Cannel Nursing Home on Staten Island after long illness. He was 94 years old.

title: About Education
description: Two federally sponsored studies have raised serious doubts about the value of one of the most highly regarded educational innovations of the last 10 yearsthe individualized curriculum.

title: Wine Talk
description: SOMETIMES it seems as if people are more interested in storing wine than in buying or drinking it. More mail to this column is concerned with the problems of apartment closets than with the relative merits of different wines.

title: School Ousts Scarsdale Club
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Jan. 11The Town Club of Scarsdale, an allmale civic organization that has been fighting a legal action by women seeking admission, now faces exclusion from its meetin place in the village's junior high school.

title: 200 Upstate Volunteers Flailed for Fire Role
description: PHILMONT, N.Y., Jan. 11The fire that last night destroyed a factory almost an acre square, plus a block of buildings in this tiny village, produced one consensus among the 1,700 residentsvolunteer firemen are wonderful.

title: Carey Is Expected to Seek Restructuring of M.T.A.
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11Governor Carey will probably seek a new structure for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, dividing the policymaking and the operational responsibilities of the $80,000ayear chairman's job and giving the top policymaking spot to Harold L. Fisher, one of his closest political advisers.

title: ANDY WILLIAMS DENIES REMARKS ABOUT EXWIFE
description: ASPEN. Colo., Jan. 11Andy Williams was called to the witness stand by the prosecution today in the trial of his former wife, Claudine Longet, on a charge of reckless manslaughter, but denied that he had told people she was a crazy gal who liked to take chances.

title: Brazil's Coffee Exporters Pressed to Keep Price High
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 7Coffee exporters here are under intense pressure from the Brazilian Government to maintain high prices in order to earn sorely needed foreign exchange and help offset the country's balanceofpayments deficit.

title: A Banker and 3 Accountants Lent To New York to Aid on Fiscal Plans
description: A vice president of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company and three certified public accountants from three wellknown accounting firms will join the staff of the city's Deputy Mayor for Finance for 15 months at no cost to the city.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Zenith Radio Corporation called yesterday for temporary television import quotas to offset alleged unfair competition from Japanese manufacturers. This represented an aboutface from the company's previous stand.

title: WATER SUPPLY IN U.S. DIPS TO NEAR NORMAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)The nation's water supply dropped to near normal last year after three of the wettest years on record, the United States Geological Survey says.

title: Dempsey Lends His Weight by Conducting Draw for Women's Squash Racquets Event
description: Jack Dempsey was late yesterday for the draw of the first women's professional squash racquets tournament in North America, but Heather McKay was glad the snow stopped at 10 inches in Toronto anyway.

title: Anxiety Pervades East Germany as Regime Tightens Grip
description: EAST BERLIN  The East German writer's wife looked out of her doorway and gazed at the green police truck parked in the snow. A cold rain began to fall. It's going to be a terrible winter, she said.

title: Notes on People
description: TO OBSERVE the 220th birthday yesterday of Alexander Hamilton, officials at Hamilton College, named after the Federalist leader, decided to do some belated turning of the other cheek.

title: Careers
description: At a time when public utility companies are having plenty of consumer as well as other problems, they may find themselves compelled to increase their executive payrolls.

title: Mistrial in Hackensack
description: A judge in Hackensack declared mistrial in Mayor Michael D'Arminio's trial on charges that he and two other officials had obtained city funds through a double billing scheme. The judge, Thomas L. Franklin, also retracted his order that the three defendants be tried separately.

title: Article 1  No Title
An Intact Union Ship Is Goal of Divers
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 11On Jan. 11, 1863, a notorious Confederate raider named the C.S.S. Alabama lured a Union blockade ship, the U.S,S. Hatteras, into open water 20 miles off Galveston and began pumping cannon shells into her fiveeighthsinchthick iron hull

title: Bishop Is Continuing to Surprise Catholics in the Memphis Diocese
description: MEMPHIS, Jan. 11 (AP)When the Diocese of Memphis welcomed the Most Rev. Carroll Dozier as its first bishop six years ago, Roman Catholics could not have realized where the rotund man from Virginia would lead them.

title: KEENAN WILL APPEAL IN CUNNINGHAM CASE
description: The special state prosecutor, John F. Keenan, announced yesterday that he would appeal a decision to dismiss a set of major indictments against Patrick Cunningham, the Bronx County Democratic chairman.

title: Letters
description: Stuffing the Fowl

title: Chris Evert Advances
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Jan. 11 (AP)Topseeded Chris Evert of Fort Lauderdale. Fla., took less than 45 minutes today to defeat Julie Anthony of Santa Monica, Calif., 61, 60, in the $100,000 Virginia Slims circuit tournament.

title: Renewal of Rhodesia Talks Delayed
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania Jan. 11 (Reuters)Ivor Richard of Britain said today that the adjourned Geneva conference on Rhodesia would not be able to resume on schedule next Monday.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Q&A
description: Q. Recently I found an ancient bot tle of imported wine vinegar in my grandmother's kitchen cabinet with a large fungus[much like a jellyfish] floating around in it. She was glad to let me have it.

title: S. K. Holcomb, Football Coach, ExWhite Sox Aide, Is Dead
description: SARASOTA, Fla., aJn. 11 (AP)Stuart K. Holcomb, longtime college football coach and former general manager of the Chicago White Sox, died today at the age of 66.

title: White Plains Aids Housing for Aged
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 11The Common Council moved last night to use greater Federal subsidies to help fill a modern apartment house intended as the residential core of a thriving downtown development area.

title: 200 Upstate Volunteers Hailed for Fire Role
description: PHILMONT, N.Y., Jan. 11The fire that last night destroyed a factory almost an acre square, plus a block of buildings in this tiny village, produced one consensus among the 1,700 residentsvolunteer firemen are wonderful.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: SINCE coming to this country in 1939 to work as a chef at the French Pavilion restaurant of the New York World's Fair, I have detected a certain snobbery in the public's mind when it comes to what are called peasant dishes, on which I thrived as a child and which I still enjoy in maturity.

title: Concert: Music Lesson
description: Music needs organizations like the New York Cornet and Sacbut Ensemble in order to show what wind groups sounded like in the past. Like other earlymusic performers, these players are invaluable for educational purposes. On Monday night, the ensemble gave a concert in Carnegie Recital Hall and fulfilled its didactic role in illustrating Brass Music of 17thCentury Germany. To one listener, however, the program seemed terribly thin in substance.

title: Iran Reports Exports Of Oil Decline 34.7%
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan, 11 (Reuters)Iran's daily oil exports have dropped by 2 million barrels compared with the same period in December, the stateowned National Iranian Oil Company said today.

title: TELEVISION TODAY
description: Morning

title: The New York Times
description: VOL. CXXVI...No. 4.,453

title: Arts in America: Denver
description: Culturally, Colorado cannot be called a desert, but neither is it a great oasis. Rather, the most charitable phrase to describe the arts scene there would be the same one that is used to describe the topography: semiarid.

title: Indications Are That Albany Legislature Will Approve June Primary
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11The Legislature today began its annual battle over the date for primary elections in the state, with strong indications that a primary in June would eventually be agreed upon.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE PREMISE underlying John L. and Karen Hess's The Taste of America can be summed up simply. Good food is food as nature Intended it to be, cooked so as to enhance its natural taste. Therefore, the Hesses argue from this premise he as a reporter for The New York TiMes who once briefly and with fear forhis tastebuds was restaurant critic for, this paper; she as a culinary historian who has dedicated her life and sacred honor to the art of good cooking: Anything that militates against nature is to be roundly deplored. This means, obviously enough, that the Hesses do a lot of deploring.

title: Spur to Energy Sources Asked; Research Unit Assails U.S. Policy
description: A highlevel task force sponsored by the Twentieth Century Fund recommended yesterday that the United States spur development of domestic energy sources by providing new price incentives for oil and gas, by encouraging nuclear and coal use and by a big Governmentsponsored program of research and development.

title: FashionTextiles Center Is Leased
description: A permanent exhibition center for the fashion and textile industry has been leased for 10 years at 1 Penn Plaza, one block north of Madison Square Garden and on the fringe of the Seventh Aevnue garment center.

title: Ford Mood, 9 Days to Go: Regret and Relief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The gaunt, ravaged look was gone, and in its place was a grin as familiar and bright as the sunlight that glistened on icecloaked snow beyond the Oval office window. President Ford seemed at peace with his fate.

title: Jersey Senate Votes to Restore Death Penalty
description: TRENTON, Jan. 11The State Senate tonight approved a measure restoring the death penalty in New Jersey.

title: Ralston in Club Post
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan. 11 (AP) Dennis Ralston, 34yearold former star player and captain of five Davis Cup teams, was named today director of tennis at the Mission Hills Country Club in nearby Rancho Mirage.

title: COURT BACKS ZONING THAT IN EFFECT BARS LOWINCOME BUCKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The Supreme Court ruled 5 to 3 today that it was not inherently unconstitutional for a suburb to refuse to change zoning restrictions whose practical effect is to block construction of racially integrated housing for persons with low and moderate income.

title: News Summary
description: Abu Daoud, the Palestinian militant arrested in Paris on suspicion of responsibility for the 1972 killings in Munich of members of the Israeli Olympic team, was released after swift judicial hearing and flew to Algeria. The court rejected requests from Israel and West Germany that he be detained pending formal extradition proceedings. It apparently accepted his lawyers argument that Israel had no right to file such a request and that the West German request had not been properly formulated. Within hours Israel recalled its ambassador from Paris and the West German Government officially deplored the court's decision. [Page Al, Column 1.]

title: Taylor in Semifinals
description: ANTIGUA, West Indies, Jan. 11  Roger Taylor, the British lefthander, led the way into the semifinals of the annual Antigua international tennis her total to 142 for a commanding 32tournament today with a 63, 76 victory over Jim Parker of the United States. Ove Bengtson of Sweden, Dale Power of Canada and Larry Parker of the United States also won.

title: FRENCH COURT FREES TERRORIST SUSPECT; HE FLIES TO ALGERIA
description: PARIS, Jan. 11After a swift and unexpected judicial hearing, French authorities today freed a prominent Palestinian militant who had been arrested by French intelligence agents on suspicion of having been responsible for the killing of members of the Israeli team at the 1972 Olympics in Munich.

title: ... So, By Popular Demand
description: 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. 2. Combine  cup sugar and the water in a small heavy saucepan and cook without stirring until the syrup turns amber brown. Do not overcook or it will become bitter.

title: S.E.C. STAFF IS SAID TO BACK AUTHORIZING OF TRADING IN PUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The Securities and Exchange Commission will receive next week a staff recommendation that trading in putsoptions to sell stocks at specified future pricesbe authorized, a wellplaced agency source disclosed today.

title: People in Sports
description: A total of five players from the New York Islanders and Rangers have been voted to the first and second teams of the National Hockey League's Campbell Conference allstar squad by hockey writers. They include Don Murdoch, first rookie in the Rangers 51year history to be chosen for an allstar berth. The 20yearold Murdoch, who has already tied the Rangers club record for goals by a rookie in one season, was voted to the second team as right wing.

title: Vance Says U.S. Erred in Joining War in Vietnam
NET OF MELLON NATIONAL ROSE 40% IN 4TH QUARTER
description: The Mellon National Corporation, the Pittsburgh Bank holding company and parent of the Mellon Bank N.A., announced yesterday that fourthquarter earnings, last year rose some 40 percent to $17.6 million before allowance for gains and losses on security transactions, compared with earnings of $12.5 million in the final quarter of 1975.

title: Greenwich Vote Fails to Bar Funds For Controversial School Project
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 11A grant of $4.1 million to remodel this town's old and vacant high school and turn it into a new town hall has been approved by the United States Department of Commerce.

title: BROWN WOULD TRIM DEFENSE COSTS IN 79
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  Harold Brown, the designated Secretary of Defense, said today that he believed United States military spending could be safely reduced by from $5 billion to $7 billion annually through savings and management, but not until the fiscal year 1979.

title: Bruins Withstand Rally, Remain Undefeated Against the Capitals
Tony Perkins and Fairily: A Study in Informal Togetherness
description: THE BABY, whose name is Elvis, wore only a Tshirt with the names of Yves Saint Laurent, Calvin Klein and Bill Blass printed on the front. He may have started out the day in diapers, but they were long gone and not missed as he sat at tlae breakfast table splashing his spoon in the oatmeal. Similarly casual in his attire and blissfully free of underwear, Osgood, soon to be 3, circled the breakfast table in a blue taffeta Batman cape, making Batmobile noises. The children's mother, balancing the telephone between her shoulder and her ear and speaking perfect French, was counting out vitamin pills and sprinkling unrefined sugar in the direction of the cereal bowl.

title: Mother's Eggnog
description: 2 egg yolks

title: Excerpts From Henry Ford Letter
description: In reflecting on my recent participation as a trustee, however, I realize that I have not been approaching the task with quite the same enthusiasm as I once did. My interest in many of the things the foundation is doing has waned considerably. I find it increasingly difficult to make a substantive contribution either to the policysetting process or to the deliberations that result in giving directional thrust to the organization.

title: The U. N. Today
SUFFOLK DEMOCRATS SUPPORT DILWORTH
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Jan. 10The Democratic majority of Suffolk County's Legislature has picked Donald Dilworth, Democrat, to replace Eugene R. Kelly, a Republican, as Suffolk County Police Commissioner.

title: All a Matter of Timing
description: VALLETTA, MaltaPrime Minister Dom Mintoff's idea of extruding both the Soviet and United States fleets from the Mediterranean and forming a EurAfrican neutral or nonaligned bloc is abhorrent to NATO and its supporters, including the U.S.A., but one must understand how it developed in Malta's mind.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday. Prime rate 66.

title: Camera Eye on the Depression
description: By any measure, this is an extraordinary book, one of the few beneficent fruits of the Depression and one of the few collections of photographs to limn both the starkness of American life in those years and the indomitable strength of those who endured them. The photographs  there were some 270,000 in allwere taken under the auspices of the historical section of the Farm Security Administration by men and women whose stature as camera artists has since been attested. At the time, though, they were jobless photographers.

title: Arlington Heights Officials Hope StigmaWill Be Erased
N.C.A.A. Retains Full Athletic Scholarships
Bridge:
description: The first major tournament of 1977 for players in the New York area will be bigger than usual this year.

title: F.C.C. Chief Wants Study to See if Networks Curb Competition
description: Richard E. Wiley, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, said that he would propose an inquiry into, television network practices in response to petitions from the Justice Department, the Westinghouse Broadcasting Company and others alleging that the networks dominate the television industry.

title: Celtics 105, Rockets 101
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 11 (AP)Charlie Scott scored 7 of his 26 points in the last 1 minute 32 seconds to lead the Boston Celtics to a 105101 victory over the Houston Rockets at the Hartford Civic Center tonight.

title: HILDA BURSTEIN HOFFMAN
description: Hilda Burstein Hoffman, a dietician and the wife of Rabbi Isidor B. Hoffman, retired counselor to Jewish students at Columbia University, died Monday at Danbury (Conn.) Hospital after a long illness. She was 79 years old and lived at 420 Riverside Drive.

title: Drop in International Paper Profit Fosters 10.22 Dow Loss to 976.65
description: A selling wave touched off by sharply lower earnings for the International Paper Company clipped more than 10 points from the Dow Jones industrial yesterday as the stock mmarket resumed its 1977 retreat after three sessions of token gains.

title: COURT BACKS ZONING THAT IN EFFECT BARS LOWINCOME BLACKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The Supreme Court ruled 5 to 3 today that it was not inherently unconstitutional for a suburb to refuse to change zoning restrictions whose practical effect is to block construction of racially integrated housing for persons with low and moderate income.

title: Retying Those Old Apron Strings
description: With so many people doing their own cooking and entertaining these days, the apron, once worn only by servants, artisans and tradesmen, has become fashionable accessory. The most popular ones are adapted from the old styles, though new fabrics and bright colors often give them a fresh, contemporary look.

title: I.M.F. Seeks China Gold Plan
Knicks Routed By Blazers, 131111
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 11The Portland Trail Blazers ran their homecourt wonlost record to 231 tonight by blasting the New York Knicks, 131111, before a crowd of 12,360, their 12th capacity crowd of the season.

title: Personal Finance: One's Own Boss
description: THE IDEA of being one's own boss is as American as apple pie. In St. Paul, Minn., Michael Putnam, a paramedic, is dreaming of setting up his own emergency ambulance service. In New York, Grant Morris, a computer specialist, recently quit a highpaying job with a big insurance agency to hang out his shingle as a pension fund consultant.

title: Solicitor GeneralDesignate
Cash Prices
description: Tuesday, Jan. 11, 1977

title: Technology
description: As the search for oil and gas pushes further into continental rock formations and into deeper waters offshore, petroleum engineers struggle with increasing intensity against added drilling costs.

title: About Real Estate
description: CARLE PLACE, L. I.  People call it the Diamond property because the Diamond International Corporation had a printing plant there for many years. The plant closed about five years ago. Diamond had the property on the market far more than $3 million.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Leslie H. Gelb of Times Named To State Department Position
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Secretary of Statedesignate Cyrus R. Vance has chosen Leslie H. Gelb, a diplomatic correspondent for The New York Times, to serve as director of the State Department's Bureau of PoliticoMilitary Affairs.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The gaunt, ravaged look was gone, and in its place was a grin as familiar and bright as the sunlight that glistened on icecloaked snow beyond the Oval office window. President Ford seemed at peace with his fate.

title: The Chinese Fortune Cookie Secret: It's Japanese
description: One's future, the ancients have written, passes before the eyes in an instant with the crumbling of a fortune cookie.

title: Ice Halts Ferry Runs
description: The Cape MayLewes, Del., ferry was shut down because of heavy ice in the lower Delaware Bay. The Delaware River and Bay Authority, which operates the ferry, said it was likely the ferry would not run at least until tomorrow. The ferry normally makes four crossings a day from New Jersey and four from Delaware.

title: The Genie and the Germans
description: We are not doing very well, as a world, in the effort to force the nuclear genie back into the bottle. But some progress has been made, in Paris. The next problem lies in Bonn.

title: BELL DEFENDS ACTS AS GEORGIA ADVISER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Griffin B. Bell, whose nomination to be Attorney General is opposed by a number of civil rights groups but whose confirmation nonetheless seems assured, told the Senate Judiciary Committee today that. his .actions two decades ago as counsel to Gov. Ernest Vandiver of Georgia might have contributed to a delay of school desegregation, but did not defy the law.

title: JURY SAID TO CHARGE TROY WITH LARCENY
description: A sealed indictment was handed up in Queens yesterday against Matthew J. Troy Jr., reportedly accusing the Queens City Councilman of grand larceny and perjury.

title: Ford to Ask Carter to Take Very Hard Look Before Making Any Significant Defense Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  President Ford will use his final State of the Union Message tomorrow as a vehicle to urge Presidentelect Carter to take a very hard look at the cold facts before making significant reductions in the defense budget, the departing President said today.

title: No Turnpike Extension
description: The State Transportation Department has rejected a proposal that it build a 35mile extension of the New Jersey Turnpike from East Brunswick to Toms River, according to the chairman of the Turnpike Authority, Francis G. Fitzpatrick. He said he had been told in a letter by Transportation Commissioner Alan Sagner that there was no hope the state would build the proposed Gov. Alfred P. Driscoll Expressway. Mr. Sagner said it was unlikely that Congress would consider adding any new major projects to the interstate highway system, which now is more than 95 percent complete.

title: CARTER'S EARLY PACE WILL BE MODERATE
Ford Calls on Congress to Create CabinetLevel Energy Department
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  President Ford recommended to Congress today the creation of a unified, Cabinetlevel department of energy that would take over the Federal Power Commission's authority to regulate natural gas prices but leave in the Interior Department custody over the use of public lands.

title: School Board Holds Hearing on a Budget That Has No Chance
description: About 50 people gathered in the Hall of the Board of Education in Brooklyn yesterday for a hearing lasting nearly three hours on a 197778 budget request that everyone present knew would not be approved by the city.

title: State Senate Approves Restoration of Death Penalty
description: TRENTON, Jan. 11  After an emotional twohour debate, the State Senate approved tonight a measure restoring the death penalty for firstdegree murder by a vote of 21 to 14, the minimum total needed for passage.

title: Stall Helps Penn Beat Princeton
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 11Pennsylvania took the lead in the Ivy League basketball race tonight with a painfully patient 4339 victory over Princeton at the Palestra.

title: Orkneys Depot for North Sea Oil Inaugurated by Hammer and Benn
description: FLOTTA, Orkney Islands, Scotland, Jan. 11The millionaire oilman and the leftwing energy minister took the oilman's private jet to this placid little island north of the, Scottish mainland today to rejoice in North Sea oil.

title: Nation's Businesses Plan 11.3% Increase On Spending in 77
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (Reuters)American businesses plan to increase their spending for new plants and equipment this year by about 11.3 percent, the Commerce Department said today.

title: The French Abjection
description: Three things stand out from the fog of extradition legalisms swirling in Paris concerning Abu Daoud, a Palestinian accused of planning the terror killings of Israeli athletes at the Olympic Games in Munich in September 1972.

title: It Took Some StringPulling to Bake That Feiner Heidelbeerkuchen
description: The thought isn't all that original that each of us is a puppet in one sense or another. What is original is that Nancy Cameron Watson has become paradoxically a highly professional baker and is a potential cookbook author because of her interest in marionettes.

title: How They Voted
description: TRENTON, Jan. 11 (AP)Here how the State Senate voted today on a bill to restore the death penalty in New Jersey.

title: Buckner, 2 Others Sent to Chicago
description: Baseball's bull market roared again yesterday when the Los Angeles Dodgers sent Bill Buckner to the Chicago Cubs for Rick Monday in a fiveman trade.

title: Donors to Neediest Cite Gratitude
description: The theme of gratitude is expressed in many of the letters that are sent with gifts to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, which is now holding its 65th annual appeal.

title: Panel Approves Bergland
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)The Senate Agriculture Committee today unanimously approved Presidentelect Carter's selection of Representative Bob Bergland of Minnesota to be Secretary of Agriculture.

title: I.M.F. Makes First Vietnam Loan; U.S. Raises No Bar to $35 Million
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The International Monetary Fund announced today that it had made its first loan to Vietnam, apparently with the consent of the United States, which has twice vetoed admission of the country to the United Nations.

title: Vernon Jordan Won't Oppose Bell
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP) Vernon Jordan, executive director of the National Urban League, said today that while Griffin B. Bell was not his choice for Attorney General in the Carter administration, he did not oppose Mr. Bell's nomination.

title: Newspaper Leaders Among 200 Who Flee Fire in California Hotel
description: PALM SPRINGS. Calif., Jan. 11 (AP)About 200 guests fled a fire in the Canyon Hotel before dawn today, firemen said.

title: That Primrose Path to Disaster
description: Red Smith

title: Grand Zenith Crew Lost
description: BOSTON, Jan. 11There were no survivors from the Panamanianflag tanker Grand Zenith, the Coast Guard said today, at the conclusion of an eightday search. The tanker, which had 38 Taiwaneie crew members aboard and a cargo of eight million gallons of :heavy fuel oil, sank in the Atlantic Ocean off Cape Cod more than a week ago. Capt. ,Bernard A. Hoyland said that the gale winds and rough seas brought the chance of survivors to zero.

title: Williams Sponsors $11.4 Billion Bill To Improve Transit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, will introduce legislation tomorrow to provide $11.4 billion additional for mass transportation over the next five years, including an increase in operating subsidies for such cities as New York.

title: KEENAN WILL APPEAL IN CUNNINGHAM CASE
description: The special state prosecutor, John F. Keenan, announced yesterday that he would appeal a decision to dismiss a set of major indictments against Patrick Cunningham, the Bronx County Democratic chairman.

title: William F. Paul, 66, Dies on Coast; Had a Heart Transplant in 1969
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 11 (UPI)William E. Paul, a heart transplant recipient more than seven years ago, died of pneumonia yesterday. He was 66 years old.

title: Former U.S. Ambassador to Chile Charges Officials Lied on U.S. Role
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Edward M. Korry, former United States Ambassador to Chile, charged before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today that high officials of three administrations and the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation had lied to Senate committees about American intervention in Chile.

title: Too Much Is Plenty At Ginsburg Concert
description: WHAT DO YOU DO if you are a young man who has composed 47 songs to a variety of texts, generally unrelated, and want to present all of them at one concert? Gerald Ginsburg's solution to that problem, disclosed at Alice Tully Hall on Monday night, was to hitch them together tenuously under such categorical titles as Dying! Flying!, Ailing! Sailing! and Sowing! Flowing! and then attempt to suggest that the results were a song cycle. In what was intended as a unifying gesture, snippets of vapid poetry by Lawrence Ferlinghetti were inserted here and there (narrated by Mary Lou Falcone).

title: Princeton Fees May Rise To $6,695, a Record
description: The advisory committee formulating Princeton University's budget yesterday proposed a $420 increase in tuition, room and board for the coming academic year. If approved, the increase would put the total cost of attending Princeton at $6,695 a year, a record.

title: ROGER S. HAMILTON
description: WOONSOCKET, R.I., Jan. 11 (AP)Roger S. Hamilton, former dean of the college of business administration at Northeastern nUiversity, Boston, died here today. He was 72 years old.

title: E.P.A. Chief Seeks to Bar Spills by Foreign Tankers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Russell E. Train, the environmental protection chief of the Ford Administration, told Congress today that it was time for the United States, acting alone, to take a more aggressive approach to protect American shores from oil pollution by foreignflag tankers.

title: Technology
description: How prospectors for oil and gas are striving to hold down the cost of drilling on land and offshore. Page D5.

title: Cocoa Futures Move Up 4c a Pound Daily Limit; Coffee Continues to Rise
description: Cocoa futures jumped yesterday on the New York Cocoa Exchange as they have so often in recent months. The March contract closed at $1.56 74/100, up the 4 cents a pound daily limit.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT HARTFORD

title: DONATIONS ARE URGED BY INAUGURAL PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11More than 200 corporation executives and officials of labor unions and trade associations were asked today to contribute a total of $350,000 by the end of this week to help pay for Presidentelect Carter's inaugural celebration.

title: People and Business
description: Presidentelect Carter's nominee to the position of Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, Richard Cooper, wound up a threeday meeting in Tokyo yesterday with the declaration that Japan's large trade surplus against other nations was a burden on the world economy.

title: CALLAWAY INVESTIGATION ENDED BY JUSTICE AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 11 (UPI)The Justice Department announced today that it had dropped its criminal investigation of conflictofinterest charges against former Army Secretary Howard H. Callaway, who had also been President Ford's campaign manager.

title: Personal Health
description: THE EXPLOSION of information about sexuality in the 1970's has prompted many women to question the adequacy of their sexual responses. many women for whom sex has long been an unpleasant or unsatisfying event have come to realize that they are not aloneand also that they need not be doomed to a lifetime devoid of sexual enjoyment or fulfillment.

title: World News Briefs
description: PEKING, Jan. 11 (Reuters)New wall posters appeared in Peking streets today demanding the rehabilitation of former Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping, some containing calls that he be named prime minister.

title: U.S. Expresses Its Dismay
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (Reuters)The United States expressed dismay today at the release by France of Abu Daoud.

title: Best Buys
description: AFTER the exuberance of Christmas, one way to make dreary. January go faster until we can get into lively little February (Lincoln's Birthday, Valentine's Day, Washington's Birthday), is to think about the pleasures of eating and plan good hearty meals. And with the prices of most things in life being what they are today, it's nice to know that even in benighted January there are some pretty worthwhile bargains in food.

title: Payless but Committed, Track Coach Stays On
description: It would have beeen easy for Leonard Braxton to walk away, to call it quits. He owed nothing to the college, he was unemployed, and his wife had just given birth to a son.

title: Cuba Said to Have Used Old, Overloaded Aircraft To Get Troops to Angola
description: HAVANA. Jan. 11 (Reuters)Cuba managed to get troops to Angola to fight in the war there by overloading aircraft and pressing small cargo ships into .service, according to a report published yesterday by the Cuban news agency Prensa Latina.

title: The Nicest Place to fee a Movie?
description: It may be the first movie theater in New York City with a street entrance graced by ornate, turnofthecentury bronze railings and a crested castiron canopy, but that isn't the only feature that promises to make Cinema III an unusually luxurious place to see films. The new theater, due to open Jan. 24 with Alain Resnais's Providence, is dedicated to the proposition that filmgoers need not suffer for their art.

title: GEORGE WHITE
description: DALLAS, Jan, 11 (AP)George White, former sportswriter, editor and broad caster, died today. His age was 74. Mr. White retired as executive director of the National Skeet Shooting Association in 1969 after 20 years in the post. He had been sports editor of The Dallas Dispatch and The Dallas Morning News.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 12, 1977

title: O'Malley Upholds Kuhn's Power
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 11  Twentyfour hours before Bowie Kuhn was scheduled to make his longawaited appearance on the witness stand, Walter O'Malley disclosed to a United States District Court judge and the rest of the world today that Kuhn and not he was the commissioner of baseball.

title: FOUR CHARGED WITH FRAUD IN S.B.A. LOANS BY BANKS
description: Two former New York bank officials, a business consultant and an accountant have been charged in Manhattan with conducting a bankfraud scheme to arrange $2.3 million in loans for small businesses in return for more than $200,000 in kickbacks.

title: Henry Ford 2d Quits Foundation, Urges Appreciation for Capitalism
description: Henry Ford 2d resigned as a trustee of the Ford Foundation yesterday, complaining that the philanthropic agency was spreading itself too thin, was cultivating a fortress mentality and had staff that often failed to appreciate the capitalist system that provided the money the foundation gave away.

title: Arco Acquires Anaconda After Court Refuses to Bar Tie
description: The Anaconda Company became wholly owned subsidiary of the Atlantic Richfield Company yesterday.

title: Union Requirement For Seeking Office Declared Unlawful
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Supreme Court ruled today, 6 to 3, that a union may not require a candidate for a union office to have attended as many as half of all regular union meetings for the three years before the election in order to be eligible for office.

title: Coretta King Uneasy Over the Selections for Carter Cabinet
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 12  Coretta Scott King, one of the nation's most influential black leaders, says she is not comfortable with the incoming Carter Administration, primarily as a result of the Presidentelect's Cabinet appointments.

title: Cowens Returning to the Celtics Today; Plans to Play Against Blazers Tomorrow
description: His motivation to play basketball restored as mysteriously as it had dissipated, Dave Cowens announced in Boston yesterday that he would return immediately to action with the Celtics.

title: Dave Anderson
description: BEAUMONT, Calif., Jan. 11In the Rusty Lantern restaurant, Duane Bobick had put away a dinner of shrimp cocktail, tomato rice soup, salad, grilled slices of abalone piled like pancakes, green beans, vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce and several glasses of 7Up.

title: James Napoli Sr. Held on Gambling Count
description: James V. Napoli Sr., reputed to be a major figure in organized crime and the head of one of the largest policy operations in the country, was taken into custody yesterday and charged with conspiracy and promoting gambling.

title: DISCIPLINING SOUGHT FOR ALLEGED C.I.A. AID
description: Brooklyn College's political science department charged yesterday that a colleague had violated academic standards and would warrant removal because he had allegedly agreed to covert intelligencegathering activity for the Central Intelligence Agency  a charge the professor, Michael Selzer, denied when reached later in Israel.

title: DECEMBER RISE 0.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Wholesale Price Index, pushed up by a jump in volatile farm prices, rose by ninetenths of 1 percent in December, the Labor Department reported today.

title: A Fiscal Replay of 1975
description: The latest developments in New York City's fiscal odyssey have introduced an unexpected replay of the days of 1975. Once more, Mayor Hearne and City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin find themselves thrust into a potential standoff with the city's leading banks. Once more, the banks are laying down what appear to be conditions for their help in borrowing money for municipal needs. Once more, the city is resisting at least some of the demands because of fears of an unwarranted intrusion by outsiders into its fiscal affairs.

title: Extension on Force Asked
description: CAIRO, Jan. 12 (UPI)The Lebanese Government has asked the Arab League to extend the term of the League's peacekeeping force in Lebanon for another six months, officials said today.

title: Detroit 92, Iona 67
description: DETROIT, Jan. 12 (AP)With John Long and Terry Tyler scoring more than half their team's points, Detroit crushed Iona College, 9267 tonight. It was the Titans 10th consecutive victory.

title: Troy Is Indicted By Queens Jury In Larceny Case
description: City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. was indicted yesterday in Queens on four; counts of grand larceny and two counts of perfury. all felonies.

title: A.T.&T. to Install Link in Chicago To Test Communication by Laser
description: The first commercial telephone link to use the new technology of transmitting calls, television pictures and computer data on beams of laser light that travel through hairthin glass fibers is to be installed soon in downtown Chicago.

title: 11 Killed in Honduras Bus Crash
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Jan 12 (Reuters)Eleven persons were killed and 32 injured when an intercity bus and a truck collided yesterday in southern Honduras, police officials said today.

title: Bridge:
description: A wellknown New York veteran who was even better known pseudonymously died in New York last week at the age of 75.

title: Israelis Protest at French Embassy
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 12Hundreds of angry demonstrators, including widows and children of Israeli athletes killed in an Arab terrorist attack at the Munich Olympics, chanted in derision outside the French Embassy here today.

title: Taft Descendant Picked
description: One of the players drafted was John Taft, a greatgrandson of President William Howard Taft. The captain at Yale this season, Taft was picked by the Connecticut Bicentennials. . . . The American Soccer League will also hold a draft, involving many of the same players, at a date to be announced. . . . Of the 72 players drafted, 12 are from Missouri.

title: Regina Sacki Is Victor In French Giant Slalom
description: LES DEUX ALPES, France, Jan. 12 (UPI)Regina Sackl of Austria won giant slalom race counting toward the women's European Alpine Cup today, beating her closest rival, Patricia Emonet of France. half a second.

title: Advertising
description: As chairman of the American Association of Advertising Agencies since last spring, Richard C. Christian, chairman also of Marsteller Inc., has been in an excellent position to see the big picture.

title: Committee Head in Delicate Spot
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The new chairman of the House Budget Committee once spent a summer vacation working as a teller in his father's bank in New Haven. Conn.. and for the last 13 years has been a member of the Appropriations Committee that decides how much Federal money will be spent where.
