But for Robert Nicholas Giaimo. a 57yearold Connecticut Democrat, his election yesterday by the House Democratic Caucus to be the new chairman of the Budget Committee will thrust him into a major role in working with the Carter administration and with the other Congressional committees in setting the Government's spending priorities.

title: A Lady in Red Puts Capraro Fans In a Summer Mood
description: The mannequin in red jerseyhalter straps above the waist, bloused pants belowstrolled across the stage. Short harem pants, scribbled the store buyers and reporters. Bloomers, announced members of the tele,vision crew filming Albert Capraro's summer fashion show at the Fashion Institute of Technology. Whatever you call it, the lady in the red outfit was one of the showstoppers in a pre

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: OPEN BOOKS There is always some general curiosity about the annual awardceremony receptions of such groups as the New York film and stage reviewers, with the public reading about but seldom attending these invitational events.

title: Atlanta Posts 4 Goals in First Period
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 12The New York Rangers will never catch the Atlanta Flames in their current battle for third place and a playoff berth if they can't put together a tight game from first shift to last against this hardworking club. Tonight they lost, 61, before 11,241 fans in the Omni after allowing the Flames to leap to a fourgoal lead in the opening period.

title: JOBLESS RATE AT 7.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The number of persons with jobs rose appreciably in December for the second consecutive month and the national unemployment rate eased to 7.9 percent from 8.1 percent, the Government roported today.

title: Vietnam's Wound in Kentucky
description: People used to say that it was in the small places where Vietnam had cut the deepest, that it was in the small places where the war had taken away so much, So this is where went: small places of all kinds, everywhere.

title: U.S. REPORT URGES NEW BODY TO DIRECT AMATEUR ATHLETICS
description: A special Presidential Olympic commission has recommended sweeping changes to upgrade America's amateur sports system. These include the creation of a strong, nongovernmental central sports organization and permission for United States athletes to accept money for endorsements and other noncompetitive activities.

title: Envoy Back in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 12 (Reuters)Israel's Ambassador to France returned home to night on the orders of his government after the French release of Abu Daoud

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Jan. 12Governor Byrne today signed an antiredlining bill that make it a crime for banks or other lending institutions to refuse to make a home loan simply because a property is in a declining neighborhood.

title: Soviet Defector Depicts Grim Life at MIG25 Base
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12When Viktor I. Belenko, the former Soviet Air Force lieutenant, recently visited the enlisted men's mess on a United States aircraft carrier, he expressed astcnishment at the huge portions of food served free and at all times to the sailors.

title: Kentucky Quintet Is Upset By Tennessee in Overtime
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 12 (AP)Mike Jackson sank two free throws with 39 seconds left in an overtime period tonight to insure a 7167 victory for Tennessee over highly ranked Kentucky in college basketball.

title: JOBLESS RATE AT 7.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The number of persons with jobs rose appreciably in December for the second consecutive month and the national unemployment rate eased to 7.9 percent from 8.1 percent, the Government reported today.

title: South Korea Says it Will Accept U.S. Pullout If North Gives Pledge
description: SEOUL, South Korea. Jan. 12President Park Chung Hee declared today that he would not oppose the withdrawal of American troops from South Korea if North Korea agreed to sign a nonaggression pact with his Government.

title: New York Jews Outraged
description: Jewish groups, an organization of professors concerned with the Middle East and the Mayor of New York reacted with outrage and scorn yesterday to France's release of Abu Daoud.

title: Knicks Box Score
description: TUESDAY NIGHT

title: HOW TO ASSIST THE FUND FOR THE NEEDIEST
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Canadian Court Upholds Ban on the Use of French in Air Traffic Control
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 12In a case related to the movement for the independence of Quebec, a federal court judge today upheld an official ban on the use of French in air traffic control except for visual operations at seven small airports in the Frenchspeaking province.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Czechoslovaks Say Signers of Petition Seek Return of 68
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 12 (AP)Two Czechoslovak party newspapers, criticizing human rights petition signed by more than 300 Czechs, said today that the year 1968 will not be reapted.

title: World News Briefs
description: CAIRO. Thursday, Jan. 13 (AP)Foreign ministers of five Arab oilproducing states have pledged $1.4 billion a year to states confronting Israel, the semiofficial Egyptian newspaper Al Ahram said today.

title: Da Capo Chamber Players Present 3 New Works
description: What might be described as the right wing of the left wing was heard last night at the Carnegie Recital Hall program of the Da Capo Chamber Players. The establishment figures of the avantgarde get most attention these days. But there also are a number of accomplished musicians working in contemporary music, using modern techniques but in a traditional manner. Three of those figures are Miriam Gideon, Robert Helps and Ezra Laderman, and each had a new work in the Da Capo concert.

title: Kuhn Backs His Rulings On Sales
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12With Charles O. Finley glaring at him from behind black hornrimmed glasses, Commissioner Bowie Kuhn testified today that he firmly believed Finley could have signed Joe Rudi and Rollie Fingers and that he doubted that the Oakland owner would have used the money from the sales of those two players and Vida Blue to sign free agentc

title: Miss Longet, on Stand, Describes Shooting Her Lover
description: ASPEN, Colo., Jan. 12Claudine Longet, fighting back tears, told the jury at her manslaughter trial this afternoon that she was asking her lover, Vladimir (Spider) Sabich, if a handgun was safe when it suddenly discharged and killed him.

title: In Memoriam
description: ALAGGIODonald J., January 13, 1973Fourth anniversary DUNBARCarrie Glover. January 13, 1976. We remember In love. Husband, Son, Sisters and Brothers, Granddaughter Carrie Anne. DaughterIn.law, Motherinlaw, Nieces and Nephews. KLOTZLouis. Daddy, we who love you can never forget and forget we never will. Your family.

title: Ethnic Groups Angered by Plans for Carter's People's Inauguration, Feeling Left Out
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Plans for Presidentelect Carter's people's inauguration, which was designed to celebrate the unity and diversity of American life, have bruised the feelings and stirred anger among some of the key ethnic groups that supported the Democratic candidate.

title: Islanders Scoring
Pivotal Talks In Ballet Strike Set Tomorrow
description: Negotiators for the New York City Ballet management and its striking musicians will meet again tomorrow morning at the request of Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, in an attempt to settle the fiveweekold ballet labor dispute and ward off cancellation of the remaining five and a half weeks of the City Ballet's season.

title: TV: Circus of the Stars, a OneRing Show on CBS
description: The mere quantity of television programming tends to camouflage the medium's more outrageous absurdities. Things pass quickly in the primetime night and, with few exceptions, are immediately forgotten. More often than not, the true dramas have taken place off camera. For a most recent and startling example, there was a curious twohour production called Circus of the Stars shown on CBS last Monday. This thirdrate extravaganza came close to creating a minor international incident.

title: Soviet Defector Depicts Grim Life at MIG25 Base
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12When Viktor I. Belenko, the former Soviet Air Forel lieutenant, recently visited the enlisted men's mess on a United States aircraft carrier, he expressed astonishment at the huge portions of food served free and at all times to the sailors.

title: BARGAIN PRICES SET FOR SPACE SHUTTLE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Although the price of nearly everything is going up, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration has drawn up a rate schedule for transporting future satellites and experiments into orbit that is literally and economically an out of this world bargain about half the present costs and as little as $3,000 for small, simple payloads.

title: 'Special Delivery': A Caper That Fails to Deliver Action
description: "Special Delivery," which opened at neighborhood theaters yesterday, is a comic melodrama about a bank holdup and the subsequent efforts of several different parties to put their hands on the loot. It stars B??? Svenson, as an ex-Marine sergeant who masterminds the caper, and Cybill Shepherd, as a smart-talking innocent who cuts herself in on the job for the fun of it. They are pleasant company if you are accidentally trapped with them.Michael C. Gwynne has some good moments as a junkie, but neither Paul Wendkos, who directed the film, nor Don Gazzaniga, who wrote it, is very adept at melodrama and action. The film ends in a car chase of the sort that makes you realize that the screeching of tires has become the most overused and boring sound in movies today."Special Delivery," which has been rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"), possibly offers some clues as to how a potential R film ???ets upgraded to PG. Alth???ugh a character in "Special Delivery" has obviously been ???lmed saying "godda???" the "god" has been bleeped from the soundtrack. The film also includes some violence of a not very brutal kind.

title: Study Stirs Divided Reactions
description: John Naber, who won four gold medals in swimming at the Olympics last summer, considered the rivalries and squabbles besieging American sports yesterday and said: I even have to clear my speaking engagements through two organizations.

title: Liberals Resisting Naming of a Black To Key Latin Post
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Unusual opposition is developing to the naming of a black career diplomat to he position of Assistant Secretary of State for Inter American Affairs. The diplomat. Terence A. Todman has been described by an aide to Secretary of Statedesignate Cyrus R. Vance as a strong candidate for the post.

title: AGE OF ELECTRONICS IS PUT OFF IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12The dawn of the electronic age in the New York State Assembly was put off for another year today amid charges by the Republican minority that the controlling Democratic Party did not really want to ballot by push button because it would end the hallowed Albany practice of emptychair voting.

title: About New York
description: The Bronx has an opera company. Mysterious power, mysteriously compelling . . . A man was singing these words of Verdi on the auditorium stage of the Bronx High School of Science the other night, only an a cappella shout from the Jerome Avenue el. The rest of the borough went through its lyricless routine, largely oblivious to the interesting fact that the Bronx has an opera company.

title: Judge Rules That an Alleged Spy Must Give Handwriting Samples
description: NEWARK, Jan. 12Judge Laurence A. Whipple granted today a Government motion that would require Ivan N. Rogalsky, a Soviet citizen accused of conspiracy to commit espionage, to submit samples of his handwriting to a grand jury.

title: This Way to the Egress
description: BOSTON, Jan. 12Henry Kissinger is leaving office in a blaze of adulation. The National Press Club produces a belly dancer for him and gives standing applause to his views on world neace. The Harlem Globetrotters make him an honorary team member. Senators pay tribute to his wisdom.

title: Richard Briefs Kenyan
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 12 (Reuters)Ivor Richard today briefed by Kenyan Foreign Minister, Munyua Waiyaki, on his latest contacts with African leaders. He flew here last night from Tanzania where he had met President Julius K. Nyerere, chairman of the five frontline African states.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended Nov. 30 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange, and (O) over the counter.

title: BLUMENTHAL PLANS TO LIMIT BENDIX TIES
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 12W. Michael Blumenthal disclosed today plans to reduce and greatly restrict, but not sever, his ties to the Bendix Corporation, a major Government contractor, in an effort to avoid conflicts of interest as Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (UPI)The Coast Guard was planning to turn the Liberian tanker Argo Merchant away from United States ports at the time she ran aground and broke up off Nantucket Island, the Coast Guard commandant testified today.

title: Friedgood Sentencing Is Delayed
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 12 (AP)Judge Richard C. Delin granted a twoweek delay today in the sentencing of Dr. Charles Friedgood, who was convicted last month of murdering his wife with a drug. John Sutter, the defense lawyer, asked for the postponement in Nassau County Court. He said that he needed more time to compile presentencing materials and that the physician, from Kensington, L.I., needed more time to conclude personal matters.

title: COMPROMISE IS URGED ON CITY U. ASSISTANCE
description: Governor Carey's advisory commission on higher education has suggested, in what would amount to a compromise, that the city and the state each contribute half of the disputed $100 million in needed financing for the senior colleges of the City University of New York.

title: Tanner Is Upset by Gorman; Pasarell Scores Over Ashe
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Jan. 12 (UPI) Roscoe Tanner and Arthur Ashe, the topseeded players, were eliminated in the third round of the $75,000 South Australia tennis championship today.

title: Spiers, Late for the 1,000, Finishes Earliest in Mile
description: Ron Spiers was late last night in getting to the 102d Engineers Armory and missed a heat of the 1,000yard run, the event he won last year in the national flatfloor record time of 2 minutes 10.1 seconds at the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union senior indoor track championships.

title: Ruling on Credit Cards in California Gives Consumers the Right to Sue
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 12 (AP)A Los Angeles judge has ruled that Californians have the right to sue for damages if credit card companies sell their names and addresses for other companies mailing lists.

title: Open Interest
Raleigh Industries To Close U.S. Plant
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Jan. 12 (AP)Raleigh Industries, an English company and one of the world's largest manufacturers of bicycles, has announced it is closing its only American assembly plant. The closing, scheduled about June 1, comes less than three years after the plant opened in Enid. Okla.

title: S.E.C. Says G.T.E. Paid $4.5 Million To Four Filipinos
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP)The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation distributed about $4.5 million to four Filipinos handpicked by officials at the highest levels of the Government of the Philippines, the Securities and Exchange Commission charged today.

title: Hospital Agency Approves a Plan To Pare Budget
description: The New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation approved a budgetcutting financial plan yesterday that avoids substantial layoffs and depends heavily on new revenueenhancement measures to eliminate a $153 million deficit in its $1 billion budget over the next 18 months.

title: St. Francis 100, Seton Hall 95
description: Manny Figueroa scored 27 points and Bobby Collier and Larry Wingate added 21 apiece as St. Francis College won, 10095, over Seton Hall University last night on the winner's court in Brooklyn. It was the fifth consecutive victory for the Terriers.

title: Books of The Times
description: Ingrid Bengis must have felt badly defeated in her earlier book, Combat in the Erogenous Zone, to surrender so unconditionally to the sexual platitudes of I Have Come Here to Be Alone. The title of this first novel is intended to connote, I suppose, the sweet sadness of the lonesome, liberated self, the modern heroine soaking away her sorrows in the dirty bath water of her narcissism.

title: Dividends
CARTER IS OPTIMISTIC ON A MIDEAST ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  Presidentelect Carter expressed optimism today about a resolution of problems in the Middle East, a settlement in which he visualized a significant role for himself and the United States Government

title: Sarkis Insistent on Meeting Deadline
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 11Lebanese factions and Palestinian groups were assembling weapons today and preparing to transport them to new locations under supervision of the Arab League peacekeeping force.

title: ETHIOPIAGOVERNMENT SEEN AS MORE STABLE
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia (AP) Whatever it is, we have a Government now, said a filling station owner of recent revamping of Ethiopia's military Government.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Delay in Execution Of Gilmore Barred
ABU DAOUD RELEASE SETS OFF AN UPROAR
description: PARIS, Jan. 12Official Franceboth the Government of President Valry Giscard d'Estaing and his principal political opponentsappeared to be in a state of silent shock today over the uproar set off by France's release yesterday of a suspected Palestinian terrorist leader.

title: SWINE INFLUENZA CASE  REPORTED IN MINNESOTA
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 12 (UPI)The Minnesota Health Department said today that a case of swine flu had been reported in a farm area.

title: Accord Is Reached on Utility Service to the Poor
description: NEWARK, Jan. 12Joel R. Jacobson, president of the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners, announced today an agreement by the state's major gas and electric companies to exercise compassion and discretion before making any decision to cut off the service of poor clients during this severe winter.

title: SUPREME COURT BANS TAX DISCRIMINATION ON STOCK TRANSFERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Supreme Court today held unconstitutional New York State's attempt to protect its securities industry by imposing a stocktransfer tax that discriminates against those who place orders on outofstate exchanges.

title: Sinatra Weeps at Rite for Mother
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan. 12 (AP)Frank Sinatra wept at his mother's funeral today after an hourlong requiem mass in the St. Louis Catholic Church in nearby Cathedral City. About 700 people, including many other entertainers, attended the funeral of Natalie Sinatra, 82 years old, who died with three others in a plane crash, last Thursday on the way to her son's opening of a show in Las Vegas. Pallbears included Dean Martin and Pat Henry. the entertainers; Dr. Michael DeBakey, the heart surgeon; James Van Yeusen, composer; Leo Durocher. the former baseball player and manager, and a restaurateur, Jully Rizzo.

title: W.T.T. Drafts Renee Richards
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 12 (AP)World Team Tennis faced a controversy today when the new Pennsylvania Keystones selected Renee Richards in the league's draft.

title: Fedders Strikers to Vote on Pact
description: EFFINGHAM, Ill., Jan. 12 (AP)About 1,000 striking workers at the Fedders Corporation air conditioner plant here will vote Friday on a contract offer that includes a wage increase of about 9 percent. Members of the Stove, Furnace and Allied Appliances Union struck the concern Dec. 21 when their old contract. expired.

title: Study Asks Less Direct College Aid, More for Tuition
description: sidles. The proposal would probably result in lower tuition costs at county community colleges and possibly at state colleges, but it would result in sharply increased tuition and fee schedules at Rutgers and possible at some independent institutions. For students from families with incomes of up to $18,000 a year, however, the commission estimates that these additional costs would be covered by increased tuition assistance.

title: Hialeah Sale Supported
description: HIALEAH, Fla., Jan. 12 (AP)A plan to save horse racing at Hialeah Park is in the hands of state officials now that the City Council has approved a $13.3million transaction aimed at preserving the track. The Hialeah City Council approved the purchase and lease of the park last night, giving John Brunetti of New Jersey control of the 51yearold race track.

title: Tex Carleton, Star Pitcher, Is Dead
description: James Otto (Tex) Carleton, who pitched with the legendary St. Louis Cardinals Gashouse Gang of the 1930's, died Tuesday in Fort Worth, Tex. He was 70 years old.

title: Union Representing 140,000 Employees Halts Albany Talks
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12The Civil Service Employees Association, the union that represents 140,000 New York State employees, announced today that it had broken off negotiations with the state over a salary increase, and both sides took the opportunity to accuse each other of not cooperating.

title: Schools Say a Strike Would Halt Meals
description: No meals will be served in New York City public schools next week if custodial employees carry out their threat to strike, the Board of Education said yesterday.

title: Ford, in Valedictory to Congress, Wishes the Very Best for Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  President Ford, in his third and final State of the Union Message, urged tonight that Congress and the new administration adopt prudent policies at home, warned that the nation must never be second in defense and said that he was returning to private life with gladness and gratitude.

title: Goldsworthy's Suspension
description: Clarence Campbell, the league president, informed Coach John Ferguson earlier in the day that Goldsworthy had been indefinitely suspended pending further investigation of a match penalty the forward incurred in Sunday's game against Los Angeles. Campbell said he would have a final decision on the incident Friday.

title: Soybean Futures Up Sharply as March Gains 10c
description: Soybeans rallied strongly yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, with price increases ranging from 9 cents to 14 cents a bushel. The March contract closed at $7.26, up about 10 cents.

title: KELLEY TO BE OUSTED AS DIRECTOR OF F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP)Attorney Generaldesignate Griffin B. Bell said today that Clarence M. Kelley would be replaced as Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in the near future.

title: Columbia 118, Wagner 90
description: Columbia set a school scoring record last night, beating Wagner, 11890, as Ricky Free led the way with 23 points and eight rebounds. The total broke the school record of 115 set in 1968 against Harvard.

title: State of Union Talks Begun by Washington
description: >WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Article II, Section 3 of the Constitution declares that the President shall from time to time give the Congress information of the state of the Union.

title: George J. Cunningham, ExOfficial Of Manufacturers Hanover, Dies
description: George J. Cunningham, former vice president of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, died at his home in Forest Hills, Queens, on Monday after a long illness. He was 66 years old and retired last Sept. 1, after 41 years with the bank, which he joined as a teller in 1936.

title: G.A.O. Says Interpol Unit in U.S. Is Yielding Information Too Freely
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The United States Bureau of Interpol has been indiscriminate in freely providing information about Americans to the national police in 124 other countries, according to a study just completed by the Government Accounting Office.

title: 5 Winners For Cauthen
description: Steve Cauthen widened his lead in the New York jockey standing yesterday by bringing home five winners at Aqueduct. The splurge left the 16yearold apprentice with 15 winners for the meeting, six more than his nearest rival. Angel Santiago.

title: U.S. REPORT URGES NEW BODY TO DIRECT AMATEUR ATHLETICS
description: A special Presidential Olympic commission has recommended sweeping changes to upgrade America's amateur sports system. These include the creation of a strong, nongovernmental central sports organization and permission for United States athletes to accept money for endorsements and other noncompetitive activities.

title: Brazil's Coffee RipOff
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Brazil is to coffee what Saudi Arabia is to oil. In concert with coffee producers, Brazil has doubled the price of coffee and confidently predicts the price will nearly be tripled by year's end.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 5.3311 UNLIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9: 00 A M TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY! NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 3390?? WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN HEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300: NASTAU CO. (516) 147.0500; SUFFOLK CO (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: A Legislator Faces Extradition
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Jan. 12 (AP)A newly elected Rhode Island legislator may be extradited to Michigan because he never served a sentence reportedly imposed for stealing 31 record albums. the state police say.

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTON  Two littlenoticed events in the capital this week underscore a new reality that is recoloring the American political and economic complexion. First, the Census Bureau announced that, by its indirect estimates, the majority of American people now live in the Southern and Western states for the first time in history.

title: East Germans End Ban at Embassy
description: EAST BERLIN, Jan 12East Germany, in an unexpected aboutface, today withdrew its police guards from the entrance to the West German diplomatic mission in East Berlin, once again allowing visitors, including East Germans, to enter the building.

title: People and Business
description: Ralph E. Walters, 52 years old, a ranking partner in the international practice of Touche Ross & Company, was named yesterday to the Financial Accounting Standards Board, the private sector's top authority on accounting. His appointment ended a long and difficult search by the Financial Accounting Foundation, the board's overseer, to fill a vacancy that opened last April in the sevenmember body.

title: 210 BLACKS LEAVE HERE FOR FESTIVAL IN NIGERIA
description: Two hundred and ten black American artists, writers and dancers flew out of John F. Kennedy Airport yesterday as the first contingent of official American participants in the Second World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture in Lagos, Nigeria.

title: CAR OUTPUT UP FOR WEEK; YEAR'S RISE PUT AT 14.3%
description: DETROIT, Jan. 12American auto output this week is scheduled to rise by 5.5 percent from last week and will be 12.5 percent ahead of the production in the same week last year.

title: Executive Accused Of Fraud in Inquiry Into F.B.I. Dealings
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12One of the principal figures in a Justice Department inquiry into alleged corruption within the Federal Bureau of Investigation was charged today with having defrauded the Government and having evaded the payment of more than $32,000 in Federal income taxes.

title: Letters
description: Soviet Defense Buildup: The Focus on Peking

title: ABU DAOUD RELEASE SETS OFF AN UPROAR
description: PARIS, Jan. 12Official Franceboth the Government of President Valery Giscard d'Estaing and his principal political opponentsappeared to be in a state of silent shock today over the uproar set off by France's release yesterday of a suspected Palestinian terrorist leader.

title: Rangers Scoring
Uncertainty Clouds Westway's Amenities
description: Not since the building of Central Park or the covering of the railroad tracks on Park Avenue has there been a decision that will change the physical shape of the city as much as Westway, said an official of the new West Side Highway Project the other day, and if he was exaggerating, it was only slightly. For when have been some larger projects in New York City's history, there have been few that have had the potential to alter the city's face as drastically as Westway.

title: HARRY F. VICKERS, 78, OF SPERRY RAND, DIES
description: Harry F. Vickers, former chairman of the board and chief executive officer of the Sperry Rand Corporation, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness. He was 78 years old and had homes in Manhattan and in Princeton, Me.

title: Transcript of President Ford's Final Message to Congress on State of the Union
description: In accordance with the Constitution, I come before you once again to report on the State of the Union.

title: Medical Records Privacy Violated, GovernmentBacked Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Americans have lost control of the enormous flow of personal medical and health information about themselves, a major Governmentsoonsored report said today.

title: Harvard Vice President Reported Chosen as Under Secretary of H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Charles Hale Champion, financial vice president of Harvard University, has been selected to be the next Under Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, informed sources said today.

title: Navy 56, Georgetown 55
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Jan. 12 (AP) Bob Scott's 15foot jump shot with four seconds left in the game gave Navy, 5655 victory over Georgetown tonight. Georgetown had fought back from. 15point deficit midway in the second half to go ahead, 5352, with 4:58 remaining.

title: News Summary
description: The international uproar over France's release of Abu Daoud, a suspected Palestinian terrorist leader, left Government and opposition leaders apparently in a state of silent shock. But the French press of left, right and center upbraided the Government. The action was interpreted by many Frenchmen as based on the Government's eagerness for better relations with the Arab nations that are major oil producers. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Arthur Siegel Sings and Plays In Broadway at the Ballroom
description: Like most of the songwriters who have appeared in the Ballroom's Broadway at the Ballroom series at the West Broadway restaurant, Arthur Siegel has brought a couple of singers with him for his engagement this week. But although June Carroll and Sandy Stewart. are capable performers. Mr. Siegel is even better.

title: Women Take the Leads in a Modern Merchant
description: The Soho Repertory Theater is hospitable little theater near Canal Street. In common with the .Jean Cocteau Theater and the Classic Stage Company, it specializes in classics performed in repertoryat reasonable prices. At the Soho Rep, a sixplay subscription costs $12.

title: Orr Gets First Tally
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12The Great Orr, thought to be extinct in these parts. surfaced in Chicago Stadium tonight and led the Black Hawks to a 21 triumph over the Islanders. Scoring the first goal of the game on his first shot, Bobby Orr played spasmodically but well in his first contest since Dec .1.

title: Leroy Jenkins Plays jazz Violin
description: Solo concerts, which have become more and more popular in recent years, offer the improvising musician a special challenge. There can be no coasting, no catching of breath while piano, bass and drums take solos. The player must give everything at all times, but if he is to maintain interest throughout his concert he must also be able to marshal his resources and spread them out.

title: The Meaning of the Message
description: TRENTON, Jan. 12  While Governor Byrne's State of the State Message yesterday to the Legislature hardly sounded like the rousing start of a reelection campaign, there were solid political overtones. It was to potential gubernatorial candidates that Mr. Byrne seemed to be talking when he said that some discern an opportunity for personal political advantage in attacking a program still widely misunderstood.

title: South Africa Police Raid Black Areas and Seize 95 After Bombings of Schools
Radio
description: 69 A.M., WNCNFM. Impromptu No. 2, Schubert; Entrance of the Gods into Valhalla from Das Rheingold, Wagner; Sinfonia, D Scarlatti; Scherzo and March from Love for Three Oranges, Prokofiev; Two Minuets, Haydn; Layenda, Albeniz; Trumpet Concerto in D, Fasch.

title: St. John's 74, St. Joseph's 57 Villanova 75, West Virginia 65
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 12 (AP) St. John's spurted to an early 12point lead but had to fight off a St. Joseph's rally shortly after halftime tonight to defeat the Hawks, 7457, in the second game of a doubleheader at the Palestra.

title: New Study on Pregnancy Links Birth Defects to Sex Hormones
description: A team that studied more than 50,000 pregnancies has found further evidence linking serious birth defects to exposure to female sex hormones, including oral contraceptives, early in pregnancy.

title: Resort Strikes It Rich: First Water, Then Snow
description: GREAT BARRINGTON Mass., Jan. 11  Yesterday's snowstorm, which dropped 17 inches on Butternut Basin here in the Berkshires and buried much of the rest of the Northeast's ski country, has made Channing Murdock feel as if he has suddenly struck oil. This was all we needed to make this a great winter, said Murdock, who owns the Butternut resort. We were in great shape before the storm. Now we're better off than we've been in years.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 13, 1977

title: Dollar. Mostly Off But Gains on Pound; Gold Prices Climb
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 12 (UPI) The dollar eased on most European money markets today, but it rose against the British pound as profit takers cut into recent gains for both currencies.

title: Soviet Defector Depicts Grim Life at MIG25 Base
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12When Viktor I. Belenko, the former Soviet Air Force lieutenant, recently visited the enlisted men's mess on a United States aircraft carrier, he expressed astonishment at the huge portions of food served free and at all times to the sailors.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: with a kind of gusto, from petty personal matters to peace is at hand.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: Something Cleansing, Something Final
description: It just sits there on Page One, pretending to be news, like yesterday's temperature low. But it sears the mind. It isn't just news; millions have known it for many years, some painfully, some righteously. It isn't just politics; nobody's fate or income or reputation required it. It isn't even significant history; the lessons and consequences can be only dimly calculated so far. Still, there is the sense that something momentous has been uttered, something cleansing, something final. The speaker was the next Secretary of State of the United States. The time was 21 months after the final American evacuation from Saigon at the end of a 12year war. He said: Let me say, in light of hindsight, it was a mistake to intervene in Vietnam.

title: Ford Accepts Levi's Resignation Next Week as Attorney General
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP)Attorney General Edward H. Levi's resignation, effective Jan. 20, was accepted today by President Ford.

title: Carter Phones Japanese Premier
description: TOKYO, Thursday, Jan. 13 (UPI)Presldentelect Carter placed a telephone call to the new Japanese Prime Minister, Takeo Fukuda, last night, and spoke with him for about 15 minutes concerning proposed summit talks.

title: A.M.C. to Use 4Cylinder Engine As Way to Improve Its Car Sales
description: DETROIT, Jan. 12  The American Motors Corporation introduced today light, highperformance, fourcylinder ensine of European design that officials of the financially troubled company see as a possible key to better sales of their cars over the lone term.

title: Oil Well Discovery in Venezuela
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Jan. 12 (UPI)Venezuela's staterun oil industry has made a major find in deepdrilling in Lake Maracaibo, source of twothirds of the country's 2.3 million barrelperday output, oil industry spokesmen said today. The discovery, along with earlier finds in the deeper cretaceus formation in Lake Maracaibo, have proved out a major producting formation, they said.

title: Tex Carleton Is Dead
description: Tex Carleton. a star pitcher for the St. Louis Cardinals, Chicago Cubs and Brooklyn Dodgers, died Tuesday at the age of 70 in Fort Worth, Tex. An obituary appears on page 38.

title: 4Alarm Fire Ruins Greenwich Village Loft Building
description: A nearly vacant sixstory Greenwich Village loft building, which was approved on Tuesday for a $1 million conversion to 57 apartments, burned yesterday morning in a widely visible eruption of smoke and flame.

title: JURY INDICTS TROY ON 4 LARCENY COUNTS
description: City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. was indicted yesterday in Queens on four counts of grand larceny and two counts of perjury, all felonies.

title: Two Big. Worries of Retailers as They Ponder 77: Effect of Rising Prices and Jeans in White House
description: To the nation's merchants, now beginning to seriously ponder the outlook for 1977, two questions rank high on a list of potential headaches.

title: Judge Refuses to Dismiss Civil Rights Violation Suit Against Major Law Firm
description: A Federal udge refused yesterday to dismiss a civil rights suit that charged the law firm of Cravath, Swaine and Moore with discrimination against a lawyer who is a Catholic of Italian ancestry.

title: Ford's Farewell Also a Sentimental Homecoming
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  President Ford's farewell to Congress tonight was more of a sentimental homecoming.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT CLEVELAND

title: Byers Urges N.C.A.A. to Reorganize
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 12Walter Byers, executive director of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, said today that the huge and diverse organization was threatened with breaking up if it did not reorganize itself to satisfy many of its members.

title: Article 2  No Title
Seattle Slew Heads the List Of Last Year's 2YearOlds
description: Seattle Slew raced only three times as a 2yearold, but those three efforts told Tommy Trotter all he needed to know about Karen Taylor's Kentuckybred colt.

title: Imperial Chemical Computer Tapes Of Financial Records Stolen at Plant
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands, Jan. 12 (AP)Computer tapes containing financial records of Imperial Chemical Industries, the British concern, were stolen last weekend from the company's plant here, an Imperial Chemical spokesman said today.

title: Leonard Silk
description: LONDONWith the planned liquidation of the pound as an international reserve currency, Britain has given up one more vestige of empire, one more symbol of its role as a world powersafety net negotiated with the Bank for International Settlements in Basel, Switzerland, that made it possibletogether with the $3.9 billion stand by credit obtained from the International Monetary Fundthings are looking up for Britain and the pound.

title: Bonds Skittish, but With Signs of Stabilizing Prices
description: The bond market remained skittish yesterday as prices changed directions several times in response to rumors and news developments. On balance, the credit markets ended lowertheir seventh decline in the first eight trading days or 1977  but there were some signs, especially Credit in the taxexempt bond secMarkets tor, that prices were beginning to stabilize. While prices were rising and falling, another heavy schedule of financing managed to move forward. Investment bankers again raised yields to speed up salesa tactic that only sometimes worked.

title: Exxon May End Participation In Seadock Oil Loading Unit
description: The Exxon Corporation has Indicated that it may have to withdraw from participation in the proposed $650 million Seadock crude oil loading facility off the Texas coast. Seadock is a consortium of nine companies that plan to finance and operate a supertanker facility 25 miles south of Texas.

title: Notes on People
description: From 1949 to 1953, when he went into politics, Senator George McGovern taught history and political science at Dakota Wesleyan University. Now the South Dakota Democrat, whose 1972 Presidential candidacy was founded on opposition to the Vietnam War, will again teach, beginning Jan. 24. Each Monday he will fly here from Washington to teach an evening seminar at Columbia University's School of International Affairs. I seized on it, the Senator said yesterday. I think it's going to be a fascinating experience to be required, after 20 years away from the classroom, to systematically organize my thoughts on foreign policy. Mr. McGovern's seminar will focus on the cold war and Vietnam, the emergence of the third world, and the role of the United Nations.

title: New Year's Gift to the Neediest
description: An anonymous donor yesterday wrote to the 65th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund to say that over the decades has been my practice to make out the first check of the new year to your Neediest Fund.

title: INFLATION SPECTER DEPRESSES STOCKS
description: Fears of a renewed burst of inflation helped to drive stock prices lower yesterday across a broad front. Weakened by losses in several actively traded stocks, the Dow Jones industrial average dropped 8.40 points to 968.25. This brought the decline in the bluechip barometer so far this year to more than 36 points in eight trading sessions.

title: Supreme Court, 63, Backs States Sovereignty in Riverbed Disputes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12In a decision of broad practical significance that strengthens state sovereignty, the Supreme Court ruled today, 6 to 3, that state rather than Federal law governs disputes over the extent of a state's ownership of riverbeds within its boundaries.

title: Music: Princeton Group Makes New York Debut
description: One of the yeastier musical phenomena of recent decades has been the rise of universitybased ensembles capable of performing difficult new works as well as the classical repertory. Such groups, many of them able to hold up their heads in any company, have sprouted all over the country, and the movement continues to show vitality. The Princeton Ensemble, a twoyearold enterprise, made its New York debut on Tuesday night at the Guggenheim Museum, bringing with it the world premiere of Edward T. Cone's Serenade for flute, violin, viola and cello.

title: S.I.A. Backs a Proposal to Open Stock Trading Half Hour Earlier
description: A proposal to open trading on stock exchanges a half hour earlier was endorsed yesterday by the executive committee of the Securities Industry Association, a trade group representing most of the nation's brokerages.

title: Article 1  No Title
High Rhodesian Aide Talks of a Separate Settlement
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 12Foreign Minister Pieter K. van der Byl said today that the endorsement given to the Patriotic Front nationalist group by black African presidents left Rhodesia no choice but to negotiate a separate settlement with other black groups and to hope that Western countries, particularly the United States, would back the resulting government.

title: President's Commission On Olympic Sports
description: EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR Michael T. Harrigan CHAIRMAN Gerald B. Zornow

title: Melvin L. Wulf Quits as Legal Director of A.C.L.U.
description: Melvin L. Wulf, a nationally known constitutional lawyer, has resigned as legal director of the American Civil Liberties Union because of irreconcilable differences with the executive director and chairman of the 275,000member organization.

title: Petition Could Validate a Lost 1938 Hughes Will
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 12What may he the first move in an attempt to probate a lost will that Howard R. Hughes is believed to have signed in 1938 took place today in Nevada District Court in Las Vegas.

title: Little Early Impact Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  A Ford Administration official concerned with international military affairs said today he doubted that the Mirage deal would upset the balance of forces in the Middle. East in the near future.

title: Beirut Says Arms TurnIn Is Over
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Thursday, Jan. 13 (AP)The Beirut radio reported today that Arab peacekeeping forces completed, by a midnight deadline last night, the collection of tanks, artillery and other heavy weapons from the private militia forces that battled in Lebanon's civil war.

title: BRIEFING BY CAREY PAINTS GRIM PICTURE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12Governor Carey, in a firstofits kind briefing for legislators, painted a grim portrait today of longterm economic trends in the state.

title: Margaret Court Advances
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Jan. 12 (AP)Margaret Court, attempting a comeback at age 34, was pushed to three sets tonight but beat a fellow Australian, Wendy Turnbull, in the $100,000 Virginia Slims Circuit tournament. Mrs. Court won the first set, 63, lost by 26 in the second, then won the final set, 64.

title: Jersey Study Urges Less Direct Aid To Colleges, but More to Students
description: A special commission appointed to study the financing of higher education in New Jersey called yesterday for a reduction of direct state aid to colleges and universities and substantial increases in tuition assistance to students.

title: Rhodesian Plane Shot Down
description: SALISBURY, Jan. 12 (AP)  A Rhodesian Air Force plane was shot down by Mozambican gunners and the two crewmen are feared dead, the Government said today.

title: MT. LAUREL OFFICIALS HAIL ZONING DECISION
description: MOUNT LAUREL, Jan. 12Officials here were jubilant today over a United States Supreme Court decision yesterday that apparently conflicted with a 1975 ruling by the New Jersey Supreme Court that ordered the township to revise its zoning ordinance to provide housing for people with low and moderate incomes.

title: Connors, Mayer Advance
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. 12 (AP)Topseeded Jimmy Connors advanced to the quarterfinal round of the $100, 000 Birmingham indoor tournament tonight with a 63, 62 victory over Buster Mottram of Britain.

title: Hartwick's Myernick Goes First in Pro Soccer Draft
description: The North American Soccer League conducted its sixth annual college draft yesterday without its two Canadian clubs, Toronto and Vancouver, and without the Boston franchise, which was suspended by the league late Tuesday and will not operate this year.

title: TAX AGENCY SEIZURES CURBED BY JUSTICES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP)The Supreme Court ruled today that Federal tax agents must have a court order before breaking into private property to seize assets and papers from delinquent taxpayers.

title: Something New, Something Old For Sentimental Rosalynn Carter
description: Rosalynn Carter is a sentimentalist. Accordingly, she decided to wear something old and something blue to the ball after the inauguration of her husband, Jimmy, as 39th President of the United States.

title: Team of Police Looks for Clue To Bronx Slayer
description: A combined team of homicide detectives, policemen of the Senior Citizens Anticrime Unit and housing policemen searched yesterday for clues to the slayer of 72yearold Sylvia Seide, who was found dead Monday afternoon in her Branx apartment.

title: Brain Surgery for ExCard
description: MEMPHIS, Jan. 12 (AP)A former St. Louis Cardinals relief pitcher, Ron Willis, was in fair condition today at St. Joseph's HospitalEast after undergoing brain surgery Monday. He is 33 years old.

title: CoOp City Is Given an Extension On Resolving Its Fiscal Problems
description: A sixmonth moratorium that New York State granted last summer to solve the severe financial problems of Coop City has been quietly extended for at least four more months, with a solution still not in sight.

title: Cuts in Money Force New York Urban Coalition to Be Less Aggressive in Word and Deed
description: When the New York Urban Coalition first set out in 1967 to attack the problems of disadvantaged blacks and other minorities in the city, its provocative slogan, Give a Damn, was cast like a challenge to the corporate and labor leaders who were called on to lead the effort.

title: Article 3  No Title
Uncertainty Clouds Westway's Amenities
description: Not since the building of Central Park or the covering of the railroad tracks on Park Avenue has there been a decision that will change the physical shape of the city as much as Westway, said an official of the new West Side Highway Project the other day, and if he was exaggerating, it was only slightly. For while there have been some larger pro jects in New York City's history, there have been few that have had the potential to alter the city's face as drastically as Westway.

title: Farm Bureau, Relaxing Its Opposition to Government Controls, Gives Qualified Backing to Price Supports
description: HONOLULU, Jan. 12The American Farm Bureau Federation, in a distinct somewhat grudging shift in its normally unqualified freemarket philosophy, approved today a resolution acknowledging that in some circumstances Government support might be needed to bolster sagging farm prices.

title: Gold
description: By The Associated Press

title: Abu Daoud Blames Groups in Police
description: ALGIERS, Jan. 12 (Reuters)Abu Daoud, the Palestinian freed by a Paris court, today attributed his controversial arrest to some groups in the French police that were trying to sabotage relations between France and the Arab countries.

title: Trader Arrested Because He Met Wrong Demand
description: Isaac Michael Webb, had a passion for collecting things, and, according to the Brooklyn District Attorney, the perfect formula for getting things to collect.

title: Manhattan 70, South Carolina 67
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Jan. 12 (AP)Manhattan, with clutch foul shots anda sticky defense, beat South Carolina, 7067 tonight. With his team down by a point with 5:35 to play Tom Courtney of the Jaspers hit on both ends of a oneandone play to put Manhattan ahead by 6261. Seconds later, Ricky Marsh added two free throws and the Gamecocks never caught up.

title: Egyptians Seeking a Factory to Make Mirage F1's, France's Advanced Supersonic FighterBomber
description: PARIS, Jan. 12  Egypt has asked France to provide it with a plant for the production on license of Mirage F1's, the latest operational French jet fighterbombers, and negotiations are under way on financing.

title: Saudis Picking New Oil Customers; Higher Output Seen Aimed at Iraq
description: A month after the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries split and established a twotier price system, the dust is settling and the outlines of a new world oil system are beginning to emerge.

title: INDIANS, IN PEACE GESTURE, FREE 2 LEADING DISSIDENTS
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 12 (AP)The Indian Government today freed two leading dissidents in the governing Congress Party who had been imprisoned under Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's state of emergency.

title: DECEMBER RISE 0.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Wholesale Price Index, pushed up by a jump in volatile farm prices, rose by ninetenths of 1 percent in December, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Mexico Upset by Unfair Image in U.S. and Fears Ties May Suffer
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 12Mexico's new Government believes that the negative and unfair image that this country has among Americans is damaging the tourist industry here and could eventually hurt its relations with Washington.

title: Excerpts From Report of President's Olympic Sports Panel
description: Having observed conditions in this country and around the world which prevent athletes from achieving the Olympic ideal, the President's Commission on Olympic Sports recognizes that it can have little or no direct influence over some of the factors prohibiting such achievement. For example, it notes with deep regret the declining ability of the nations of the world to separate sports from politics.

title: Judge Refuses to Dismiss Civil Rights Violation Suit Against Major Law Firm
description: A Federal judge refused yesterday to dismiss a civil rights suit that charged the law firm of Cravath, Swaine and Moore with discrimination against a lawyer who is a Catholic of Italian ancestry.

title: Carter's Sister and Mr. Universe Make the Chic Scene in New York
description: Jimmy Carter's sister stood under a pair of buffalo antlers at the 21 Club yesterday to talk about her book, The Gift of Inner Healing. Further uptown meanwhile, at a party in his honor at Elaine's Restaurant, Arnold Schwarzenegger, who is Mr. Universe and the star of a new film called Pumping Iron, was rubbing his musclebulging shoulders with those of such unlikely luncheon companions as Andy Warhol and Jacqueline Onassis.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: 4Cylinder A.M.C. Engine
description: The American Motors Corporation sees a new fourcylinder engine as possible key to better sales of its cars. Page 51.

title: The U.N. Today
The Summaries
description: MEN'S EVENTS

title: Topics
description: On Police, a Palace and Position

title: Market Place
description: Occidental Petroleum, a Wall Street favorite of the late 1960's that got little attention thereafter, seems to be making a comeback with investors.

title: James E. Kearney, Catholic Bishop. Of Rochester From 37 to 66, Dies
description: Bishop James E. Kearney, who headed the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rochester, from 1937 until his retirement in 1966, died yesterday in St. Ann's Home in Rochester after a long illness. He was 92 years old.

title: Anheuser Planning a Light Beer To Compete With Miller's Brew
description: When the Miller Brewing Company introduced its lowercalorie Lite beer two years ago, industry observers acknowledged it was a major marketing coup. The beer company, owned by Philip Morris Inc., not only created a national market that did not exist before, but Lite turned out to be the most successful new beer introduced in years.

title: On a Farm, She Made the Leap to Independence
description: Sherry Thomas, 28 years old, child of affluence and of the suburbs of Washington, still feels that fivesecond hesitation after all this time.

title: Ford, in Valedictory to Congress, Wishes the Very Best for Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  President Ford, in his third and final State of the Union Message, urged tonight that Congress and the new administration adopt prudent policies at home, warned that the nation must never be second in defense and said that he was returning to private life 'with gladness and gratitude.

title: Carter Says He Is Deeply Disturbed by the Release of Palestinian
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  Presidentelect Carter said today that he was deeply disturbed and very much surprised by France's release yesterday of the Palestinian militant Abu Daoud, but he said that he did not expect to mention the incident when he spoke on the telephone tomorrow with President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France.

title: Theater: WellActed Revival of All the Way Home
description: JAMES AGEE'S A Death in the family is an account of the brutal blow suffered by a Knoxville, Tenn. family when their loving but unquiet father is killed in an automobile accident. The book's materials are its marvelous, nuanced observations; its momentum comes from kind of flowing meditation.

title: FUNDS FOR NEW YORK FROM U.S. IN DOUBT
description: Federal officials said yesterday that more than half of the Federal money that Mayor Beame is counting on to help close New York City's budget gap might not be forthcoming.

title: Records:
description: In the late 1930's and early 40's, when bigband jazz was in flower and small jazz groups were almost universally ad hoc, in hock and living on what Eddie Condon termed transparent hamburgers, one small jazz group made such an impression with its style and finesse that it had a network radio show every Sunday afternoon, intruding on a time normally reserved for Wayne King's Lady Esther Serenade. The John Kirby Sextet was, at its best, a fantastically tightknit group that flowed along on airy rhythms that suggested it would never touch the ground. But the group's very tightness could work against it, and this, combined with an insistence on trying to use classical material as a base for its repertory, led it down a path that finally choked it off.

title: Bengtson Takes Title
description: ANTIGUA, West Indies, Jan. 13 (AP) Ove Bengtson of Sweden defended his Antigua open tennis title today, defeating Roger Taylor of Britain, 57, 76, 76. Bengtson was forced into two tiebreakers against Taylor and won them both, 50.

title: 200 Years of the Smithy's Art
description: From the time that Leif Ericson established a forge in Newfoundland 900 years ago to the 20th century, blacksmiths were integral to the development of North America, making and repairing the tools and weapons, cooking utensils, wheels and plows that conquered the great forests and built and maintained the country.

title: Rockefeller to Address Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP)Vice President Rockefeller will deliver a farewell address to the Senate next Tuesday afternoon, two days before the inauguration of his successor, Walter F. Mondale. An invitation to speak, extended by the majority leader, Robert C. Byrd, of West Virginia, was approved unanimously by the Senate last night. Mr. Rockefeller accepted and said he would limit his valedictory remarks to about 10 minutes. He is the constitutional presiding officer of the Senate, but may not make a speech to it without its permission.

title: Suffolk Towns Ordered to Press Programs for LowCost Housing
description: Judge Thomas P. Griesa of United States District Court in Brooklyn ordered 26 Suffolk County towns and villages yesterday to commit themselves to building lowcost public housing or risk the loss of their share of $4.2 million in Federal community development aid funds.

title: $63.5 Million Offer In Shearson Stock Is Made for Orion
description: Shearson, Hayden Stone Inc., a stock brokerage firm, yesterday proposed a merger with the Orion Capital Corporation of Parsippany, N.J., that would involve an exchange of new Shearson Hayden Stone common and preferred securities with a value of about $63.5 million for outstanding Orion common shares.

title: Ford Gives Kissinger Top Civilian Award
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (UPI)President Ford presented Henry A. Kissinger with the nation's highest civilian award, the Medal of Freedom, in surprise ceremony tonight and called him the greatest Secretary of State in the history of our Republic.

title: P.S.C. to Open Meetings to Public
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13The Public Service Commission, faced by mounting criticism, reversed itself today and voted to hold all but the most sensitive of its deliberations in open meetings.

title: Anthony Eden Grows Weaker As His Condition Deteriorates
description: ALVEDISTON, England, Jan. 13 (AP)Anthony Eden, the 79yearold former British prime minister who is gravely ill with a liver ailment, grew weaker as his condition deteriorated today, his doctor and family said.

title: Art: Asian Carving Dazzles at Show
description: OURS IS NOT an age rich in the art of woodcarving. Few of our greatest sculptors have attempted to work in this venerable medium with any continuity or commitment. Its slow, painstaking pace somehow violates the rhythm of the age, and the economics or contemporary art militate against the investment of time and talent in an object that cannot be easily reproduced. Woodcarving does not lend itself to editions, to shoppingcenter sculpture or blockbuster monuments. We lack, in any case, the craft traditions upon which great achievements in this medium are based.

title: Commerce Head to Act On Shipbuilding Loan
description: WASHINGTON,Jan.13(AP)  Commerce Secretary Elliot L. Richardson said today that he would act before leaving office on a $500 million loan guarantee application, that has become complicated by what he has called questionable commission to a South Korean businessman.

title: Senator Is Optimistic of Action On Proposals for Amateur Sports
description: A United States Senator said yesterday he was optimistic about the chances of Congress passing legislation this year to upgrade America's sagging amateur snorts system.

title: 12 Chateaubriands for John L.
description: Red Smith

title: Kings ,Down 10, Rally to Beat Warriors by 2
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 13 (AP)Richard Washington hit a 25foot jump shot with two seconds remaining to cap a fourthquarter Kansas City rally and give the Kings a 116114 National Basketball Association victory over Golden State tonight.

title: ALEXANDER CAMPBELL, EDITOR AND REPORTER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13Alexander Campbell, author, editor and foreign correspondent for more than four decades, died today of cancer at Sibley Memorial Hospital. He was 64 years old.

title: Doctor Suspended in Hepatitis Dispute Is Practicing in Pennsylvania
description: TRENTON, Jan. 13While the State Board of Medical Examiners has raised its estimate of the number of hepatitis cases attributed to Dr. Peter T. De Marco, from 26 to 94, the suspended physician has resumed treatment of his New Jersey patients by opening an office just across the state border in Morrisville. Pa.

title: C.I.A. Declines Specific Comment On Ties With Brooklyn Professor
description: The Central Intelligence Agency said yesterday that it would not deprive people from voluntarily offering information to their Government, but it declined specific comment on its involvement with a Brooklyn College faculty member.

title: SALES OF NEW CARS INCREASED BY 20.8% FOR EARLY JANUARY
description: DETROIT, Jan. 13Domestic newcar sales increased 20.8 percent in early January from a year ago, according to reports from the four auto companies today.

title: Remembering Those Women Who Like Dresses
description: Reiko, the Japanese woman who used to paint designs on other people's fashions and now paints them on her own, and Halstonoh, everybody knows about Halston. Both showed summer collections yesterdayReiko in her studio on East 87th Street, Halston in his showroom on Seventh Avenuethat seemed destined to make the world safe for the woman who likes to wear dresses. As opposed to the woman who likes to wear miniskirts, bandanas or togas, that is.

title: Outboard Power Race Is Stalled
description: The outboard engine has made the pleasures of boating a reality for rapidly growing number of Americans and, at last count, there were more than 6.5 million outboard rigs on the waters of the United States. Part of this growth came as a direct result of the development of high horsepower engines that opened a totally new market and part resulted from more people turning to recreational boating as an escape from everyday existence.

title: Haywood Back for Tests
description: Spencer Haywood, the Knicks 6foot10inch forward center, is back in New York to undergo further tests beginning today. He returned after consulting with Dr. Robert Kerlan, the Los Angeles Lakers team physician, about the leg injury that has bothered him all season and helped keep him out of 12 games.

title: Racers 4, Whalers 1
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 13 (AP)Frankie Rochon, who had scored just three times all season, got two goals tonight as the Indianapolis Racers defeated the New England Whalers, 41, in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Farewell Addresses
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13In his eloquent and appealing Farewell Address, President Ford emphasized the importance of maintaining and increasing the military power of the United States. When President Eisenhower left office sixteen years ago, he also called for a strong military establishment but emphasized the dangers of letting it get out of hand.

title: Plans for Hatchery Go On, Despite Ontario Pollution
description: Although recent research indicates that the contamination of Lake Ontario and its tributaries may be worse than originally thought, the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation may go ahead and build a S10 million salmon and trout hatchery near the lake anyhow.

title: Volume in Commodity Futures Sets Record of 36.9 Million Contracts
description: Commodity futures trading set a record high for volume in 1976, according to the latest statistical summary issued by the Futures Industry Association.

title: Roald Morton Dies at 64; A Founder of Publication Of Daily Bond Offerings
description: Roald A. Morton of Rye, N. Y., one of the founders of the Blue List of Current Municipal Offerings, a daily financial publication of municipal and corporate bond offerings, died last Tuesday while visiting his farm in Newfare, Vt. He was 64 years old.

title: In Memorium
description: COOPERBelle. On this your birthday in glorious memory of Your devotion and love for me. Your own, Hy.

title: Market Place
description: The random walk approach to investing whereby one buys stocks according to darts thrown at the stock table is being used by a computer programming company to challenge a current investment vogueindex investing.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The Parker Pen Company disclosed today in a filing wiith the Securities and Exchange Commission that it made questionable payments to a foreign distributor of $21,387 in the last five fiscal years. It overbilled the distributor, then kicked back extra amounts. The Janesville, Wis., company also said it was opening an investigation into questionable payments by each of its domestic and foreign subsidiaries.

title: Quarter's Earnings Up for J. P. Morgan And Chemical Corp.
description: Two major New York bank holding companies. J. P. Morgan Inc. and the Chemical New York Corporation, reported yesterday substantial earnings gains during the fourth quarter of last year over the same period of 1975.

title: Gerulaitis Ousts Solomon
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. 13Harold Solomon was upset by Vitas Gerulaitis, 61, 36, 64, tonight in firstround action at the $100,000 World Championship Tennis Birmingham international indoor tournament.

title: O'NEILL PRODS PANEL ON ETHICS FOR HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13Prodded by Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. to go all the way, a House commission began grappling today with trying to write tighter code of ethics for representatives that the House could approve by early March.

title: Money Supply Climbs
description: The New York Federal Reserve Bank reported the nation's basic money supply rose $2 billion to $314.3 billion in the week ended Jan. 5. Page D2.

title: PANAMANIAN LEADER HOPEFUL ON U.S. PACT
description: RIO HATO, Panama, Jan. 13Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, the Panamanian strongman, reclined in a hammock, his bare feet hanging over either side, and puffed contentedly on a long Havana cigar.

title: The Pop Life
description: PEOPLE COMPLAIN that pop stars fall too readily into formulas. Artists will have hits using a certain kind of arrangement or singing about certain subjects or dressed in certain costumes. And then until the hits begin to fall off, they will stick doggedly to what got them their hits in the first place. It's distressing for those who like to think of artists as continually creative, continually questing sorts. But who can blame them, really? As Randy Newman tells us, it's lonely at the top.

title: Ski Courses in Northeast Reported Good, With More Snow on Way
description: With the best ski conditions of the season available across the entire northeast, ski area operators were expecting a sizable invasion of the snow country this weekend. In almost all caseseven at resorts not serviced by snowmaking machinessurfaces were reported as being at least good to excellent. What a revelation this is to me, said Gloria Chadwick, the president and manager of Burke Mountain in Vermont. When I was out West, I used to hear the East offered little more than ice and bare spots to its skiers. At our place, we have nothing but powder.

title: The U.N. Today
BROAD HEALTH PLAN STARTED IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, Jan. 13A comprehensive prepaid health services program, said to be the first citywide, publicly financed health plan in the nation and a possible forerunner of a national health insurance program, got under way here today when state and Federal officials signed contracts with representatives of the Newark Comprehensive Health Services Plan.

title: An Architect Is Charged With Laundering Funds Through Brothel Operator
description: A prominent New York City architect who was said to have laundered his corporation's funds through Xaveria Hollander, the brothel operator, and Joel Kline, a Washington stock manipulator, was indicted in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday on a charge of incometax evasion.

title: Children's Books: P.L. Travers Offers An Opposing View
description: Having had pointed out to me an article in The New York Times of Jan. 7 In Youngsters Books, the Stereotype of Old Age, may I, as a writer of books that children read, put ashes on my head and cry in a loud voice, peccavi!

title: Acadian Schools Giving Up Religion
description: ST. AGATHA, Me.,  The dominant building in each of the little towns along the upper St. John's River Valley in this remote, farthest northern corner of Maine is a Roman Catholic church. In Frenchville, just down the road, it is St. Luce, built of multicolored stone; in fort Kent it is St. Louis, with a lacy wroughtiron steeple; in Lille, it is Mount Carmel, with twin spires, each topped by a trumpeting angel. And here, amid the trackless, snowcovered, gently rolling hills of the back settlements, it is the plain. solid St. Agatha's.

title: New Hampshire Ice Mystery
description: WAKEFIELD, N.H., Jan. 13First, said William McCarthy, choosing his words very carefully, I saw what appeared to be a hole in the ice.

title: Art People
description: BENNI EFRAT draws in chalk on the screen as his films are projected, which sounds terrible but is, in fact, spellbinding. In Putney Bridge, for instance, on top of a chalk pattern already laid down on black paper for a preceding film, he projects a pale, distant view of a London bridge, some boats on the water and boys on the bank skipping stones. That's all.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The Beame administration's highestranking black official, Paul Gibson Jr., announced his resignation as deputy mayor for planning and will return to American Airlines, where he was director of urban affairs. He will be replaced at City Hall by Lucille Rose, the Employment Commissioner. [D12:3.]

title: Rockefeller Says He Will No Longer Play An Active Role in State Republican Affairs
description: Vice President Rockefeller, who has dominated the Republican Party in New York State for nearly 20 years, has told leading Republicans that he will no longer play an active role in the party.

title: Alexander Eliminates Gorman in Straight Sets in Adelaide Tennis
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Jan. 13 (AP) Tom Gorman, who ousted favored Roscoe Tanner a day earlier, was eliminated from a $75,000 international tennis tournament today. He was beaten by John Alexander of Australia, 64, 64.

title: WouldBe Hughes Beneficiary Is Said to Have Lied
description: RENO, Nev., Jan. 13Melvin Dummar, the Utah service station operator who said that he had known Howard R. Hughes, has admitted that he lied about his role in the socalled Mormon will under which he would be a beneficiary of the late billionaire, two lawyers who questioned him said today.

title: FORD SENDS TO CONGRESS FREER CODE FOR AIRLINES
Bullfight Promoter Locks Horns With the Law
description: He tried mightily and almost promoted a little slice of Fifth Avenue into a Plaza de toros yesterday before he was arrested, and this disappointed John Hoffman, because what I was doing was good for New York.

title: Coal Miners Accept Accord
description: LONDON, Jan. 13 (AP)Union leaders of Britain's 262,000 coal miners approved a plan tonight to allow early retirement for their members, averting a possible national mine strike.

title: Stage: Elly Stone In Cockeyed Tiger
description: THERE ARE SOME shows that are simply incomprehensible  or even complexly incomprehensible. The Cockeyed Tiger, which happened to open at the Astor Place Theater last night, is absolutely a case perilously in point.

title: State Senate Raising Allowance for Staff
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13 (UPI)The Senate Republican leadership has decided to follow the lead of the Assembly by increasing each lawmaker's staff allowance by $5,000, a legislative spokesman said today. If the Democrats follow suit, as expected, the total additional cost to the taxpayers would be $300.000.

title: $75,000 in Rare Coins Are Missing From Sotheby Parke Bernet Gallery
description: A collection of rare coins valued at more than $75,000 is missing from the vaults of Sotheby Parke Bernet galleries in New York City, and the chief sleuth of the venerable auction house says the case is one of the big mysteries of his career.

title: Ford to Close New Jersey Plant For One Week Starting Jan. 17
description: The Ford Motor Company said yesterday that it would close its Metuchen, N. J., assembly plant for one week starting Jan. 17 temporarily laying off 1,650 hourly employees.

title: New Hands Are Taking Up the Hammer
description: The American ironwork exhibition that opens today at the Museum of Contemporary Crafts clearly shows, in its 200year overview, that the tradition of the blacksmith never diedalthough in recent decades the practicing blacksmith was becoming an isolated rarity.

title: CANADIANS ACCUSED OF BACKING ARAB BAN
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 15A committee of prominent Canadians issued a lengthy report today giving details of what it said was widespread compliance with the Arab boycott of Israel by Canadian Government agencies, banks and other business organizations.

title: Frances Lee Maclay, 49 Dies; Teacher and Community Leader
description: Frances Lee Maclay, a teacher and community leader, died Sunday in Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. She was 49 years old and a resident of Stamford.

title: Bruins Top Kings, 43, On a Goal by Anderson
description: BOSTON, Jan, 13 (AP)Earl Anderson, who sat out most of last season with a leg injury, scored his sixth goal in 12 games early in the third period tonight to give the Boston Bruins a 43 triumph over the Los Angeles Kings in the National Hockey League.

title: Five Witnesses Asked
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 13 (AP)Mr. Gilmore asked today that his girlfriend, his uncle, his two lawyers and the man who obtained rights to the convict's life story be witnesses to his execution. He is allowed by state law to name five witnesses.

title: Holy Cross 113, Canisius 64
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Jan. 13 (AP)Ronnie Perry, a freshman guard, led a scoring parade with 22 points tonight as Holy Cross trounced Canisius, 11364.

title: LongSought 200Mile Limit Can Turn Tide
description: On a spring weekend in 1960, the destroyer U.S.S. John R. Pierce left Its Norfolk, Va., berth under emergency orders to keep an eye on a Soviet trawler, loaded with electronic gear, which was shadowing our first nuclear sub, the George Washington, on its trial runs.

title: Management Resentment at Having to Retire
description: In the three decades following World War II, Americans added a new and novel phase to their life cycle: retireanent.

title: News Summary
description: Resolving the Cyprus dispute and ac celeration of negotiations for a new Panama Canal treaty are among foreign policy matters that will be given priority by the Carter Administration, according to members of Congress who participated in daylong discussions with Presidentelect Carter, Secretary of Statedesignate Cyrus R. Vance and other Carter aides. The new Administration will also consider ways to alter the ineffective JacksonVanik amendment of 1974, which bars trade concessions to the Soviet Union until there is assurance of liberalized Soviet emigration, and will seek a new strategic arms limitation agreement with Moscow by next October. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: 36 in Congress Deplore Release
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (Reuters)Thirtytwo Senators and four members of the House of Representatives have signed a letter saying that they deplore and deeply regret France's release of Abu Daoud.

title: CALIFANO WOULD BAR U.S. AID TO ABORTION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13Joseph A. Califano Jr., the incoming Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, told Congress today that he was opposed to abortion and would work actively to bar abortions under all Federal health programs, including any national health insurance plan that is enacted.

title: Horsemanship Trophies To Wheeler, Miss Gurney
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 13Kenneth Wheeler, a professional ridertrainer from Keswick, Va., and Hilda Gurney, a member of the 1976 Olympic dressage team, were awarded the horseman and horsewoman of the year trophies today at the opening session of the American Horse Shows Association Convention. The trophies were sponsored by Martini and Rossi. The winners were chosen by yearlong, nationwide balloting of horsemen and horsewomen last year.

title: 3d Candidate in Mine Union Race
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Jan. 13Harry Patrick, secretarytreasurer of the United Mine Workers of America, a former ally of Arnold R. Miller, the union's president, announced today that he would oppose Mr. Miller in the union election in June.

title: 3 Indicted in Tax Haven Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13A Federal grand jury in Miami that has been investigating the illegal use of Caribbean tax havens by United States citizens today charged three men with conspiring to defraud the Government through a complicated commodities trading scheme that made use of trusts in the Cayman Islands.

title: 5 Charged in Sewer Conspiracy
description: TRENTON, Jan. 13 (UPI)Five Morris County men have been charged with conspiring to bribe a Randolph Township official to approve sewage services for a residential development. Named in the $15,000 bribery plot were Robert J. Eckstein, 33 years old, a real estate broker from ParsippanyTroy Hills; Joseph Marinaro, 44, a builder from Morristown; Herbert Steinberg, 56, a real estate broker from Mt. Freedom; Charles Zimmer, 46, an insurance broker from Convent Station, and Stanley Buglione, 47, former, health officer for the Borough of Morristown.

title: Cocoa Futures Rise; Sugar Ebbs
description: Cocoa figures contracts set another record high yesterday on the New York Cocoa Exchange, where the March contract closed at $1.59 55/00 a pound after being as high as $1.61 51/00.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: UNLIKE its American counterpart, British television does not let a series run until it collapses from sheer exhaustion and audience fatigue.
