description: Special to The New York Times

title: Ancient Hebrew Via Computers
description: Yeshiva University in New York and Bar Ilan University in Ramat Gan, Israel, have joined forces in a $1 million project using ultramodern computer technology to make ancient Jewish legal texts accessible to scholars.

title: Deborah Waldner Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs.Tay Dudley Waldner of Glen Ridge, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Deborah Newsom Waldner, to Robert Edward Guttentag, son of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Guttentag of Toronto, where his father is president of Meteor Plywood Ltd. Mr. Waldner, a Glen Ridge councilman, is director of consumer and member services for Edison Electric Institute. Miss Waldner and her fianc are doctoral candidates in developmental psychology at the University of Denver.

title: Hunt and Sharif Khan Reach Racquets Final
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15  Sharif Khan of Toronto, the defending titleholder, and Geoffrey Hunt of Australia reached the final round of the $16,200. North American open squash racquets tournament today at the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Removal of Snow Is Found Lagging On Harlem Streets
description: Asnowremoval job that apparently was so thorough that even Cherokee Place, an obscure blocklong street in the East 70's, had been cleared by lunchtime, brought a smile to the face of a Santitation Department inspector making the rounds of his Manhattan district yesterday.

title: The Cuddy Cabin: A Room Afloat
description: Evolution takes strange turns, but it's thereand the most striking recent example of it in the pleasure boating field has come about in cuddy cabin boats.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Halftime Stole the Show From Super Bowl Teams
description: LOS ANGELESLast Sunday's Super Bowl halftime show, which turned all the spectators into participants, will never happen again in the opinion of Bob Jani, the Disneyland executive responsible for the risk, the gamble and in part the result.

title: Kathryn Sowerwine Is Wed to Librarian
description: Kathryn Evans Sowerwine, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Orvis Sowerwine of Summit, N.J., was married here yesterday to Joseph Donald McMahon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas McMahon of Jamaica Estates, Queens. The Rev. Michael Vincent Thornton performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Teresa's Roman Catholic Church. Margaret Sowerwine was maiciof honor. for her sister and Maj. Thomas McMahon, U.S.A.F., served as his brother's best man.

title: Spinks, Davis Victors In First Pro Fights
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 15 (AP)Two Olympic goldmedal winners, Leon Spinks of St. Louis and Howard Davis of Glen Cove, L.I., made successful professional boxing debuts today.

title: A Player's Solution: Set a Salary Scale
description: Representatives of the National Football League club owners and the National Football League Players Association sat down recently to begin negotiations, for a New collectlite bargaining agreement.

title: U.S.Canada
description: In the following record of observations yesterday at weather stations in the United States, high and low temperatures given are for the 20hour period ended at 8 P.M.; precipitation totals given are for the 24hour period ended at 8 P.M. Weather descriptions are forecasted conditions for today. (All times are in Eastern Standard Time.)

title: Many Choices, All Costly, in the Power Boat Field
description: In many ways, 1977 should represent a year of unparalleled opportunity for buyers of new powerboats; there is something for everyone.

title: Letters
description: Did you hear the one about . . .?

title: Renee J. Harron Fiancee of Ambrose Monell
description: Ingrid Harron of New York and Marbelle, Spain, and Joseph Fralinger Harron of Bacton, Herefordshire, England, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Rene J. Harron, to Ambrose K. Monell, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund C. Monell of Southampton, L.I., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Happiness Is an Equation
description: Travelingbeing a touristis life lived in the extreme: The highs are astonishingly high; the lows are soulcrushing. This obtains because a multitude of new experiences are compressed into a brief space of time, pushing emotions to one or the other end of the scale. But due to the romantic mythology that surrounds the whole notion of travel, we don't talk much about its terrifying aspects; returned voyagers, like Known Soldiers, are apt to screen out from consciousness and conversation the dreadful times they had, leaving us with one more pastel fantasy of the wonders of venturing out.

title: Son to the Anthony D. Dukes
description: A son was born last Monday to Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Drexel Duke at Mount Sinai Hospital. The child has been named Washington Alcebo for his maternal grandfather; Jose Alcebo of Miami, formerly of Havana, and his paternal greatgreatgrandfather, Washington Duke, founder of the American Tobacco Company. His mother is the former Maria de Lourdes (Luly) Alcebo. Her father is chairman and founder of Boys Harbor, a multiservice organization for children from deprived areas.

title: Presidents Come and Go, but the White House Staff Remains
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15As the Presidential swearingin ceremony takes place on the steps of the Capitol at one end of Pennsylvania Avenue on Thursday, there will be anothernot quite so symbolictransfer of power at the other end of the avenue. As the clock strikes 12, the Fords double bedthe only piece of furniture they brought with them to the White Housewill be moved out, and the Carters personal effects, including Rosalynn Carter's sewing machine and Amy's two cats, Sawshoes and Misty Malarkey Yingyan, will be moved in.

title: Carla Schiller, Librarian Fiancee of Jay L. Harwitt
description: Mr. and Mrs. Ronald Schiller of Larchmont, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, . Carla Beth Schiller, to Jay Lewis Harwitt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Harwitt of ,South Hempstead, L.I. The couple will be married next month.

title: O'Mara Heads Mission
description: Donald J. O'Mara has been named general manager of the Mission Marine Power. Boat Group, which consists of Pacemaker Yachts and the Egg Harbor Boat Company. O'Mara also continues as president and general manager of Pacemaker Yachts, Egg Harbor City,N.J.

title: Man Charged in Carter Threat
description: HONOLULU, Jan. 15 (AP)  Secret Service agents arrested a 27yearold man from Oahu on a charge of writing and mailing a letter threatening the life of Presidentelect Carter. Anthony Francis Paolini was arraigned yesterday before Federal .Magistrate Thomas P. Young, who set bail at $10,000. Mr. Paolini is accused of mailing the letter dated Jan. 3. A psychiatric examination was ordered.

title: Boat Show Brochures Are Worth Adding to Your Collection
The Making of a Critic
description: IT seemed logical. Ten Crucial Days: A Children's Learning Environment, the new exhibition at the State Museum on State Street in downtown Trenton, is described as a walkthrough history of a critical period in the American Revolution, a presentation researched and handmade by children for children. So who is better equipped to review it than a child?

title: State vs. Wolves
description: Three years ago Alaska declared aerial war on wolves. Defenders of Wildlife, with headquarters in Washington, has been battling Alaska every winter since then.

title: Knicks Defense Turns Trip Into Horror Show
NURSINGHOME DATA ORDERED RELEASED
description: New York State's highest court has upheld the State Welfare Inspector General's sight to publish a medical billings report critical of nursing home operator in New York City.

title: Occasionally the Violence Stops, but Only for Holidays or ShortLived CeaseFires, Then It Starts Again
description: LONDONMerlyn Rees, until last summer Britain's Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, ended his tenure on a weary note. He had just watched Ulster's politicians fail yet another time to reach a solution to the bloodshed and violence that have slowly, but systematically, destroyed the province for seven years. There is no instant solution, he said, to the problems of Northern Ireland.

title: The Electric War
description: A great national debate is now ragingalbeit at the regional levelabout what kind of energy and how much of it America should consume in the next quarter century. It is about ending dependence on foreign oil. It is about whether Americans should change their patterns of energy consumption, hence their life styles. And, since Great National Debates hitch up every issue to every other issue, it is about, among other things, public regulation of private power and our other old friend Can Military Technology Find Happiness (and Utility) in Civilian Life?

title: Aid Plan for Colleges: Will It Work?; State aid for scholarships and tuition would rise to $80 million
description: THE RECOMMENDATION last week by a special state commission that New Jersey dramatically increase the amount Jersey dramatically increase the of money available for student scholarships and tuition grants and that this money be paid directly to students and not to state colleges is refsing questions and controversy.

title: Barbara Schneider Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Schneider of Jericho, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Barbara Ann Schneider, to Joseph G. Sullivan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph P. Sullivan of Wilbraham, Masss.

title: Chesimard Case Recalls. HallMills
description: NEW BRUNWICK THE trial of Joanne Chesimard, the alleged soul of the socalled Black Liberation Army, is scheduled to begin here tomorrow, and it promises to be the bigest event in this area since the HallMills murder trial 50 years ago.

title: News of Realty
description: Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co. Inc. is moving many of its operations from downtown to the McGrawHill Building at 1221 Avenue of the Americas.

title: 2 on Ford Panel Back Amnesty
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI)Two former officials of President Ford's clemency board proposed today a sweeping program of amnesty and relief for Vietnam draft evaders, deserters and servicemen who were punished for minor antiwar offenses Their program would go far beyond the general amnesty for draft evaders that Jimmy Carter plans to issue his first week in office.

title: DANIEL J. MELOY IS DEAD
description: Daniel Joseph Meloy, a former State Department career officer and expert on Japanese affairs, died on Jan. 7 of an apparent heart attack after a swimming accident while he was vacationing in Yucatan, Mexico. He was 56 years old and lived at 44 Gramercy Park North.

title: Jersey Court Upholds the Variance In Rates Charged by 22 Hospitals
description: TRENTON, Jan. 14 (UPI)New Jersey's highest court ruled yesterday that it was legal for 22 hospitals in the northern part of the state to charge Blue Cross patients less than those covered by other insurance plans.

title: City Money: Who's in Charge?
description: New Yorkers who may have the feeling that they were asleep in the back of the fiscal bus when it plunged off the road, now ask themselves in the midst of the smoking wreckage: Who was driving?

title: BalletFrom Lydia Abarca to Suzanna Zviagina
description: Dr. Samuel Johnson once wrote: To make dictionaries is dull work. Even in his own monumental Dictionary of the English Language, he sourly defined the lexicographer as: A writer of dictionaries, a harmless drudge. It may be dull work and it may be drudgery to produce a dictionary, but I must say I love the results. I am a fiend for dictionaries and encyclopedias. I use the Encyclopedia Brittannica almost every day the old one, rather than that new monstrous misconception of human knowledge. Dictionaries I dote on, and I even use quotation dictionaries. Indeed, I got the two Johnson quotes from the Oxford Dictionary of Quotations. The only reference book I have never found usefulwhether I too stupid or too impatientis Roget's Thesaurus.

title: Egypt and Sudan Sign Pact
description: CAIRO, Jan. 15 (UPI)Egypt and .the Sudan signed a military agreement today aimed et discouraging. dissidents living in. Ethiopia from invading the Sudan in an attempt to depose the government of President Gaafar, alNimeiry.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: INTERVIEW

title: Sometimes, Nothing Succeeds Like a Flop
description: Last night I dreamed that I wrote a Broadway flop, and do you know what? I wasn't embarrassed at all. Because It made pots and pots of money. Be advised: life after death existsat least for certain Broadway flops. There are approximately 40,000 community theaters, stock companies and drama clubs scattered across the country, and these have become an astonishingly rich play ground for entertainments which the churlish New York critics seemingly burled in Shubert Alley.

title: Geoghegan Steeped in Naval and Boating History
description: WASHINGTONOne of the natural resources of the Smithsonian Institution is in the Museum of History and Technology on the fifth floor, where the public can't go. William Earle Geoghegan is not designated a living national treasure, as he would be in Japan. But, with the revival of woodenboat building and the intense interest in the maritime world today in preserving classic American boats, it's worth considering.

title: Campaign Cash: Who And How
New Influence In Committees
description: Often weakened in Congress by disunity and personal ambition in its delegations, the region has increased its influence significantly with the selection of one of its Representatives to head a major committee; another is exnected to be chosen this week.

title: Appeals Judge Refuses to Stop Gilmore Execution
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 15A Federal appellate court judge rejected tonight a move to block the execution Monday of Gary Mark Gilmore, the 36yearold condemned killer.

title: 67th Annual Boat Show Is Launched
description: The red carpeting has been rolled out thousands of yards of itand 375,000 visitors, a record number, were expected to tread across it during the 67th annual National Boat Show which opened a nineday stand at the Coliseum yesterday.

title: Power Squadron, Coast Guard Auxiliary Courses Available
Wood, Field and Stream: Deerslayers
description: When Ohio crossbow enthusiasts take to the woods this winter in quest of deer, they will be part of a growing band of hunters who, for various reasons, wish to kill game with socalled primitive weapons.

title: ART
Miss Comaneci Is Set To Appear at Garden
description: Madison Square Garden announced yesterday that Nadia. Comaneci, the star of the Montreal Olympics, would compete March 12 and 13 in the American Cup gymnastics competition.

title: Moynihan Sends Letter of Protest Over Nomination by Doublespeak
description: For the longest time, Daniel P. Moynihan appeared to have nothing to say about his nomination for a. Doublespeak Award.

title: Murdoch's eighteenth
description: Iris Murdoch's new novel begins with Cato Forbes crossing and recrossing London's Hungerford railway bridge on an April midnight, intent on diwping into the Thames a revolver, after the accomplishing of which the sexual excitement, diffused and vague, remained as a comfort. This excitement has much to do with the fact that the revolver is Beautiful Joe's, a lovely young boy whom Catoa Catholic convert and priest, now ministering to London's deprivedhopes to save from a life of sin and crime.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THE vast majority of homes built in New Jersey since World War II have walls and ceilings made of gypsum board (also referred to as dry wall or Sheetrock, although the latter is actually a brand name for wall paneling). One big advantage of this material is that unlike plaster, the homeowner is much less likely to be troubled by cracks that have to be repaired at frequent intervals.

title: Mary Williams, Frank W. Zurn Wed in Illinois
description: In Christ Episcopal Church in Winnetka, Ill., Friday evening, Mary Anne Margaret Williams became the bride of Frank Willard Zurn. The Rev. William S. Lea performed the ceremony.

title: What's Doing in SAN ANTONIO
description: OVERVIEW  San Antonio, sitting at the edge of the Edwards Plateau in southcentral Texas, is a blend of many culturesSpanish predominatingand a place where the past and present coexist. The Spaniards founded the city in 1718 as a fortress to defend their missions in the area, but it was actually a mission, not a fort, that became the city's most famous battleground: the Mission of San Antonio de Valero, also known as the Alamo. The first nonmilitary or nonclerical inhabitants of ban Antonio were colonists from the Canary Islands, who settled there in 1731. A string of missions, built along rivers in the area, helped early San Antonio to develop as a settlement. The influence of the Franciscan fathers and the Spanish conquistadores waned in the latter part of the 18th century and was replaced in the 1820's and 30's by an influx of landseeking Americans swarming into what was then the Mexican state of Coahuila, which included today's Texas.

title: GARDENING
Marilyn Horne At Home in Orange
description: ORANGE

title: Cup Sailor Tells Of Glory and Agony
description: Two boats will come to the starting line next September 13 off Newport, R.I. for the first race of the 23rd match for the America's Cup. Few can even imagine the effort and dedication required to have arrived there.

title: PORTUGUESE LEFTIST SAYS ALL IS NOT LOST
description: LISBON, Jan. 15Our opinion is that the revolution is not over, an extreme leftist Member of Parliament said. He conceded, however, that the revolutionary left was no longer mobilizing big protest crowds.

title: Boston School Order Stands
Vindolanda: New Insights to England's Past
description: The thrill of a long leap back into time some 1,900 years awaits visitors to the ruins of an old Roman fortress community in the north of England called Vindolanda. Just off the 73 mile complex of forts, towers, and embattlements that is Hadrian's Wall, Vindolanda has for three years now been the center of exciting finds dug up out of the past.

title: H. S. Sherrill Plans to Wed Miss Cooper
description: Mr. and Mrs. E. Kirkland Cooper of Pembroke, Bermuda, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Alexandra Vaughan Cooper, to H. Sinclair Sherrill, son of the Rev. and Mrs. Henry W. Sherrill of Lancaster, N.H.

title: Amy Alcott's Love of Golf Becomes Lucrative Affair
description: Twentyyearold Amy Alcott was among the 10 competitors in the Colgate Triple Crown Friday and yesterday. The youngest member of the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour earned the right to compete in the $50,000 event by earning $71,122 last season in only her second year on the tour. Her seventhplace finish in moneywinning for 1976 placed her among the top 10 and made her eligible to compete in the prestigious event.

title: John Gerbner Is the Fiance Of Anne Jarvis
description: The engagement of Anne Reid Jarvis t0John Christopher Gerbner has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. John Arthur Jarvis of Lancaster, Pa., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Dr. and Mrs. George Gerbner of Ardmore, Pa.

title: Here Are Some Facts About the Show
description: Sponsor: The National Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers.

title: Shipping on the Mississippi Stalled by Ice
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 15Frigid temperatures throughout the Middle West have effectively closed to river traffic a 180 mile stretch of the Mississippi River from this city south to Cairo, Ill., according to Coast Guard officials here.

title: In Defense of Tenure
description: THE concept of tenure for teachers is simple and basic. Stated succinctly, tenure is a right earned after a long probationary period. This right protects against arbitrary dismissal for frivolous, malicious or purely political reasons. It insures that so long as a teacher performs his or her duties, he or she is protected against dismissal or reduction in compensation except for inefficiency, incapacity, or conduct unbecoming a teaching staff member or other just cause.

title: The Might of a Mouse
description: LONG ISLAND Republicans face some hard bargaining with the Conservative Party in this year's county and town electionsbargaining that could well determine the political future of many Republicans from the County Executive on down.
