description: To the Sports Editor:

title: 2 CZECH AIRLINERS COLLIDE ON GROUND
Twelve exquisitely crafted porcelain collector's plates portraying great moments from the stories of America's most beloved author, Mark Twain.
description: Mark Twain, America's bestloved author, was probably the greatest storyteller of all time. His wit, his warmth and his genius for capturing the joys and delights of the American scene endeared him to millions, young and old alike. And the stories he created are read and enjoyed today as they have been for more than a century.

title: Pete Rademacher
CAMERA VIEW
description: To most people the word animation conjures up images of Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck and all those other marvelous cartoons which we used to watch as childrenand which still dominate much of Saturday morning television. The term implies giving life and motion to something inanimate.

title: New Law Paring Budget Requests
description: A NEW law that limits spending by the state is making it harder than ever to prepare budgets for the 197778 fiscal year. The law ties budget increases to growth in the personal income of the state's 7.5 million residents.

title: What Are We To Make Of Remakes?; FILM VIEW; What Are We to Make of Remakes?; FILM VIEW Why Remakes?
description: King Kong and A Star Is Born, two of the season's most expensive and most highly publicized productions, are inaugurating Hollywood's newest remake trend with something less than transcendental excitement while raising serious questions about the mental health of an industry that, when in doubt if not panic, begins dabbling in resurrection.

title: The Last Ford Has Now Left The Foundation
description: Henry Ford 2d has quit as a trustee of the Ford Foundation, and his letter of resignation raises again two common, though possibly contradictory, complaints about the foundation world. They are that sometimes it acts against the interest of the economic system that makes it possible, and that it is not innovative enough.

title: Revolutionary Ensemble at a Club
description: The Revolutionary Ensemble, which performed on Friday evening at the Tin Palace, 324 Bowery, and will be there again next weekend, has survived the 1970's without a personnel change. During this time the group has explored so many facets of improvisational music that even its staunchest fans have found it difficult to keep up.

title: Design
description: A normal conversation between an architect and a client who is building a new house involves such matters as the number of bedrooms required, the family's needs as to kitchen, eating and recreational facilities, its stylistic preferences, and so forth. When architect Charles Moore met four years ago with an Investment banker and his family to begin planning a new house for a site in the outlying suburbs of New York, all of these matters were discussed. But there was another factor as well: The client is blind, and the house had to accommodate his needs above all.

title: Broderick CrawfordFrom Huey Long to J. Edgar Hoover
description: His barbed, seared voice is that of the contentious pink pad of TV's SOS commercials. In fact, the pink pad's voice is Broderick Crawford's, and he admits it unashamed. Hell, for an actor it's doughnuthunting time forever. The takethemoneyandrun days never end! But this week, kid, it's steak and champagne.

title: The Bowling Clinic
description: Throwing the bomb is part of the nomenclature of football. It's also the way his fellow bowling pros describe Mark Roth, the Staten Islander who has come on so fast the last two years on the Professional Bowlers Association tour and has even stolen some of the attention from Earl Anthony.

title: Islanders Defeat Pesky Capitals, 21
Showoff Begonias for the Beginner to Grow
description: All shades of green and mahogany on paper thin or leathery thick leaves? Sound intriguing? Then try the rhizomatous begonias. There are practically endless choices for the group has well over 450 species and cultivars (cultivated varieties). Many of them are well known and readily available. Others are rare and require good detective work to track down.

title: The Idea at the Heckscher: Art
Eisenhower College Is Confident Of Winning in Its Battle to Survive
description: SENECA FALLS, N.Y.After several years of uncertainty and a close brush with extinction in 1974, an air of optimism has fallen on the windswept campus of Eisenhower College along with the winter snows.

title: MidSize Boats Are Dominating the Waterfront
description: Midsize boatsvessels from about 17 feet to 24 feethave dominated boating activity in the past several years. Listen to this Coast Guard Auxiliarist operating out of Rye:

title: RoadPainting Companies Accused Of Antitrust Violations in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Jan. 15 (UPI)Three men whose companies paint the center lines on New Jersey's highways were charged Thursday with violating the state's antitrust laws.

title: The Value of Teaching Tools
description: A report by the Educational Testing Service of Princeton, N.J. has called into question the value of a teaching approach that has sometimes been hailed as, an educational panacea, the use of personalized teaching materials chosen to suit the level of each child.

title: Tribute to a Singer Who Had No Funeral
description: BALDWIN

title: Ship Officers Question Need For Many Aids
description: The art of navigating a vessel safely hasbeen in the news recently because of the breaking up of the Liberian tanker Argo Merchant and the disappedrance in the North Atlantic of the Liberian tanker Grand Zenith. The bridges of modern merchant ships have a bewildering array of navigational and safety gear. This gear includes magnetic and gyro compasses, radar sets, Loran sets, echo sounders, a clock, course recorder, pelorus, engine room telegraph ,smoke detector, whistle pull, binoculars, loud hailer and a set of signal flags. Aft of the bridge, in the chartroom, will be found one or two chronometers, sextants, radio directionfinding apparatus and a set of uptodate charts for the voyage.

title: Mozambique Is Closing Borders to Tourists
description: JOHANNESBURG, Jan. 15 (Agence closed its borders for a month to all tourclosed is borders for a month to all tourists and travelers without official business, it was announced in Maputo, the capital.

title: A kidnapping and a railroading?; Scapegoat
description: No single crime in memory, not even the Kennedy assassination, so outraged America as did the kidnapping and murder of the infant Charles A. Lindbergh Jr. in 1932. Society demanded retribution, and obtained it with the electrocution four years later of Bruno Richard Hauptmann. Here is shattering evidence that we may have slain an innocent man.

title: Martha Washington's Bathing Suit, Jefferson's Fountain Pen and Other Reminders of Our Glorious Revolutionary Past
description: We will never know for sure, though we could make some guesses, which personal belongings the Founding Fathers and other famousand infamous  characters of Revolutionary times would have placed in time capsule for examination 200 years later. Nevertheless, they did leave, intentionally or not, a legacy of assorted effects that conjure up their activities, foibles and habits. The traveler who does not intend to cut short his search for the nation's roots with the end of the Bicentennial Year can find them on view at

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: OUTSIDE of standing in a warm swimming pool, my favorite form of exercise is walking through other people's houses. I have gone on a lot of house tours and remember all but two with pleas tire. The first was one that I inadvertently found myself in charge of 10 years ago in Miami. The complicated logistics put me in such an evil temper that my nearest and dearest could scarcely wait for me to retire to private life.

title: A Kissinger Warning
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has given what will probably stand as his last major declaration in office, and in it he has delivered his version of President Eisenhower's warning. against the dangers of the mllitaryindustrial complex. Mr. Kissinger's message, in effect, is: Beware the Dr. Strangeloves.

title: U.S. JUDGE RELEASES FILES HE HAD SEALED
description: Court documents in a corruption case that had been sealed by Federal judge were released last week, but a legal battle continues in an effort to prevent future documents from being closed to the press and public.

title: A Dance Revolutionary On Broadway
description: After a quarter of a century of being ignored, heckled and then feted at home and in the capitals of the world as a high lama of the American avantgarde, Merce Cunningham is coming to Broadway.

title: Ferry Captain Is a Lifeline in Maine
description: CASCO BAY, Me, Jan. 15 (AP)Almost 2,000 people living on islands off the Maine coast might be cut off from the mainland were it not for the efforts of a 48yearold ferryboat captain.

title: A Little South Of Center
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The Presidential transition period or exhibition season is now over for Mr. Carter. He has picked his assistant coaches and his first and second teams, and has made clear that he will be sending in the plays from the Oval Office.

title: Representing the Rothschilds in New York
description: The New Court Securities Corporation, primary investment vehicle for the Rothschilds in the United States, has not one Frenchman and not one representative of the centuriesold European banking family on the staff. The investment banking, portfolio management and venture capital firm named after the London street where the Rothschild? British bank is based is run by American, Ivy Leaguers. They speak no Trench, with the exception of John P. Birkelund, New Court's president. Mr. Birkelund, a tall, 46 yearold Princeton graduate, describes his Gallic language skills as primitive.

title: Radical Weather Group Leaders Reported Planning to Surrender
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 15 (AP)Leaders of the radical. Weather Underground, including some facing Federal charges, have begun to implement a plan to give themselves up, according to statements attributed to dissident members of the clandestine group.

title: January Thaw
description: The January thaw used to be considered an annual event, almost as predictable as an equinox. But weather patterns change, and the prophet who forecasts the thaw now takes his reputation into his hands at a time when Ms fingers are stiff with cold. It is even risky to predict a January thaw at all. But if there is one, it usually comes about now.

title: Of Slumbering Figs and Winter Dreams
description: AFIG TREE grows in Glen Cove. And when it grows, it is summer. Now, in the winter, it waits. Dormant, along with the others of its kind planted around the Island, it stands hidden under the wraps of a protective shell, sleeping in a humanformed cocoon of warmth, quietly anticipating spring.

title: American in Moscow Finds Cyanide, Mercury in Water
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 15 (Reuters)The United States Embassy's doctor has found cyanide and mercury in potentially harmful amounts in the water supply at two Moscow apartment buildings where foreigners live, an American spokesman said today.

title: Excerpts From Carrillo Interview
Ambergris Ca Gateway to an Undersea Spectacular
description: We swam slowly over the wreckage of the shrimp boat, picking our way across its barnacled rib cage, swiveling our beads like radar scanners. There were sharks in these Central American, waters, we'd been told, and we didn't want to be surprised.

title: New York Help May Come at A High Price
Home Clinic
description: Q: I have acquired an old but handsomely designed butcher block bartable which is scarred and stained. I intend to refinish it, but am not sure whether I want to continue using it as a chopping block, or just as a bar or table. I assume that the refinishing procedure would be different for each purpose, so can you tell me how the finishing procedures would differ?M.G., New York City.

title: Jones Wins First Event On Pro Bowling Tour
description: ALAMEDA, Calif., Jan. 15 (AP)  Steve Jones threw six straight strikes in the final game against Marshall Holman today and won his first tournament on the Professional Bowlers' Association tour.

title: A Thirst for Bottled Water
description: TAP WATER that is safe to drink has long been symbolic of this country's hygienic superiority. Travelers to other parts of the world have traditionally relied on bottled water.

title: The TV Networks Do Combat And the Truisms Come Tumbling Down
Law, Business, Economics
description: Publishers of law, economics and business books generate a considerable amount of pulp. Unlike science fiction and gothics, however, most of the pulp is not even marginally interesting. It will not distract you from the 11 o'clock news, deter you from confecting chocolate fudge brownies, or permit you to put off doing your income taxes.

title: DexterAn Artist Who Pinches Pennies
Article 3  No Title
Yoga Center Head Acquitted in Death Of Boy He Treated
description: GOSHEN, N.Y., Jan. 15An Orange County Court judge has acquitted the founder of a yoga study center in Monroe, N.Y.. of all charges stemming from the death of a 3yearold boy at the center in July 1975.

title: Rabies in Israel
description: A week after a rabid mongrel dog went on a rampage in Jerusalem, biting more than 50 people, 17 dogs and possibly other animals, Israel declared its entire country a danger area. Pet owners were warned last Dec. 11 that dogs and cats wandering unleashed would be destroyed.

title: Egypt's Eggs In a U.S. Basket
description: CAIROEgyptian President Anwar elSadat is ready to go anywhere at any time to see President Carter, after the inauguration, to press his ideas on how to achieve Middle Eastern peace, this year if possible.

title: A SHADOW CABINET SUGGESTED BY FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  President Ford submitted a plan for creating a new Republican coordinating committee to the party's national committee today, but the members postponed action on the question to give their new chairman, Bill Brock, a chance to study it.

title: Joung Ja Kim, Soprano Suggests a Capability
description: Joung Ja Kim's debut at Carnegie Recital Hall last Sunday night showed the young soprano to be capable of achieving some pleasing things as well as displaying much indifferent singing. The voice, often poorly supported, could vacillate between a nonvibrato, instrumental purity and a wide tremolo, and while certain upper tones came through powerfully and cleanly, the lower range seemed undeveloped.

title: Food
description: A new book. Eating in America, A History, has but one remark to make about the White House kitchen:. . . at the moment of writing, there is a French chef there who turns out excellent milk shakes and double hamburgers. Well, there is nothing wrong with firstclass shakes and hamburgers, and the chef is Swiss, not French, but the very fact that a 512page tome on the history of American cuisine has only that to say about White House cooking reflects an unfortunate point: The culinary reputation of the White House dreary indeed.

title: Lanier Paces Offense as Pistons Finally End Braves Jinx, 121105
description: DETROIT, Jan. 15 (AP)  Bob Lanier scored 20 of his gamehigh 30 points in the first half tonight and sparked the Detroit Pistons to a 121105 victory over the Buffalo Braves in a National Basketball Association game. Lanier, inlaying without any ill effects from an inflamed left knee, hit 10 of 11 shots in the first half as Detroit built a 6851 advantage.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Energetic energy writing

title: New &
description: By Antony Trew. 223 pp. New York: St. Martin's Press. $8.95.

title: Ulrich Heads World List Of Senior Tennis Players
description: Torben Ulrich of Denmark leads the senior tennis world rankings for 1976, chosen by Tennis magazine. He won $52,715 and 10 events in the Grand Masters senior circuit in 1976.

title: Restoring the Death Penalty
description: New Jersey will apparently become one of the earliest states to reinstitute the death penalty under conditions intended to satisfy United States Supreme Court rulings in 1972 and 1976 that found the old laws unconstitutional. New York and Connecticut now have death penalty statutes; New Jersey's state Senate gave final legislative approval to a death penalty measure last week.

title: ExAide to Carter Reported Cleared; Expects New Post
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15. (UPI)Greg Schneiders, who was a personal campaign aide to Jimmy Carter, has been cleared of allegations that he illegally received unemployment compensation in 1975. his attorney said today.

title: There's Worse to Come in Coffee
description: Coffee lovers who are gagging on today's unprecedented prices may soon look back on these days nostalgically. At least there's no problem in getting the coffee. In the future, say the experts, the luxury commodity may become scarce indeed.

title: GARDENING
description: AVID New Jersey gardeners are feverishly reading seed catalogues, making lists of the must haves and then mislaying the lists. Which is just as well, because new check marks beside items in the catalogues increase daily until they are so numerous as to lose all meaning. Then one must checkmark the check markswith ink of a different color.

title: Elsie Proxmire to Be Married To Dr. Alan R. Zwerner April 16
description: Senator William Proxmire of Washington and Madison, Wis., and Mrs. Miles McMillin of Madison and Paul Smith's, N.Y.. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elsie Stillman Proxmire, to Dr. Alan Robert Zwerner, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Zwerner of White Plains.

title: Anais Nin, Author Whose Diaries Depicted Intellectual Life, Dead
description: Anais Nin, the Frenchborn novelist and diarist, died Friday night of cancer at CedarsSinai Hospital in Los Angeles. She would have been 74 years old next month.

title: CrossCountry on the Ski Tails
description: ALTHOUGH almost unheard of in the metropolitan area five years ago, crosscountry skiing is becoming popular in New Jersey. Where only one ski area offered the sport in 1971, there are now four such places in the state.

title: William Grubb Reflects Polished Poise on Cello
description: Though his appearance Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall marked William Grubb's New York recital debut. the young cellist is already an experienced performer, and the authority and conviction of his playing reflected it.

title: Education
description: Paul Marantz is a student in the sixyear medical program at Brown University. However, he won't be found in Providence, R.I. He's in New York City, working as a clerk in the medical books department of Barnes & Noble and living in SoHo. At night he works as a saxophonist.

title: Dr. King's 48th Birthday Is Celebrated at Church Where He Was CoPastor
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 15(AP)  Strains of We Shall Overcome filled the red brick church where the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. once preached as crowds gathered today to celebrate the slain civil rights leader's birthday.

title: Older Suburbs, Feeling Age, Seek Downtown Renewals
Andrea Lynn Alexander Fiancee of B. A. Clark 3d
description: Irene K. Alexander of Lloyd Harbor, Huntington, L.I., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Andrea Lynn Alexander, to Bernard A. Clark 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clark Jr. of Hagerstown, Md. The prospective bride is a daughter also of Dr. John T. Alexander of Huntington, L.I., chief of the emergency department at Huntington Hospital.

title: William L. Ham Marries Deborah Ellen Finehout
description: Deborah Ellen Finehout daughter of Patricia Mason Finehout of Plainfield, N. J., and Robert Milton Finehout of Chicago, was married in Plainfield yesterday afternoon to William Lawrence Ham, son of Mr. and Mrs. Isaac Duncan Ham Jr. of Greensboro, N. C.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Southerners Senate is dying out. By 1980. Chandler estimates that only one of the major Senate committees will be chaired by a Southerner at a time when regional defensiveness seems to be receding as well. Moreover, three million newlyregistered black voters have already had a major impact on state legislatures and governorships, the training ground for future leadership. The example of Jimmy Carter will surely have a profound effect on the political style and substance of the region, presumably sending racial moderates like the current governors to the Congress. What will the Club look like in 10 years? The author doesn't discuss that but the New South Congressmen and Senators will have a proud tradition to draw on, even though the Southern Senators whose politics ruled them out of the Club are rarely mentioned in this bookTennessee's Estes Kefauver and Albert Gore, Alabama's Lister Hill Texas's Ralph Yarborough, North Carolina's Frank Graham and South Carolina's Olin Johnston  Southern progressives whose careers gave a measure of credibility and authenticity to the candidacy of the first Southern President in a hun

title: Teacher and Pasarell Gain Aussie Semifinals
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Jan. 15 (UPI) Brian Teacher edged thirdseeded Dick Stoekton, 76, 76, tonight in the quarterfinals of the $75,000 Marlboro South Australian men's tennis tourament. Teacher will play Charlie Pasarell in the semifinals tomorrow.

title: Outlawed Spanish Reds Put Faith in Democratic Process
Pamela A. Raymont Fiancee Of Charles J. Simpson Jr.
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Manley Raymont of Huntington, L. I., have announcedthe engagement of their daughter, Pamela Anne Raymont, to Charles Jasper Simpson Jr., who is in his first year at the Georgetown University Law Center.

title: EILEEN SHANAHAN NAMED AS ASSISTANT AT H.E.W.
Cummings First in 3:59.2
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 15, (AP)Paul Cummings ran the first sub4minute mile of the indoor track season and Steve Riddick captured the two dashes today to highlight the 17th Sunkist invitational track meet.

title: Driving Slowly Up Capitol Hill
description: Jimmy Carter's deliberate approach to Government, already evident in his choice of a Cabinet, has now been applied to his planning of a legislative program. The new team, profiting from its members familiarity with the ways of the bureaucracy, the Congressional committees and the press, plans no precedentshattering innovations in a first Hundred Days blitz. On the contrary, it seeks to establish the reality of solid competence and firm control.

title: Seeing the Light in Its Setting
description: A BRIGHT new concept In illumination came to light recently when the South Bay ElectriCenter opened its showroomwarehousesupply headquarters to the public at 460 Waverly Avenue in Patchogue.

title: LIBERALS REJECTED. ON A PLEA TO CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15In what Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, called political litmus test of the new administration, Presidentelect Carter and his advisers were urged to appoint a strongly liberal and unorthodox thinker to the Council of Economic Advisers but have rejected that advice.

title: Concorde Diverted to Baltimore
description: LINTHICUM, Md., Jan. 14 (AP)An Air France Concorde jet with 37 passengers was forced to land at the BaltimoreWashington International Airport. tonight, due to icecovered runways at its scheduled destination, Dulles Airport in northern Virginia. An Air France spokesman. said the plane would be flown to Dulles tomorrow.

title: Snow at Camp David Graces Fords Visit
description: CAMP DAVID, Md., Jan. 15 (AP)President and Mrs. Ford are spending their last weekend here at Camp David with longtime friends, amid picturesque snowy surroundings.

title: The Nation
description: Through four long days last week the Senate Judiciary Committee held hearings on Presidentelect Carter's most controversial Cabinet choice: Griffin B. Bell of Georgia to be Attorney General. The hearings were televised by Public Broadcasting, and they offered a considerable civic education. For they gave unusual insight into the constitutional process of Senate confirmationits purpose and its politics.

title: DINING OUT
description: Geiger's, 560 Springfield Avenue, Westfield. (201) 2332260 GEIGER'S is one of the first restaurants in its area to adopt the excellent practice of offering smaller portions on most dinner items. In a world where so many people never have enough to eat, the wastage at most American restaurants is just short of criminal.

title: Sumter F. Hazzard Engaged to Peter Adolph
description: Sumter Fraser Hazzard and Peter William Adolph, graduates of the University of Virginia, will be married in March.

title: Stony Brook's Growing Pains
description: THE chancellor of the State University of New York, Dr. Ernest L. Boyer says he cannot see any basic conflict between the Stony Brook center's demand for a 21,600student main campus and his central administration's plans.

title: Vance's Talks In Peking in' 75 Are Published
SORENSEN APPROVAL BY SENATE AS HEAD OF C.I.A. IS IN DOUBT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  Presidentelect Carter's selection of Theodore C. Sorensen to be Director of Central Intelligence ran into unexpected difficulty in the Senate today, with a growing possibility that the nomination might be withdrawn.

title: AUDIT SHOWS $25,000 MISSING FROM AGENCY
description: A fullscale internal audit in New York City's Department of Consumer Affairs has uncovered the disappearances of at least $25,000 in fines that were collected but apparently not recorded in the department's books.

title: Ranger Trainee Dies in Swamp
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., Jan. 15 (AP)One soldier is deal and.another is missing after several members of a 37man Ranger training platoon became separated from the main group Thursday night in the Yellow River Swamp in a rainstorm, Army officials said. Identities were withheld, pending notification of next of kin Camp Rutter officials said the soldier apparently died of overexposure.

title: Louis A. Albarracin, 78, Dies
description: Louis A. Albarracin, a former senior vice president in the international department of the Chase Manhattan Bank, died Monday night in Richmond (Va.) Memorial Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived in Kilmarnock, Va.

title: 2 Public Hearings Set By City Council Units
description: The following public hearings will be held by New York City Council committees this week.

title: Garrett John Peyton To Wed Julie Lange
description: Julie Abbott Lange, an environmental educator with the Beaver Brook Association in Hollis, N.H., and Garrett John Peyton, a teacher in Troy, N.Y., will be. married Feb. 19 in Dayton, Ohio.

title: Carter's Proposal for Withdrawal From South Korea Is Uniting Political Foes There in Rising Concern
description: SEOUL, South KoreaPresidentelect Carter's proposed withdrawal of American troops from this divided peninsula has aroused strong opposition on all sides of the political spectrum In South Korea and some new worries in Japan.

title: Cauthen Rides 5 More Winners And Sets Record of 23 in Week
description: Steve Cauthen, the 16yearold wonder boy from Walton, Ky., turned in another series of sparkling riding performances yesterday at Aqueduct as he set a riding mark in New York for a oneweek stand.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayNimrod Farm, Route 57, Weston, Conn. Regular, suitable and children's working hunters; open jumpers, equitation. 9 A.M.

title: Carefully Selected Accessories Will Increase Angler's Pleasure
description: With the addition of carefully selected accessories, almost any boat can be altered to increase an angler's enjoyment on the water and help him to catch more fish. In fact, many items are now classified as necessities rather than accessories because they are so important to piscatorial success.

title: Museum For All People
description: TWO current exhibits at the Newark Museum underline the democratic, ecumenical spirit of a showplace that displays all kinds of works in an attempt to reach a vast urban public of different backgrounds and styles of life. They also demonstrate that the institution does not follow an inflexible policy of displaying only the traditional high art forms.

title: Havel, Czech Playwright, Reported Under Arrest
description: VIENNA, Jan, 15 (AP)Vaclav Havel, the Czechoslovak playwright who was among the signers of a humanrights manifesto known as Charter 77, has been arrested in Prague, his wife said today.

title: Miss Burtchaell Fiancee Of Theodore S. Ingalls
description: Donna Margaret Burtchaell, a buyer with Singer Media Services, a Boston advertising agency, and Theodore Smith Ingalls of Boston will be married in March.

title: CrossCountry Ski Areas
description: GREAT GORGE NORTHTrail fee, $3(9 A.M.10:45 P.M.). Equipment rental fee: $5, weekdays; $7, weekends. Group lessons, $6.50; private lessons, $15:

title: The Intercity Bus Strikes Back: Lowest Fares in 25 Years
description: After years of losing longdistance travelers to cars, planes and trains, the nation's two largest intercity bus companies, Greyhound Lines and Continental Trailways, have come up with a novel way of selling bus tickets. They're just about giving them away.

title: A Choice Site, A Sale, a Gift, A Tax Issue
Eve Binswanger Is Engaged to Leighton A. Wildrick
description: The engagement of Eve Binswanger to Leighton Andrew Wildrick has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Frank G. Binswanger Jr. of Jenkintown, Pa. A spring wedding is planned.

title: 60,000 Attend Opening Of Festival in Lagos
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 15Sixty thousand spectators crammed into the national stadium here today to watch black artists and performers from 48 nations in the opening ceremony of the Second World Black and African Festival of Art and Culture.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated.

title: Anthony Eden
description: History will almost certainly deal more kindly with Anthony Eden than the more nearsighted chroniclers of contemporary events. In the fickle eye of popularity, the sum of his career is distorted by excessive expectations of greatness shattered by a single lapse of judgment.

title: CHESS
description: Why is it that players who have long espoused a limited opening repertoire, as well as those who come to a tournament with a special arsenal for the occasion, are so quick to drop what they are well versed in for the sake of trying something new?

title: Interest Groups Gave Vital Help To Key Senators
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The 14 major committee chairmen who will largely control the Senate for the next two years received nearly $900,000 in campaign contributions from special interest groups the last time they ran, or about $1 of every $5 they spent to win reelection.

title: Israeli and Arab Agents Go on Killing Each Other
description: In Paris, a Palestinian agent turns the ignition key in his car and is blown to bits. In Madrid, an Israeli undercover man is shot dead at midday on the Gran Via, a major shopping street. In Norway, a Morrocan waiter is mistaken for a top Palestinian agent and gunned down by an Israeli hit team. It all sounds like the work of John Le Carr or Len Deighton.

title: Now That They Need Jordan, Arabs Again Take It Seriously
description: DAMASCUSSyria and Egypt, newly reconciled since an Arab leadership conference halted the war in Lebanon less than three months ago, are now bringing King Hussein back into the Arab lineup by seeking to add Jordan to their joint political command. This is part of the Arab governments' attempt to work out an integrated political strategy for the negotiations on a Middle East settlement that are expected to start in Geneva this spring or summer. It is also part of the continuing process of taming the Palestinians and making sure that they will not become the rock on which the negotiation falters before it begins.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: CARLE PLACE EVERY morning, like thousands of other Long Islanders, Sal Patane hauls himself out of bed, grabs some breakfast and sets out for work. Sal is among the lucky few who can walk to work: His job is just seconds away from his home here, up a rickety flight of steps that lead to his attic workshop.

title: He Clothes Ringo, Elton, Dustin and the Governor
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.To survive in the clothing business, you need sense of humor or a tendency towards depravity, said Berny Ross Schwartz, president of Eric Ross & Company, Beverly Hills store that has outfitted everyone from actor Paul Newman to former California Senator John V. Tunney. The cost of everything is inflated todayfabrics, labor, even electricity. The only thing that has not risen in price is the ego.

title: A Methadone Substitute
description: A partial solution to one of the drawbacks of methadone maintenance programs may now be at hand in a related drug called methadyl acetate. Unlike methadone, methadyl acetate need not be taken every day: Three times a week are enough. But like methadone, methadyl acetate relieves the symptoms of heroin withdrawal without producing any euphoria.

title: Zero Mostel Is A Force of Nature
description: I am sorely tempted to pronounce Zero Mostel simply unreviewable and let it go at that. What is one to say of him? That he is a magnificent, wholly legitimate, actor capable of tearing your heart out as he bends himself double, brow pouring sweat, over the milkcart he must push on alone? No, you can't quite say that, indelible as the image is in Fiddler on the Roof, because just a few minutes earlier in the same Fiddler on the Roof he has been bringing down the house with a crosseyed grimacetongue lolling wildlycontorted enough to resurrect vaudeville, burlesque, and possibly the commedia del l'arte in one great swivel of his head. The swivel undercuts the sweat, the seriousness of the second image can't be taken at face value because of what the man has so recently been doing with his face.

title: For Supers, More Pay And More Pressure
A Former Nixon Aide is Indicted For Improper Hiring Practices
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP)A former Nixon Administration official was indicted by a Federal grand pury yesterday for conducting a partisan hiring program in violation of Civil Service rules.

title: Many Drops to Drink
Music: Folkloric
description: It is easily possible, even for a constant reviewer, to go through whole music seasons in New York without ever hearing a song by Bartk. And yet the Hungarian composer was deeply interested in vocal music and his researches into folk tunes and texts were among the most important contributions made in musical ethnology early in this century. Why, then, is his vocal output neglected?

title: Jeanne Fonseca, an Editor, Married to Philip Brennan
description: Jeanne Devlin Fonseca, a widow and an associate editor of Nursing Outlook, a national professional magazine, was married yesterday morning to Philip J. Brennan of Brooklyn. The Rev. Harold Theriault performed the ceremony in St. Vincent De Paul Roman Catholic Church.

title: Celestial Navigation Courses
description: Courses in celestial navigation and oceanography will be offered next month in New York City and Stamford, Conn., by the Long Island Sound chapter Of the Oceanic Society. The society is a nonprofit membership organization working to preserve the marine environment through education, conservation and research.

title: 12 Die in Canadian Crash
description: TERRACE, British Columbia, Jan. 15 (AP)A small twinengine passenger plane crashed last night in a snowstorm two miles south of the airport of this western Canadian community, killing all 12 persons aboard, the Royal Candian Mounted Police reported.

title: Robert Frost
description: In 1934, Robert Newdick, a young professor of English at Ohio State University, wrote a letter of warm praise to a poet whose work he especially admired. The professor ventured to Suggest a regrouping of the poet's Selected Poems as an aid to students. Accept, he said, my personal salute to you as a beautyandtruthrevealing American poet. The poet was flattered out of his boots. He sought in his turn to flatter the professor in the cleverest possible way: by asking for advice. The two men quickly became friends, and, by September 1935, it had been agreed that Newdick would become Robert Frost's official biographer. Newdick's labors were cut short by his sudden death of appendicitis four years later, but the hundredodd pages of his manuscript have now been published, together with a large apparatus compounded of research find . ings and a narrative of the Frost

title: Playing up to Toscunini
How to Get to the Boat Show
description: Here are the hours, admission fees and a description of the public transportation to the 67th National Boat Show that opened to the public yesterday at the Coliseum, Columbus Circle, Manhattan, between West 58th and West 60th streets.

title: BUSINESS ROUNDUP.
Editors Choice
description: Fiction & Poetry

title: The Natural Superiority Of Southern Politicians
description: When Richard Nixon learned that Senator Sam Ervin of North Carolina would be chairman of the special Senate Committee investigating the Watergate breakins, he moaned on the tape to John Dean:

title: Article 13  No Title
description: ABOUT LONG ISLAND

title: Events Today
description: SKIRMISH AT THE VALENTINEVARIAN HOUSE: recreation of the Revolutionary War engagement In which Hessian troops were routed by Colonial soldiers: 1 P.M. Bainbridge Avenue and 208th Street, the Bronx.

title: Washington's star stargazer
description: It's an autumn day like any other in Washington, D.C., during an election year, and a case of Capitol nerves shudders through the air. Senator A is worried about his reelection chances, and examines his options: He can consult with his strategists about his strong and weak points; he can read the latest polls to ascertain how insecure he should feel; he can talk with his spies in the opposition camp or he can check CBS and The New York Times to see how he is coming across to the media. But reelection isn't his only problemhis mistress is threatening to do Elizabeth Ray imitations, his wife is vaguely aware of what's going on and he can't go to a psychiatrist because it might look bad. So instead of visiting a variety of consultants for his various traumas (heightening the risk of discovery), this senator does what an increasing number of Washingtonians are doing these days. He turns to the one person he can really trust: his astrologer.

title: Births
description: Brokaw

title: Halaby, the New Saudi Traffic Director
description: Najeeb E. Halaby, whose problems as chairman of Pan American World Airways included a shortage of air travelers on that airline's 747's, is currently tackling a very different problem in Saudi Arabia: too many travelers.

title: Fredericks's Surge Wins 4Mile Relay
description: HANOVER, N.H., Jan. 15  Greg Fredericks overtook Joe Savage on the final turn and gave the Philadelphia Pioneer Club a narrow victory over the New York Athletic Club in the fourmile relay today at the eighth annual Dartmouth relays. Fredericks, the former Americanrecord holder in the 10,000meter run, made up an 80yard deficit with his anchor leg of 4 minutes 0.5 seconds. The Pioneers final time was 16:28.8, almost 10 seconds over the world indoor record set by Villanova at this meet last year.

title: For young readers
description: It is springtime in Holland, 1995. People are planting marigolds. Under the German occupation they had been forbidden to do so. Orange was the color of the royal family.

title: St. john's, on Home Court, Bows to Manhattan,7167
description: Either Manhattan is the best college basketball team in the metropolitan area all of a sudden or the Jaspers are just on a rampage of upsets for a while Time will tell.

title: Cynthia Ford Fiancee of L. T. Paddock Jr.
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. James A. Ford of Stamford, Conn., of the engagement of their daughter, Cynthia Ford, to L. Turner Paddock Jr. of Billings, Mont., son of Mr. and Mrs. Laurence T. Paddock of Boulder, Colo.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
Memoirs of a Former Horse Owner
description: I am a $2 bettor and happy to be one. I can think of no finer way to start the day than by plugging in the coffee maker and the electronic calculator. and snapping open a fresh copy of the Daily Racing Form. Nor is there any finer way to pass an afternoon than out at the track, belly up to the rail screaming for some long shot to catch the favorite, chasing, a dream with a deuce.

title: Fashion
description: Peter the Great was a 6foot8inch giant of a man who straddled cultures in his size14 boots. At home in his boyar court, he wore traditional caftans of Oriental splendorone was limegreen brocade, worked with white leaves and small blue flowers; another was Russianwoven peach moir silk with wide gold galloons (scalloped lace trim).

title: Scott Wins Open Title For Fifth Straight Year
description: Special to The New York Times

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The 1977 Presidential Inaugural Committee has announced the final details of sizes, metals and prices for the official Jimmy Carter Inaugural medal. As frequently emphasized in this column, there can be only one official inaugural medal, and that one is illustrated at right. There will be many other commemoratives (in fact, heavy advertising for a number of themincluding some lookalikeshas already started in the hobby press as well as in regular newspapers and magazines), but only this one has the imprimatur of the Inaugural Committee. The singular title official will guarantee this medal's entry into future editions of recognized catalogues or guidebooks on this increasingly popular medallic series. These include Richard B. Dusterberg's The Official Inaugural Medals of the Presidents of the United States, and Neil MacNeil's authoritative new reference book entitld The President's Medal, 17891977.

title: POLITICS
description: GOVERNOR Byrne is continuing his political strategy of acting like a candidate and looking like a candidate without formally announcing whether he intends to run for a second term.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 9:30 A.M. (Channel 4) Here and Now: Francis T. Purcell, presiding supervisor, Town of Hempstead.

title: DR. MORIKAWA HAILS NEEDIEST CASES FUND
England in Command Of 3d Cricket Test
description: MADRAS, India, Jan. 15 (Reuters) England once again exploited India's weakness against pace and took command of the third test here today.

title: Watts Presents AllWatts Evening
description: John Watts of the Composers Theater put together an entire program of his own music Friday night at the New School's May Theater on Fifth Avenue. The first half was mostly electronic and the second half was mostly instrumental, and the first half was easily the more interesting.

title: DINING OUT
description: Cheong's Garden, 190 Hempstead Turnpike, West Hempstead. 2921650.THE diner's vocabulary expands at an amazing rate. Moo shu pork, Hunan beef, hacked chicken and hotandsour soupvirtual unknowns just a few years agoare becoming commonplace. Doors to every Chinese province have been opening, offering variety, spice and interest.

title: Columbia Routs Cornell For 5th in Row by 8052
description: Columbia played Cornell in a basketball game last night at Levien Gymnasium and about the only trouble the Lions had was with their lockerroom showers.

title: HOME CLINIC
Key Decision on Arab Boycott
description: An attempt by the Justice Department to use the antitrust laws to prevent United States companies from complying with the Arab boycott of Israel has ended in an agreement whose terms may become guidelines for other American firms doing business with Arab countries.

title: Dates, Places, Casualties of an Underground War
Katherine L. Mertz Engaged
description: Mrs. Edward Lloyd Mertz of Port Washington, L.I., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Katherine Lloyd Mertz, to Todd Richard Schonenberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman J. Schonenberg of Setauket, L.I. The future bride, daughter also of the late Mr. Mertz, is a senior at Gettysburg College. Her fianc graduated from Gettysburg with the class of '73. A September wedding is planned.

title: Reservists Learn, Do and Wait
description: HAMPTON BAYS COAST GUARD reservists at the Shinnecock station here man and repair patrol boats, help regular Coast Guard personnel with paper work, clean floors, cook meals and operate the radio room. During the summer they regularly patrol the waters around this resort town, waters that can resemble the Long Island Expressway during rush hour.

title: MISUSE OF FUNDS IN FIGHT ON ALCOHOLISM IS HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI)A report to Congress by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare shows that some organizations getting Government grants to help fight alcoholism may have misused the money.

title: Short Hair Is Back in Vogueby Order of the Court
description: Hair length is cropping up again as an issue in labor relations. Six Circuit Courts of Appeals have ruled recently that employers may require short hair on their male employees without requiring the same of their female workersin spite of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 which forbids discrimination on the basis of sex.

title: Home Style
description: Block power lives! in fact; it is thriving. New York City now has more than 10,000 block associations andfiscal crisis or nothe city has accelerated its aid to the groups. Last fall, the first citywide conference for block association leaders was held, with smaller, borough meetings to be conducted throughout the year. And several city agencies stand ready to guide new organizations through their first days.

title: Lawyers Dogs Win Many Decisions
description: A client looking for a leading champion in the highly competitive world of dogs just might do well to consult a lawyer. Two top contenders have started off the year by racking up more bestinshow victories in different parts of the nation, proving that their metropolitan area attorneyowners asof tuteness goes far beyond the courtroom. Dominator and Gatsby are respectively owned by Michael Weissman of Yonkers and Robert A. Koeppel of New York.

title: Sunday Observer
U.S. Ships Back In St. Lawrence
description: CHICAGOIt was a time for celebrating. The Marjorie Lykes was hauling her 14,286 tons through the St. Lawrence Seaway system, making calls at Detroit and Milwaukee.

title: Book Ends
description: Carteriana. The Presidential campaign did not generate an abundance of books on the candidates and the issues at the time, but once Mr. Carter became a serious contender things picked up and when he won they picked up even more. Here with some of the Carterrelated books scheduled for upcoming months.

title: OldWorld Flavor:
description: WHAT is an Italian deli? This is a question that many who live outside of the New York metropolitan area might well ask. Let's drink a toast and shed a tear for them. As Long Islanders, we are fortunate to know the answerit is a place where the food tastes good. Italian delis whisper to us one of the secrets of Old World wisdomeating is pleasure, Eating good Italian food is an event to be savored, an affirmation of one's own aliveness.

title: Stephen L. Yake Will Marry Harriet Heldenfels May 28
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard Ransom Heldenfels of Newport News, Va., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Harriet Ransom Heldenfels, to Stephen Lincoln Yake, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Lincoln Yake of Cohasset, Mass.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: 1977 The New York Times Company

title: KENNETH LEWIS PECK
description: Kenneth Lewis Peck, founder and chairman of Peck & Hale, manufacturer Of cargo securing devices, died Friday at the Patchogue, L.I., Nursing Center after a long illness. He was 70 years old and lived in Sayville, L.I. He leaves his wife, theformer Virginia Gould; a daughter, Shirley Schultz; a sister, Marjorie, and three grandchildren.

title: Prudence E. Lewis Married
description: St. James' Episcopal Church was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Prudence Ellen Lewis, daughter of Mrs. Douglas Leigh of New York and Wolfram Lewis of Santa Fe, N.M., to Carlile BoltonSmith Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. BoltonSmith of Georgetown, Washington. Bishop Horace W. B. Donegan, retired Bishop of New York, performed the ceremony. A reception was held at the River Club.

title: Sadat and Husein Plan a P .L .O. Role
description: ASWAN, Egypt, Jan. 15King Hussein of Jordan and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt ended two days of talks here today after agreeing on a statement calling for a separate Palestinian delegation to the Middle East peace talks in Geneva. They also agreed to strengthen CairoAmman relations.

title: The P.S.C. Says Con Edison Took Too Long to Reopen Plant
description: A study by the staff of the New York State Public Service Commission has found that because of poor planning, the Consolidated Edison Company's Indian Point 2 nuclear power plant was out of service last year for four months longer than necessary, at a cost to consumers of about $32.5 million.

title: This Week in Sports
Notes: JetSet Pets, A Growing Breed
description: The pet travel agency business is still small, but it's taking a larger bite of tourist revenue every year. Connecticut  based Cosmopolitan Canine Carriers, the largest organization in the field, moved 4,000 animals last year. And Frank Filipelli, coowner of Pet Transport of New York, formed two year ago, says: I believe the ceiling for our operation is unlimited. We're straining at the leash.

title: NEW YORK CITY GIVES BANKS ANOTHER PLAN
description: New York City's banks have received new proposal from municipal officials on how the city would repay nearly $1 billion in shortterm notes. The proposal calls for an immediate offering of $300 million in Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds and a subsequent issue of some kind of new city bond.

title: WOMAN VISITING A FRIEND. IS KILLED BY INTRUDERS
A Merger Proposed For Health Plans
description: BLUE CROSS and Blue Shield in New Jersey have so much in common that many subscribers to their respective hospital and Surgical insurance Plans wrongly assue that two are the same thing. The fact is they are not, although the state's Department OR Insurance is trying to change that.

title: Mr. Smith Is Pessimistic
description: The five black African nations actively promoting a black majority government for Rhodesia have given their support to two nationalist leaders to the exclusion of other blacks represented at the adjourned Geneva talks on Rhodesia's future. Last week's decision  by the presidents of Mozambique, Angola, Tanzania, Zambia and Botswanasharply reduced the chance that the negotiations, due to have resumed tomorrow but postponed indefinitely, will continue, and increased the likelihood that fighting will intensify between the Rhodesian Government and the nationalist guerrillas and among the nationalist factions themselves.

title: America's Cup: All Aboard
description: Newport is going to sing this summer, really swing and sing. The America's Cup campaign coming up will be grand indeed and who cares where all the money comes from as long as it keeps coming?

title: Katherine Whitner McKay Belk Engaged To Charles Walker Morris, a Teacher
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Milburn Belk of Charlotte, N.C., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Katherine Whitner McKay Belk, to Charles Walker Morris, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Speight Morris of Greensboro, N.C.

title: MAYOR URGED TO BLOCK BRONX POLICE TRANSFERS
description: Led by Representative Mario Biaggi, 15 elected Bronx officials, including Representative Herman Badillo and Borough President Robert Abrams yesterday urged Mayor Beame to block the planned transfer of 200 police officers from the Bronx to other boroughs.

title: Nadim Gargour to Marry Patricia McCormick
description: Dr. and Mrs. John J. McCormick of Great Neck and Westhampton Beach, L.I., and Jamaica have announced the engagement of their daughter, Patricia Jean McCormick, to Nadim John Gargour. son of Mr.. and Mrs. John Garaour of Amman, Jordan.

title: FiveDay People's Inauguration Begins in Capital Tuesday
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15Hawkers are selling plastic peanut buttons for $1.25 on Connecticut Avenue. Workmen, shivering in the cold, are hammering thin wooden bleachers into the stands beside the White House. At the old neoRoman Union Station, volunteers are hauling in crates of red and blue taffeta in advance of the two nights next week when thousands of people will surge into the hall for square and folk dancing.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: THE longtalkedabout scheme to run some Conrail Erie Lackawanna commuter trains directly from New Jersey into Pennsylvania Station in Manhattan got a new spark of life last week.

title: ROBBERY SUSPECT SEIZED At. THE NEW YORK HILTON
description: A 22yearold Brooklyn man was arrested in a room at the New. York Hilton Hotel early yesterday morning as a suspect in a string of robberies since July 1976, when he was released from Federal prison after serving three years on bankrobbery charges, the police and the Federal Bureau of Investigation reported last night

title: And Now a Word for That Forgotten Man, the Older Athlete
description: Why are the sports accomplishments of talented juveniles made much of, while Mal Dixon, a 46yearold football player for Fairleigh Dickinson University, seldom makes the sports pages? I don't emulate or necessarily condone what Dixon does, but I do appreciate his spunk.

title: Elena Marquand Dies at 45
description: Elena Susannah Coward Marquand, a former editor at Random House, died Thursday of cancer at her home in Manhattan. She was 45 years old and also lived in Edgartown, Martha's Vineyard, Mass.

title: Concorde Has Surprise Landing
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 15 (UPI)The Concorde made an unexpected debut at Baltimore Washington International Airport when slick runways prevented it from landing as scheduled at Dulles Airport in northern Virginia. The Air France supersonic airliner arriving from Paris landed at 6:03 P.M.

title: More Pay at the Top of the Ladder
description: The pricetag for new company presidents and chief executive officers is going to jump in 1977. The demand is strong because many recessionscarred companies, now sensing greater stability in the economy, want to build a strong top management to head into 1980. The supply is weak because people in their 40's, the prime age for corporate leaders, are scarce. They are Depression babies, born when the nation's birth rate was low.

title: 2 More Held in Reporter's Slaying As Phoenix Suspect Pleads Guilty
NEW LAW ON MATERNITY CHALLENGED BY INSURERS
description: The commercial health insurance industry has filed suit challenging the constitutionality of a New York State law that requires all buyers of illness and accident insurance to buy maternitybenefit insurance too.

title: Nancy Kolzak Engaged to Randel Barnett
description: The engagement of Nancy Elizabeth Kolzak to Randel Gale Barnett has been announced by Dolores Curran Snow of Alexandria, Va., mother of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. David L. Barnett, also of Alexandria. A May wedding is planned.

title: Cara Lebowitz Engaged
description: The engagement of Cara Lebowitz to Dr. Leonard Michael Kagan has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Abraham J. Lebowitz of Valley Stream, L. I., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elias R. Kagan of Elmont, L. I. Miss Lebowitz is a senior at Cornell University. Dr. Kagan graduated from Union College and the New York Medical College.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: SISTER O'REILLY, 85, DIES
description: Sister Thomas Aquinas O'Reilly, former dean of the College of New Rochelle, died Wednesday at New Rochelle hospital. She was 85 years old and lived at the college.

title: Several Thousand Buildings in the U.S. Now Depend on Solar Energy for Heat
description: When Jimmy Carter takes his place in the reviewing stand to oversee the inaugural parade on Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington Thursday, the Presidential feet and those of his companions will be kept warm from heat generated by four portable solar energy units set up at the rear of the stand. Water heated to approximately 150 degrees Fahrenheit by solar collector panels on towering triangular units will circulate through conventional finned convector tubes along the baseboard of the reviewing stand.

title: Jack Davidson in Recital
description: Jack Davison, a bassbaritone who appeared in his recital debut last Sunday in Town Hall, has an impressive assortment of previous engagements to list in his program biography, including several of our best regional opera companies. His recital was devoted exclusively to the song literature, however, and he proved himself as masterly an exponent or this moreintimate form as one suspects him to be of the broader, more overtly dramatic operatic literature.

title: A Secret Nuclear Weapon
ExInmate Leads Alcatraz Tours
Stephanie Russell Wed to T. A. Tombrello Jr.
description: Stephanie Merton Russell, youth program coordinator at the Van Nuys (Calif.) Psychiatric Hospital, was married yesterday afternoon to Thomas A. Tombrello Jr., a professor of physics and director of the W. K. Kellogg Radiation Laboratory at the California Institute of Technology.

title: Woods Are Full of Spies in Vienna
description: VIENNA, Jan. 15Austrian security officials are reporting a boom in the spying business in Vienna in the form of what they term an influx of intelligence operatives from big powers and notsobig powers.

title: TV VIEW
description: A new production of The Man In the Iron Mask starring Richard Chamberlain will be presented on NBC tomorrow night at 9, and thereby hangs a tale of network programming and giant sponsors. A.T.&T.'s Bell System has been firmly settled in broadcasting since at least 1940, when the Bell Telephone Hour began to conduct its selfproclaimed pursuit of excellence in music. The format was transposed in the mid50's to TV where it had a run of about nine years before succumbing to the scourge of skyrocketing costs and relatively low ratings. According to John Howland, in charge of all sponsoring arrangements at A.T.&T., the programs were so good that nobody watched them. The company felt it could not continue to justify the large budgets required to record the program at events such as the International Spoleto Festival.

title: Amritraj Gains Final
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 15 (AP) Viljay Amritraj of India defeated Richard Lewis of England, 75, 46, 76, 57, 61 and Tim Wilkinson. of the United States beat Chris Lewis of New Zealand, 46, 76, 64, 62, in the semifinals at an international tennis tournament today.

title: The Furor Surrounding Abu Daoud
Sandy Johnson Wed to Robert S. Jessup
Commons Will Honor Eden
description: LONDON, Jan. 15 (AP)Special ceremonies in the House of Commons Monday will honor former Prime. Minister Anthony Eden, who died yesterday at the age of 79. Prime Minister James Callaghan is to pay a personal tribute and the Commons will then adjourn in his memory.

title: T V: SitCom to Documentary
description: By scheduling chance, the content flavor of tonight's programming is unusually Jewish, from situation comedy silliness to documentary tragedy. The sitcom is CBS's Busting Loose, which features Adam Arkin as Lenny Markowitz in a vehicle designed as New York version of Happy Days, one of ABC's most popular series. The executive producers (and writers of the first episode) are Mark Rothman and Lowell Ganz, formerly the producersof Laverne and Shirley, another of ABC's most, popular series. Their new concoction will begin its popularity bid at 8:30 P.M.

title: Scanlon Falls To Connors By 63, 63
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. 16 (UPI)Jinimy Connors, in the opening event of the 1977 World Championship Tennis tour, today captured his fourth consecutive Birmingham International indoor tournament, defeating Bill Scanlon of Dallas, 63, 63.

title: Inaugural Route: Scene Unchanged. Since 61
description: WASHINGTONIt was Inauguration Day in 1961. when President Kennedy, riding in the inaugural parade, noted that the parade's route down Pennsylvania Avenue took him past as much urban blight as Federal grandeur. He was so concerned that he appointed a commission to undertake the renewal of the avenue, and the commission, with much fanfare, proposed an elaborate program that would have virtually rebuilt Pennsylvania Avenue's north side from the Capitol to the White House.

title: U.S. Estimate of Soviet Defenses Questioned in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 16Although the Soviet Union has an elaborate civil defense programso detailed that some city residents know precisely to which coach in which train they are assigned for evacuationa number of Western attaches, foreign diplomats and Russians are skeptical about its effectiveness in helping the country survive a nuclear attack.

title: Miss Evert Triumphs
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Jan. 16 (AP)Chris Evert regained her accustomed spot at the top of women's tennis today. beating Margaret Court, 63, 64, for the $20,000 title in a $100,000 indoor tournament at the Sportatorium here.

title: Eden Is to Be Buried In His Village Today
description: ALVEDISTON, England, Jan. 16 (AP) Anthony Eden is to be buried at noon tomorrow in the parish church cemetery here In his home village, his family announced today. The former Prime Minister, who became Lord Avon in 1961. died Friday at the age of 79.

title: Rabin Vows Abu Daoud Will Be Brought to Trial
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 16 (Reuters)Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin promised today that Israel would make every effort to bring Abu Daoud, the Palestinian guerrilla leader, to trial.

title: CORRECTION
description: It was incorrectly reported in The Times Thursday that Lieut. Viktor I. Belenko had witnessed the shooting of a deserter from the Soviet Air Force. Lieutenant Belenko, who defected to the United States Sept. 6, only reported to American interrogators that he had heard of such an incident.

title: Shanghai Posters Praise Teng as Old Faithful
description: SHANGHAI, Jan. 16 (Reuters)A campaign to rehabilitate Teng Hsiaoping emdrged today on the streets of this city, China's largest and until recently the stronghold of radicals who are enemies of the purged former deputy prime minister.

title: 600 Run in Marathon Despite Icy Conditions
description: ASBURY PARK, Jan. 16The sixth annual Jersey Shore Marathon, one of the country's most prestigious longdistance races, was run today under extraordinarily treacherous conditions.

title: Gilmore Faces Execution at Dawn
description: POINT OF THE MOUNTAIN, Utah, Monday, Jan. 17The State of Utah made the final preparations yesterday to execute Gary Mark Gilmore at sunrise today and to end a 10year moratorium on the death penalty in the United States.

title: Venezuela Says Official Collected Boeing Bribe
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Jan. 16 (Reuters) President Carlos Andres Perez has ordered the arrest of an executive of the national airline, Viasa, who is alleged to haire collected a $500,000 bribe in the form of an illegal commission on the purchase of a Boeing aircraft, an official statement said today.

title: Dr. Samuel Cohen Is Appointed To a Post in Jewish National Fund
description: Dr. Samuel I. Cohen has been named executive vice president of the Jewish National Fund of America. He succeeds Abram Salomon, who died last October. The fund is the afforestation and landreclamation arm of the World Zionist movement.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Needlest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Carrier the Exotic Site As Boxing Goes to Sea
Gilmore Faces Execution at Dawn
description: POINT OF THE MOUNTAIN, Utah, Jan. 16The State of Utah made the final preparations today to execute Gary Mark Gilmore at sunrise tomorrow and to end a 10year moratorium on the death penalty in the United Slates.

description: Music

title: SAXBE SEES INDIA'S TIES WITH SOVIET IN DECLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (Reuters)William Saxbe, former United States Ambassador to India, says he believes that the honeymoon is about over between India and the Soviet Union because the Indians, are beginning to feel they have been used.

title: Unbeaten San Francisco: A Return to Glory Days
A Slap at the Decorating Mystique
description: Are American consumersespeclaily the younger onesfed up with interior designers, highpriced furniture and the mystique of decorating? And do they have more taste than American manufacturers give them credit for? Terence Conran, an energetic English interior designer, thinks so, and he is ready to do something about it.

title: Pact in 11Month Strike
description: Some 800 workers at the NL Industries plant in Sayreville have decided to end their 11month strike, but they say they will not go back to work until another union reaches agreement on a new contract. The members of Local 83660 of the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union voted 620 to 133 late Saturday to ratify a contract accord worked out by their leaders with NL Industries, which manufactures titanium pigments for paint.

title: U.S. Underwriters Hopeful About B.P. Sale
Losing Streak Ends, 52, With Soetaert in Goal
Florio Is Preparing To Run for Governor
description: Representative James J. Florio, Democrat of Gloucester and Camden Counties, has told a meeting of Atlantic County mayors and political leaders in Mullica Township in Atlantic County that he would formally announce his candidacy for Governor before the end of January. He said Governor Byrne could not win reelection, either in a primary or general election, and could only lead the Democratic candidates for the Legislature to a onesided disaster.

title: Commodities
Music : India's Premier Film Singer
description: When Westerners think of Indian music, most of them think of the classical style as represented by Ravi Shankar or Ali Akbar Khan. But the music one hears in most Indian households, and in most of this city's Indian restaurants, is Indian film music, and the reigning queen of the idiom, Lata Mangeshkar, gave a rare public performance Saturday evening at the Felt Forum.

title: 5 Arab Oil Lands Defer Aid to Egypt and Syria
description: CAIRO, Jan. 16 (AP)Foreign ministers of five Arab oilproducing countries have deferred a decision on more financial aid for Egypt and Syria until the leaders of their countries meet in March, a Foreign Ministry source said today.

title: An ExConvict's 202Page Manual Offers Legal Advice to Prisoners
description: A selfeducated jailhouse lawyer has written a 202page manual on how prisoners can sue to improve conditions in prisons or to reduce the time they have to serve.

title: Cost of Ford's Plan for Combating Spread of Nuclear Arms Is Put at $2.8 Billion Over the Next 3 Years
Steel Union Leadership Fight Could Have Wide Effect
description: , Some people call Ed Sadlowski the  Jimmy Carter of the steel mills, with his warmth and smile propelling his populist campaign for the presidency of the United Steelworkers of America.

title: Nets Suffer 10th Straight Loss, 10691
description: BOSTON, Jan. 16The score was a little different and the faces of the opponents had changed, but for the New York Nets this afternoon the outcome was depressingly familiaranother defeat.

title: Issue and Debate
description: The newest buzz word on Wall Street is internalization, with brokers, specialists, block traders and stock exchange officials either looking forward to or concerned about its implications. With indications that the Securities and Exchange Commission may reach a decision on this subject before too long, the forces in the financial community for and against its implementation are marshaling their manpower and financial resources for what could be the final battle.

title: Livers Wins Triple Jump, Meet Honors
description: HANOVER, N.H., Jan.16Ron Livers of San Jose State set a meet record in the triple jump at the Dartmouth Relays today with a mark of 54 feet 9 inches, just 8 inches short of Tommy Haynes's American indoor reoord.

title: 18 Injured in Evacuation Of Plane in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 16 (UPI)Eighteen persons were injured today when a chartered plane caught fire on a runway at Baltimore  Washington International Airport and had to be evacuated.

title: Lietzke Defeats Littler in Playoff Of Tucson Golf
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Jan. 16What do you have to do to gain your first victory on the pro golf tour?

title: Sabres 3, Rockies 0
description: BUFFALO Jan. 16 (AP)Gerry Desjardins, Buffalo's goalie, registered his third shutout of the N.H.L. season tonight as the Sabres defeated the Colorado Rockies, 30.

title: L.I. Schoolboy Sets Mark on 7Foot Jump
description: Greg Thompson, competing in his first season on boards, became the only high school junior ever to clear 7 feet in the high Jump indoors yesterday at the 21st annual St. Francis Prep Games in the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Skiing
description: AT KITZBUEHEL, AUS.

title: Meeting of Basque Mayors Blocked by the Police
description: MADRID, Jan 16 (Reuters)The police today stopped Basque mayors from gathering near Pamplona to discuss regional grieyances.

title: Serrano Retains Crown
description: GUAYAQUIL, Ecuador, Jan. 16 (Reuters)Samuel Serrano of Puerto Rico retained his World Boxing Association junior lightweight title when he knocked out Ecuador's Alberto Herrera in the 11th round tonight.

title: OpenHouse Guests Open Hearts And Give $400 to the Neediest
description: An annual open house In tribute to Charles Dickens's A Christmas Carol brightened the holiday season for friends of Alan R. Thompson and brought a gift of $400 to the 65th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Beggars Proliferate on. Mexico City Streets
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 16Every day, more and more Mexicans can be seen on the sidewalks of the capital playing music for money, selling fruit, or simply touching their stomachs as a sign of hunger and begging for the price of a meal.

title: Wanted: Rabbi for a Congregation on Long Island
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I.A synagogue often takes on the name of its rabbi, while its real name is almost forgotten. Thus, for 23 years the Jewish Community Center here was known to many as Rabbi Moseson's congregation.

title: Letters
description: Enforcing Wage/Price Curbs

title: Chesimard Trial to Open
description: The murder trial of Joanne Chesimard, a leading figure in the socalled Black Liberation Army, begins today under tight security that could include body searches and the use of metal detectors near the courtroom. Miss Chesimard, who is charged with the murders of a state trooper, the wounding of another trooper and the death of one of her companions in a shootout in the New Jersey Turnpike on May 3, 1973, will be taken to the courtroom under heavy guard and through a tunnel that will keep her from public hallways.

title: How Metropolitah Area Democrats Got on Inaugural List
description: auguration planning process in. Washington, Democrats from the metropolitan region sent listsnames of people who worked for Jimmy Carter's campaign, names or people who gave rnony to Jimmy Carter's campaign, names of people who just always get invited to things like Presidential inaugurations.

title: Caravan Protests New Jersey Tax.
description: A caravan of about 125 cars led by a hearse toured through eight Essex County, N.J., communities yesterday to call attention to opposition to the state's new income tax. The motorcade, organized by a group calling itself, United. Taxpayers, began In Nutley and ended. in Cedar Grove, 20 miles away. The cars, which had their headlights on, had signs plastered on their sides expressing opposition to the state income tax. Organizers of the event said the procession had been met with support. Passing cars honked their horns in approval and shoppers stopped and waved as the caravan passed, they said.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: A while back, when a letter from Karen Butterfield stated that her husband was most desirous of finding a shop that sold kitchen utensils for lefthanded people, I was, to say the least, a trifle amused to think that such utensils might conceivably exist.

title: Budget Unit Reviews Food Stamps
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16The cash value of food stamps is enough to bring about onequarter of poor recipients above the poverty line, a Congressional Budget Office report has found.

title: Benefit Concert Held for Children Of Woman Who Vanished in '76
description: BALDWIN. L.I., Jan. 16Music had been Florance Busacca's life, and today an audience of 300 sat in respectful silence through a concert of classical music that was a benefit for her children and a tribute to her.

title: Stenmark Takes World Cup Slalom With Gros 2d
description: KITZBUEHEL, Austria, Jan. 16 (AP) Ingemar Stenmark won his third straight slalom today, but Franz Klammer, Austria's downhill ace, blocked the Swede's bid for the World Cup lead. Stenmark won the slalom with a combined time of 1 minute 39.63 seconds. He was tied for the fastest time in the first run with Piero Gros of Italy at 47.66 seconds, but was the fastest in the second with 51.97.

title: 2 Angolan Soldiers Are Executed For Killing Portuguese Technician
description: LUANDA, Angola, Jan. 16 (Agence FrancePresse)Two Angolan soldiers were publicly executed by firing squad yesterday for the killing of a Portuguese technician. The court president who sentenced them to death said that their crime encouraged the departure of skilled European workers the country needed.

title: First Sunday Racing at Yonkers Gets Snowy Sendoff
description: YONKERS, Jan. 16Sunday afternoon harness racing in metropolitan New York was introduced under highly unfavorable weather conditions at Yonkers Raceway today, but the innovation. nevertheless was a success.

title: Market Place
description: The Bank of Virginia Company gave investors some bad news last Fridaytelling them it had set aside an additional $8.2 million in reserves for fore, closed propertiesand its stock reacted accordingly.

title: Cultural Renaissance Is Under Way in West Africa
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 16That Africa once produced great art is no longer in dispute. What is not so commonly acknowledged is the breadth and vitality of contemporary African culture. This is the hidden message of the Second World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture, which opened here yesterday.

title: Moscow's Rusty Triangle
description: There was a time when analysts spoke of East Germany, Poland and Czechoslovakia as Moscow's iron triangle. Despite periodic tensions, these East European dependencies were more reliable and generally more compliant with Soviet wishesand their Soviet occupation forcesthan the Communist buffers to the south: heretical Yugoslavia and Albania, nationalistic Rumania and the once openly rebellious Hungary.

title: Austrians Deplore A Call for Missiles By Defense Chief
description: VIENNA, Jan. 16Austria's Defense Minister has stirred a controversy here by suggesting publicly what army officers have been contending for some time that this neutral country needs defensive missiles of limited range.

title: 31 Dead in TrainBus Crash
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 16 (Reuters)At least 31 persons were killed and 22 injured when a train struck a bus at a rail crossing northwest of Mexico City today, the police said. They said the impact had sent the bus hurtling into a private car.

title: David Rockefeller Leaves China
description: TOKYO, Jan. 16 (AP)David Rockefeller, president of the board of the Chase Manhattan Bank, left Peking today after a visit to China, the official Chinese press agency, Hsinhua, said today. During his visit he talked with Chinese leaders, including Deputy Prime Minister Li Hslennien, the secondranking member of the governing hierarchy.

title: Think
description: WASHINGTONNever in American political history has one corporation so completely dominated the top levels of any Administration.

title: Aqueduct Jockeys

description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16The Federal Bureau of Investigation today arrested a 23yearold University of California student and charged him with spying for the Soviet Government during the past 18 months.
