description: AT WESTON. CONN.

title: Improprieties at Bridge Championships Reported
description: Two of the nation's most successful tournament players, who stunned the bridge world a week ago when they withdrew from the most important event in American competition at the point of almost certain victory, did so after having been summoned before a special committee to answer accusations of improprieties.

title: Genesco Relaxing Corporate Bureaucracy
description: Genesco Inc., the country's largest producer and retailer of apparel, is moving very rapidly to relax some of the excessive operating controls that hurt executive morale, according to its new management.

title: Homage Paid Jelly Roll Morton
description: The kind of success that always eluded Jelly Roll Morton in what he called that cruel city, New York, finally arrived Saturday evening, 35 years after his death. Carnegie Hall was all but. filled by a warmly enthusiastic audience that had come to hear his music played by a recreation of his distinctive sixpiece band, the Red Hot Peppers, in Bob Greene's World of Jelly Roll Morton.

title: JAMES W. SASSER DIES, PUBLICITY EXECUTIVE, 51
description: James W. Sasser, a former New York newspaper reporter who became a public relations executive, died Friday in New Orleans after a threemonth illness. He was 51 years old.

title: Memorial Services
description: CHAMBERLAINLaslia LaIsh, suddenly on Tuesday, Nov. 23, 1976. Memorial Service TUSSdlY, Jan. IS, 1977, 4:30 P.M., St. James Episcopal Church. Madison Ave., at 71st St.

title: The Editors Notebook
description: Venice is sinking; the Acropolis is crumbling. Western culture is biodegradable. The architectural monument of postindustrial society is the shopping center, not the Parthenon. Art may be eternal but only plastic lasts.

title: F.B.I. Reports Death Toll In Bombings Fell in 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (UPI)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation reported today a decline in the toll of death and injury from bombings in the first 11 months of 1976 as against the same period the previous year.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Books of The Times
description: Norval White had a splendid idea, and he has more or less pulled it off. Mr. White, who is chairman of the department of architecture at City College and was coauthor of the American Institute of Architects Guide to New York City, decided to put together an alphabetical encyclopedia for the layman of all things architectural; there are entries ranging from the wellknown Alvar Aalto, the great Finnish architect, to. the more obscure zoophorps, the procession of sculpted animals in has relief on a frieze.

title: DR. GIUSEPPE CARONIA DIES
description: ROME, Jan. 16 (AP)Dr. Giuseppe Caronia, an internationally known pediatrician and author of numerous works on child health and children's infectious diseases, died of a heart attack at his home here yesterday. He was 92 years old.

title: End of New York City Support of Senior Colleges Of City U. Is Urged by Temporary Commission
description: The Temporary Commission on City Finances, rejecting the recommendation of a subcommittee, urged yesterday that New York City terminate all financial support for the senior colleges of the City University of New York, starting July 1.

title: A Beame Reelection Strategy Seems to Be Taking Shape
description: Mayor Beame is not expected to announce his candidacy for reelection for another month or more, but he is clearly signaling that he will run and is just waiting for the opportune moment to make the announcement. His likely strategy has been made clear in conversations with Democrats close to him. Even the Mayor's prospective foes concede that he has come a long way since the depths of New York City's fiscal crisis, when he seemed to be a mere bystander to the rescue efforts of Governor Carey and leading bankers and businessmen. Then, there was even talk of removing him from office to restore confidence in the city. Now, the Mayor, who will be 71 years old in March, is not signaling retirement but a run for reelection. The signs are plentiful.

title: Talks Seek to Avert Staten Island Rail Strike
description: Efforts continued late yetterday to avert a strike this morning against the deficitridden Staten Island Rapid Transit line, used by about 9,000 commuters each weekday. Talks at the Holiday Inn of Staten Island involved the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Harry D. Bickford of the National Mediation Board and a 48member local of the Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, which is asking for the same pay and working conditions that prevail on other transit lines operated by the M.T.A.

title: 2COAST MEN ACCUSED OF SOVIET SPY PLOT
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16The Federal Bureau of Investigation today arrested a 23yearold University of California student and charged him with spying for the Soviet Government during the past 18 months.

title: TALMADGE TO OFFER BILL ON FARM PROPS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16A new farm bill containing provisions that are likely to revive subsidy payments to farmers will be introduced tomorrow by the Senate Agriculture Committee chairman, Herman E. Talmadge. The measure would tie farm price supports to growers production costs for the first time.

title: Train Derails in Alabama, Sending 149 to Hospitals
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. 16 (UPI)Ten cars of a southbound Amtrak passenger train derailed north of here early today, sending 149 passengers and crew members to hospitals. There were no reports of serious injuries.

title: Recital: Flutist
description: It's not the easiest thing in the world to establish oneself as a woodwind soloist, but Paula Robison, who opened a threeconcert series called Paula and  at Alice Tully Hall Saturday afternoon, seems to have done it. Miss Robison's program notes  claim she has more than 100 concerts scheduled each season, with 38 of them during 197677 in New York.

title: Chess :
description: Which player on the international circuit gets on more of his colleagues' nerves than any other? That's easynine out of ten grandmasters would instantly nominate Henrique Mecking, the onetime Brazilian enfant terrible who will celebrate his 25th birthday this Sunday.

title: Raymond DeVoe, 82, A Retired Financier And Executive, Dies
description: Raymond Forsyth DeVoe Sr., retired Wall Street financier and Continental Can Company executive, died yesterday at the Community Hospital in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 82 years old and lived in Boca Raton. Fla.

title: Richard J. Daley, a Consummate Man
description: CHICAGOSome commentary following the death of Mayor Daley proves Shakespeare was right in saying the good that men do is oft interred with their bones.

College Results
PRICE DROP LEAVES OUTLOOK UNCERTAIN IN CREDIT MARKETS
Pressure Seen in OPEC To Abolish 2Tier Pricing
description: Even as Saudi Arabia continues to complete plans for its war for oil price moderation, pressure appears to be building within the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries for an end to the twotier price system that has been in effect for only two weeks.

title: A Telecast of 1933 King Kong Canceled Because of New Movie

title: Advertising

title: Supporters Question the Success Of Tanzania's Decade of Socialism

title: Passaic Residents Get a Chance To Tell the City How to Improve
description: PASSAIC, Jan. 16The 55,000 residents of this city have been given what almost every resident of every city has long soughtthe chance to tell officials what should be done to make their town better than it is.

description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 16 (AP)Marquette, led by Butch Lee's 27 points, broke open a tight game early in the second half and sent Notre Dame to its fourth consecutive defeat, 7869, today in college basketball.

description: NIAMEY, Niger, Jan. 16The Government of neighboring Benin reported today that its troops had routed a number of unidentified armed men who landed at a military airfield overnight and launched an attack on the city of Cotonou.

description: A state mediator continued efforts early today to reach a settlement in the strike by musicians against the New York City Ballet. Midnight passed with no action by the company, which had threatened to cancel the remaining four weeks of its winter season unless the musicians had ended their fiveweek walkout by then.

title: Luxon Sings Schubert Lieder
description: Schubert's song cycle Die Schne Mullerin is the music that probably springs to mind first when the subject of lieder is brought up, and with good reason. Its text is not the deepest or most intellectual, but what Schubert did with it sums up the German song tradition. Every intelligent singer wants to be tested against such tremendous music, and Benjamin Luxon is no exception.

title: Latin Leaders Appeal to Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP)At least seven Latin American leaders have joined In addressing a personal message to Presidentelect Carter stressing the importance for their region of quickly negotiating a new Panama Canal treaty yielding substantial control of the waterway and its zone to Panama.

title: Mihajlov, on a Fast In Yugoslav Prison, Is Reported Very Ill
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 16Family members reported today that the dissident writer Mihajlo Mihajlov is in dangerous condition as a result of a protracted hunger strike in the prison where he is serving seven years for having criticized the Tito Government.

title: JOANNE CHESIMARD FACES TRIAL TODAY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Jan. 16The murder trial of JoAnn Chesimard, a leading figure in the socalled Black Liberation Army, begins tomorrow under, tight security that could include body searches of some of those attending the trial and the use of metal detectors near the courtroom.

title: Treaty Isolates Continent From Rivalries7 Nations Claim Slices of Region
description: Negotiations to be conducted in the coming months may well determine the fate of the world's last unexploited continentAntarctica. At stake are its mineral deposits and, of more immediate concern, its offshore food and fuel resources.

title: Economic Problems Widen QuebecOttawa Schism
description: MONTREAL, Jan, 16The political and economic climate in Quebec and in Canada generally appears to have worsened in recent weeks as conflicts between Quebec and federal authorities in Ottawa have sharpened. A Quebec Minister has called Ottawa a foreign power and battle lines are being drawn over the issue of independence for this Frenchspeaking province.

description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 16Old Washington says it has got the cold shoulder from the Carter people and is feeling left out of the action as the inauguration nears.

The 16yearold high school junior found some time today and he won the New York. State ski jumping championship and, the Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Cup.

This will also be the first independently produced featurelength play to be housed at the midtown showcase, a thriving base for the performing arts.

title: Leonard Silk
description: SOUTHAMPTON, EnglandThere remains a doughtiness to the British people that carries them through hard times. We don't panic, said Kenneth Porter, British mechanical engineer on the train down to Southampton from London. It was slightly ironic, however, that Mr. Porter had just taken a job with a French company that manufactures printing equipmenton the basis of exclusively developed French technology, as Mr. Porter's brochure stated. Yet things have been looking up in Britain for the last week, in the wake of the two big loans, totaling almost $7 billion, from the International Monetary Fund and the Bank for International Settlements. The pound has strengthened, and so has the British stock market.

title: Music: Lively
description: Sergiu Comissiona, guest conductor of the American Symphony Orchestra yesterday afternoon in Carnegie Hall; led an enjoyable concert that opened with a belated Bicentennial bang, the Festival Overture by Dudley Buck. Written in 1882, the piece is tremendously appealingnot so much for its skillful romp through themes from The StarSpangled Banner but simply for its irrepressible optimism.

title: Superb A Sorrow Beyond Dreams, Dramatic Monologue About Suicide
description: The death of a mother. That and nothing else is the subject matter and the focus of a wonderfully dramatic monologue by Peter Handke called A Sorrow Beyond Dreams, which the Phoenix Theater company introduced last night at the Marymount Manhattan Theater. It is a document of impassioned grief, the documentary of the life of a woman who, as the author so poignantly says, was cheated of her own biography.

Who should lose?

description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 16 (AP)Weeklong floods along the Parana River have inundated scores of small farming communities in northern Argentina and forced the evacuation of more than 1,000 residents, the police said today. No casualties or major damage have been reported.

title: Overview of PreBaroque Music By New York Renaissance Band
description: The New York Renaissance Band, a group specializing in preBaroque instrumental music, hs augmented its forces this seasonmore krummhorns, racketts, sackbuts, shawms as well as a lutenist and a countertenor to provide tonal contrast to all those marvelous snarling, buzzing, deliciously spicy medieval instruments.

description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. This city's elected officials are once again facing a controversy that has set not only town against town but also scientist against scientist.

title: 'Get Charlie Tully,' Movie By British, Rather Funny
description: Underwear and bottoms. They are the underpinnings for generations of British music-hall humor. The pound has shrunk but not the poundageto judge, at least, by the new British movie "Get Charlie Tully."This offering of ponderous jokes and broad acting, which opened yesterday at the Fine Arts Theater, has a sneaky appeal. It is not camp. The jokes are often old and corny, but we are not asked to laugh on the grounds that they are old and corny. We are asked to laugh on the ground that they are funny.It is refreshing. It ismaybe sentimentality is involvedtouching, like a parade of Chelsea pensioners. And some of the jokes, in fact, are funny.At the start, the arch con man, Charlie Tully, is sitting in a Buckingham Palace officenever mind howselling a gullible Italian industrialist the hand of Princess Anne for a consideration of several hundred thousand pounds. At the end, Charlie Tully is dressed as a monsignor and selling the Sistine Chapel to a pair of American tourists.In between, he is pursued by the law, by a gang of rough London gangsters and by a Mafia detachment seeking to avenge the Italian industrialist. Apart from these diversionary incidents, Tully's main concern is finding the Swiss bank number that harbors the Princess Anne bridal money. It was deposited there by an associate on whom a wall fell before he could disclose the number.As it happens, the number is tattooed, in sections, on the bottoms of four young women with whom the associate was on friendly terms. A lot of dressing and undressing takes place.As Tully, Dick Emery is energetic and sometimes funny, though his timing and mugging are such that you get the feeling that a cheering audience has been placed behind the camera. Far better is Ronald Fraser as the associate. Mr. Fraser has two owl eyes, a ginger mustache, a long nose stuffed full of adenoids and a lovely faith that things will turn out well. Unfortunately there's that wall.The movie is rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"). Children in particular are likely to be delighted by the film's abundant use of posterior disclosure.

title: Where Do You Eat When You Have Your Day in Court?

title: Outsiders Assistance in Union Elections
description: WASHINGTONThe resolution of a question now being raised by president I. W. Abel and the official family of the United Steelworkers in their efforts to repel the challenge of Ed Sadlowski and his reform group may prove to be as important to the future of tradeunion democracy as the outcome of the union's presidential election itself.

title: Manila Schedules a Trial for 10 Accused of AntiMarcos Plots
description: MANILA, Jan. 16 (UPI)Military authorities said today that 10 persons, including three Americans, will go on trial before a military tribunal Feb. 7 on charges of plotting to assassinate President Ferdinand E. Marcos. Conviction could bring the death penalty.

title: Hispanic Groups Say They Are Inequitably Treated in Support for Arts
description: Hispanic artists and art organizations expressed concern yesterday that at a time when their art forms were expanding in scope and popularity, the level of state support was not.

title: Thievery at Yale Museum
description: More than $34,000 in cash has been stolen from Yale's Peabody Museum, and a 22yearold secretary there has been charged with larceny in the case. The theft will mean that some puolic displays at the museum will have to be curtailed, said Prof. Keith Thomson, acting museum director.

title: Dowries in India Attacked As Degrading Wornen's Role
description: LUCKNOW, India, Jan. 13One hot rainy night a couple of years ago, a 24yearold engineer named Ashok Lal, acting with the help of his father and his sister, strangled his wife in the kitchen of their middleclass apartment here, and burned her body with kerosene.

description: WALTHAM, Mass., Jan. 16 (AP)Susan Kellyand Andy Stroukoff of the Skating club of, Boston tnolt the gold dance crown in the, final of the Eastern figure slcatIng championships last night. Stacey Smith and John Summers of the Skating Club of Wilmington, Del., were second.

description: Having chosen to call his production of Shakespeare's play MacBeth, Ted Story seems to be saying that it isn't quite Macbeth. This is true.

The problems have resulted primarily from the oil price increase and the worldwide recession.

title: The End of the Line
description: More than 10 percent of the population is older than 65; and this figure may double over the next 25 years. A steadily increasing number of these people are spending, and ending, their lives in institutions. As the physician caring; for a group of 40 residents of a healthrelated facility over the past year. and having been involved in placing perhaps .100 elderly people in nursing homes after a hospitalization. I have come increasingly to question this way of channeling the. lives of our older people.

title: Assertion of Will by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 17The stunning setback dealt Presidentelect Carter over his nomination of Theodore C. Sorensen as Director of Central Intelligence is not only a mark of his inexperience in dealing with Capitol Hill but a sign that even with a Democratic President, Congress intends to assert itself in foreign affairs. A decade ago, such a nomination would probably have been given quick, rubberstamp approval by the Senate. But after exposing the past abuses of the intelligence community, the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence was determined to assert the will of Congress in the selection of the nation's new intelligence chief rather than merely grant Mr. Carter complete freedom of choice.

title: Chemical Carriers of Cholesterol Put Light on HeartAttack Puzzle
description: Recent studies have shown that cholesterol does not exist in the blood as a single substance but is carried by more than half a dozen different chemicals, some of which protect against heart disease rather than promote it.
