In those days, officials worried a lot about hair and individuality. As he was about to take off in his jet, unshorn, the squadron commander told him, You're not going up. With that, Captain Bach hung up his helmet and became Mr. Bach again.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Bridge
description: The Greater New York Championships begin today at the New York Hilton Hotel, and will conclude Sunday with what might be called The Day of the Fossil.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Lifts Curbs on Press, Speeds the Release of Prisoners
Eugene F. Peterson Dies at 68
description: Eugene Forrest Peterson, a former vice president of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, died Wednesday in Greenwich Hospital, Greenwich, Conn. He was 68 years old and lived on Overlook Drive in Greenwich.

title: Carter Sought Change in Music
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP)Officials handling inaugural arrangements got an eleventhhour request from Presidentelect Carter for the final musical selection by the Marine Band to be God Bless America, not Hail to the Chief. The music was changed, but Mr. Carter's wishes were learned too late for the printed inaugural program to be changed.

title: FRANCES KREUTER, AT 72, EXNURSING SCHOOL DEAN
description: Frances Kreuter, dean of the Graduate School of Nursing, New York Medical College, from 1960 to 1969 and dean emeritus since then, died Tuesday in Cherry, Ill., after a long illness. She was known professionally as Frances Reiter. Mrs. Kreuter was 72 years old.

title: W.H.A. Drops Fighting Saints
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Jan. 20 (AP)The Minnesota Fighting Saints the World Hockey Association went out of business tonight when a league deadline for sale of the team was not met. A revised league schedule has been drafted end will be made public within the next 24 hours.

title: Meadowlands Drivers
Art People
description: THE FRENCH GOVERNMENT'S release last week of the suspected Palestinian terrorist Abu Daoud has caused a flap in the New York art world not seen since the Protest days of the late 1960's. The closeathand opening (Jan. 31) of the Governmentsponsored arts facility in Paris, Le Centre National d'Art et Culture Georges Pompidou (otherwise know as Le Centre Beaubourg) has made the center a natural target for the anger felt by many over the incident. There have been withdrawals of promised gifts to the Beaubourg, cancellations of trips to attend its opening and a rush of dialectic an all sides of the Question.

title: Bayi Will Run In A.A.U. Meets
description: Filbert Eayi of Tanzania will run in the United States this winter, starting with the Wanamaker Mile Jan. 28 in the Millrose Games at Madison Square Garden.

title: Article 6  No Title
Con Ed Cuts Off Sidewalk Current
description: The Consolidated Edison Company said yesterday that it had cut off the current from cables under a patch of Harlem sidewalk that raised the hair of dogs and made them leap away howling.

title: HOTEL WHERE 2 DIED GETS 300 BLANKETS
description: New York City sent 300 blankets to a West Side welfare hotel yesterday, after two elderly tenants died in their icy rooms Tuesday when there was no heat in the building and when outside temperatures ranged from 1 degree below zero to 12 above.

title: For Children
description: The Paper Bag Players

title: Soviet Defends Its Record On Allowing Emigration
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 20 (UPI)A Kremlin official said today that more than 98 percent of those who asked to leave, the Soviet Union were allowed to go, but he added that there cannot be any social reason for Russians to emigrate.

title: Ice Skating Is Nice SkatingIndoors or Out
Article 7  No Title
Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT KANSAS CITY

title: People and Business
description: A radical change in the traditional American attitude toward unfair cornpetition in foreign trade has been suggested by Prof. Richard N. Cooper, the new Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs. In effect, Mr. Cooper said the United States should consider abandoning its current efforts to negotiate an internationally agreed ban on many kinds of subsidies that governments pay their exporters and allow such practices to continue under certain safeguards.

title: HELICOPTER FLIGHTS APPROVED BY BOARD
description: Helicopter flights to and from the roof of the 59story Pan Am Building were unanimously approved yesterday by the New York City Board of Estimate, clearing the way for the resumption of regular helicopter service to and from the metropolitan area's three major airports on Feb. 1.

title: Lazy Man Juggles Flute and Baton
description: It's my nature to be very lazy, says JeanPierre Rampal, except when I like what Im doing. Fortunately, the great French flutist is still in love with music. He performs, he transcribes, he records, he teaches, he tours, and he is forever seeking new outlets for his creative energies.

title: Ford, Arriving on Coast, Declares He Now Has Best of Both Worlds
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Jan. 20Leaving the icy chill of Washington behind him, former President Gerald R. Ford flew into this balmy coastal resort late today, saying that he now has the best of both worlds.

title: Blast at University of Pittsburgh Kills 2 and Injures at Least 45
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 20 (AP)An explosion leveled part of a University of Pittsburgh classroom building today, killing at least two persons and injuring more than 45 others.

title: RESULTS
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% tax)

title: Ford Closes His 2 Years In Serenity
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Presidency of Gerald R. Ford ended in traditional and rather serene fashion today, in marked contrast to the drama and crisis with which it began on a humid August day two and a half years ago.

title: Pop Music: Jule Styne Takes an Amiable Ego Trip on Nostalgia.St
description: Jule Styne, who composed the scores of Gypsy and Funny Girl and such pop songs as Let It Snow! Let It Snow! Let It Snow! and I've Heard That Song Before, is enjoying an amiable ego trip this week and next in the Rainbow Grill. He is playing piano and singing, in a husky voice made a little huskier the other evening by laryngitis, more than four dozen of the countless tunes he has written during the last 50 years.

title: Opera: Rita Shane as Lucia
description: Rita Shane stepped forward to sing her first Metropolitan Opera Lucia Wednesday night, filling in for Cristina Deutekom, who canceled her engagement. The season's eighth performance of Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor also found William Walker taking the role of Lord Ashton for the first time with the company.

title: Poland Is Shifting Priorities to Increase Consumer Goods and Keep Food Prices Down
description: WARSAW, Jan. 15The Polish Cornmunist leadership has made a series of important economic decisions that, it believes, will sort out the country's immediate problems and restore stability.

title: Japan, Responding to Western Pressure, Plans 17% Budget Rise to Help Spur International Economy
description: TOKYO, Jan. 20Sensitive to American and other Western pressures over Japan's huge trade surpluses and fiscal conservatism, the Government of Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda agreed today after a night of debate to submit to Parliament a $97 billion spending budget for the fiscal year beginning April 117 percent higher than this year's budget.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: ProAmnesty Groups Offer Praise But Assert That Plan Is Too Limited
description: President Carter's pardon for draft resisters drew sharp denunciations yesterday from major veterans' organizations and only qualified praise from proamnesty groups, which called it insufficient because of its exclusion of deserters and veterans with lessthanhonorable discharges.

title: MUGGED WOMAN DIES DESCRIBING ATTACK
description: An 84yearold. Queens woman died yesterday afternoon while describing to police ,officers the assault she had just suffered in an attempted robbery as she was entering her Queens apartment.

title: Inland and Republic Steel Net Up in 4th Quarter
description: The Inland Steel Company, citing a demand for sheet products reported yesterday a fourthquarter profit rise of 95 percent on a 14 percent sales gain. Inland, the nation's sixth largest steel producer, said earnings were up 25% for all of 1976 and sales were 13 percent higher than the year before.

title: Reports on Strike at the City Ballet And on Murdoch Set By Channel 13
description: WNET/Channel 13 has scheduled two special reports on local topics making headlines. The first will examine issues surrounding the strike by musicians of the New York City Ballet orchestra. The strike began more than six weeks ago and led to the cancellation of the ballet's winter season, usually US most profitable.

title: About New York
description: In recent years, the friendly neighborhood pimp has come in with cash in hand to buy a Buick with lavish appointments, and Charley Prinzi did not, indeed could not, balk as.. he manned his selling post by the shiny cars behind the big windows of the salesroom at Broadway and 55th Street.

title: Pesticide Concern Scored On Worker Nerve Damage
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)Federal officials have accused a chemical company of 44 safety violations at a pesticide plant where at least 10 workers suffered nerve damage.

title: For Upstaters, The Snowy Winter Is Just Not a Big Deal
description: It provides employment for weathermen who predict it, statisticians who measure it, those who write about it, salt spreaders who melt it and plow operators who shovel it.

title: Obscenity Conviction in Jersey
description: NEWARK, Jan. 21 (AP)The owner of a movie theater here has been convicted of violating the state's obscenity law. Hamar Theatres Inc., which owns the Treat Theater here, was found guilty yesterday by a jury of all 36 counts in the indictment against the concern. Twentyone counts were for exhibiting the film Divine Obsession and 15 counts were for showing the film Farewell Scarlet. The New Jerseybased company faces a fine of up to $36,000.

title: Where Have All TV Programs Gone? To Fight Ratings War
description: For the millions to whom favorite television programs are visits to old friends, the social landscape of the weekend is drastically changing. Kojak and The Jeffersons have moved out. Rhoda, Phyllis, Switch and Executive Suite have all moved in.

title: Haywood Sidelined Five More Weeks
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21After learning that Spencer Haywood's injured leg wculd keep him out of action another five or six weeks, the New York Knicks were beaten, 10894, by the Los Angeles Lakers tonight before a crowd of 17,505 in the Forum, the first capacity crowd of the season here.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, JANUARY 22, 1977

title: FARMERS PLANNING A 1977 CROP OF CORN ABOVE RECORD IN 76
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Farmers surprised. the experts today with reported plans for planting still more corn than the acreage that produced a record crop last year.

title: Yoshimura Juror Tells About Split
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 21A juror who held out against conviction of Wendy Yoshimura, an underground traveling companion of Patricia Hearst, said today that she changed her vote after 12 straight hours of deliberation because the other furors had called her stupid.

title: 3 Die in Fire on Burma Train
description: RANGOON, Burma, Jan. 21 (UPI) Three passengers burned to death and 21 were injured in a fire on the passenger section of a mail train north of Mandalay, it was reported today. The report said the fire broke out Wednesday night, when passengers were using candles because there were no electric lights. A candle fell on a tin of kerosene, engulfing the section in flames, the report said.

title: PRESIDENT URGES 65 AS TOP HEAT IN HOMES TO EASE ENERGY CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 21President Carter called on all Americans tonight to turn down their thermostats at home to 65 degrees in the daytime and lower at night to help cope with what Mr. Carter called an energy crisis precipitated by this winter's unusaily cold temperatures.

title: Abortion Is a Hotly Debated Issue in Many Lands
description: Fierce and often emotional debates on the ethics and legality of abortion have been under way for some years in the United States, where the Supreme Court declared abortion legal four years ago, and just about everywhere, else in the world.

title: Frilly, Feminine Styles For World of Business
Mobil Oil Walkout Averted
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21 (AP)A contract settlement averting a walkout by more than 500 Mobil Oil Company workers in California was reached in a 17hour bargaining session that lasted until nearly dawn today. The agreement between the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union. Local 1547 and Mobil calls for a 9 percent raise the first year of a twoyear, contract and a straight 75cent raise for all pay classifications in the second year.

title: Protest Is Planned On an Alleged Shift Of Rescue Company
description: Fort Greene residents plan to stage a demonstration at noon today to protest what they say is a plan by the Fire Department to move Brooklyn's only fire rescue company to the socalled People's Firehouse in the Northside section of the borough.

title: U.S. MONEY SUPPLY DROPS $700 MILLION
description: The nation's money supply, called M1 and defined as currency in ciculation and demand deposits, declined 3700 million to a seasonally adjusted average level of $314 billion in the week ended Jan. 12, the Federal Reserve System reported yesterday.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, JANUARY 22, 1977

title: Bellow and Boll Give Support
description: PARIS, Jan. 21 (UPI)Saul Bellow and Heinrich Bll, Nobel Literature Prize winners, have joined the International Committee of Support for the Principles of Charter 77. the group said today.

title: Egypt Opens Drive Accusing Communists of Leading Price Protest
description: CAIRO, Jan. 21The Government of President Anwar elSadat today opened a campaign to blame Communists and their allies for the bloody rioting that disrupted the country Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: At Least 12 Presidents Involved In Pardon or Amnesty Moves
description: President Carter's granting of a pardon yesterday to draft evaders and others who violated the Selective Service laws was an action with roots that go deep nto the history of the American republic.

title: EVICTION ORDERED AT BRONX MARKET
description: One of the largest wholesale grocers in the Bronx Terminal Market was served with a 72hour eviction notice yesterday afternoon in the latest round in the tangled dispute involving the operation of the cityowned market.

title: EXSENATOR EPSTEIN SENTENCED IN THEFT
MOSCOW RESIDENTS HEAR MYSTERIOUS EXPLOSIONS
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21Explosions were heard by some Moscow residents tonight but there was no immediate reliable indication as to the cause.

title: Most Futures Fall in Quiet Trading
description: As traders awaited the latest Department of Agriculture report on plantings this year, trading on the Chicago Board of Trade in farm commodity futures was dull yesterday.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reported in The Times during the last week.

title: Selling of Pesos Slows
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 21 (UPI)The rush to exchange pesos for dollars, which resulted in a 20 percent slump in, the peso's value yesterday, began to abate today. Financial observers said the rush seemed temporary and predicted it would soon die down.

title: Hunter 72, Manhattanville 70
description: Tyrone Anderson's basket with 18 seconds to play gave Hunter College a 7270 victory over Manhattanville last night at Hunter.

title: Middle East Attitudes
description: President Carter was treated with deference in Israeli editorials, but an Iraqi leader voiced suspicion of his aims.

title: Cauthen Going West
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 21 (AP)Steve Cauthen will make his Western debut Sunday when he will ride in each division of the $75,000 San Fernando Stakes at Santa Anita.

title: Carter Chooses Desk Once Used by Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)President Carter is going to work at the desk used by President Kennedy in the Oval Office. The desk was carved from oak timbers of the British ship Resolute and was a gift to the White House from Queen Victoria in the Administration of Rutherford B. Hayes.

title: JOSEPH KOHN, 64, DIRECTOR OF JERSEY UNIT FOR BLIND
description: Joseph Kohn, executive director of the New Jersey Commission for the Blind and Visually Impaired, died Tuesday at St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Elizabeth, N.J. He was 64 years old and lived in Cranford, N.J.

title: Equal Rights Backlash Slows Fight in Hartford
Gorman Gains With Vilas, Gottfried, Kodes in Tennis
description: BALTIMORE, Jan.  21 (AP)Three seeded players and the unseeded defender, Toni Gorman, scored quarterfinal victories today in the $100,000 Baltimore international indoor tennis tournament. Gorman will face topseeded Guillermo Vilas of Argentina in one of tomorrow's semifinal matches. after both poster straightset victories.

title: South Africa Vows Dignity for All
description: CAPE TOWN, Jan. 2IThe South African Government, outlining its legislative program, pledged today, to follow a course that will secure peace and insure human dignity and opportunities for all.

title: The Conspiracy of Feelings Is Uncertain Russian Play
description: The Conspiracy of Feelings, written in 1929 by the Soviet satirist Yurii Olyesha, bristles in every direction like a hedgehog. Hedgehogs configurations protect them doubly: There are the quills, and there is the fact that you can't be sure which way the animal is headed.

title: Dollar and Gold Decline
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 21 (UPI)The dollar weakened slightly on most European money markets today but still closed substantially higher than a week ago. The price of gold, after inactive trading, tumbled $1.25 in London to $131.875 an ounce and closed 25 cents lower in Zurich at $132.875 an ounce.

title: Western Europe's Reaction
description: LONDON, Jan. 21 (AP)Commentators in Western Europe greeted President Carter's inaugural address with lowkey approval or mild criticism. Some papers complained that they still knew little about him.

title: Congressmen and Nader Demand Proof of Nuclear Plant Safety
description: WASHINGTON, Jan: 21 (UPI)A group of House members and Ralph Nader, urged today that Congress order nuclear power. plants gradually shut down unless there. was firm proof that they could he safely operated.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LLAMALAND Pedestrians attracted by the colorful display of pictures and artifacts visible through the glasswalled facade at the corner of Avenue of the Americas and 43d Street would do well to step inside the Kodak Photo Gallery for one of its typical free exhibits.

title: Fund Option Writing
description: Mutual fund shareholders may have ushered in the investment wave of the future when they approved charter changes enabling investment companies to write call options against their portfolio securities. Page 29.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTONThe promotors of a new method of reproducing text and illustrations say it offers considerable savings in labor and materials for publishers of newspapers, magazines and catalogues. The process is called electronic pagination. Patent 4,004,079 was granted this week to W. Thomas Boston, an engineer, and assigned to his employer, Optronics International Inc., a Chelmsford, Mass., company active in computerized image processing.

title: To Florida Citrus Growers, Freeze Is Blessing
description: The freezing weather in Florida's citrus belt will reduce this year's previously predicted bumper crop to levels close to last year's production, but ironically it will ease the worries of growers who had feared they would lose money because of the surplus.

title: Letters
description: Trade Center: Marred Quality

title: Poison Center Has Antidotes on Call
description: It is 9:30 P.M. A telephone rings in a stuffy, groundfloor office in the building at 455 First Avenue. It is answered before the first ring finishes.

title: Order Halts Construction Of Nuclear Power Plant
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)An appeals board today ordered a halt to construction of, a $2 billion nuclear power plant in New England that has been criticized by environmentalists.

title: School Results
description: BOYS BASKETBALL

title: Ford, on First Day of Private Life, Draws Crowds at Golf Tournament
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Jan. 21Gerald R. Ford still had the crowds with him today as he moved through the first full day of his reentry into private life.

title: Mel Davis Joins Club Before 9988 Defeat Mel Davis Joins Club Before 9988 Defeat
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 21The New York Nets lost their 13th consecutive game tonight, bowing to the Washington Bullets, 9988, in the Nassau Coliseum before 6,122 impressed fans.

title: Personal Investing
I.R.A. Begins Series of Attacks On Buses and Roads in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 21 (Reuters)The Irish Republican Army started a series of attacks on this city's public transportation system today, hijacking and burning a number of buses and bombing a bus depot.

title: People in Sports
description: Willis Reed, who quit professional basketball with two years left on his New York Knicks contract rather than face further knee surgery during the 19741975 season, has finally undergone the surgery. But he is not planning a comeback as a player.

title: In Brazil's North, Thousands Die Of ThirdWorld Ills Defying Cure
Television
description: Afternoon

title: Tuna Fishing Allowed After Porpoise Kill Is Set
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 21 (AP)A Federal district judge temporarily blocked enforcment of the Marine Mammal Protection Act today, allowing United States tuna fishermen to resume fishing. But a limit of 10,000 was set on the number of porpoises which may be killed in their nets.

title: Part of a Talk Given on Radio
description: Following is an excerpt from a Consumer Alert program broadcast earlier this month: . . . Consumer Protection Law Regulation 3 provides that. the full range of prices must be disclosed in ads for products or services that come at a variety of prices. This rule outlaws the use of phrases such as $7.99 and up because we don't, think shoppers have the time to figure out just how high is up.

title: UConn 67, Rhode Island 65
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 21 (AP)Tony Hanson became the leading scorer in University of Connecticut basketball history tonight scoring 33 points and leading the Huskies to a 6765 victory over the University of Rhode Island.

title: Deputy Chancellor Gives Queens 4th Graders Their Just Desserts
description: A class of Queens fourth graders who had complained to the Board of Education about their school's hotlunch menu met yesterday for a lunch of meat loaf, mashed potatoes, fruit cocktail, milk and bread with a special guest who gave his meal a grade of

title: British Football
description: By The Associated Press ENGLISH LEAGUE Fourth Division Colchester 0, Cambridge I. Stockport 2, Newport I

title: Analysis of Soviet Goal Is Defended
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Two participants in a recent intelligence review of Soviet military capabilities and aims said today there was unanimity within the intelligence community that the Soviet Union seeks strategic superiority over this country.

title: Stones Jumps 75, Best This Season
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21  With a homemade banner proclaiming Dwight + Philly = World Record, Dwight Stones cleared 7 feet 5 inches in the high jump at the Philadelphia Track Classic tonight, the best performance in the world this season.

title: Notes on People
description: In the English Midlands town of Alfreton yesterday, a retired schoolmaster, a housewife and a garage owner formed a tribunal that fined Prnieess Anne, daughter of Queen Elizabeth II, $69 for speeding at 96 miles an hour on an expressway. Princess Anne, who will not be hurt financially by the fine, since the Government gives her an allowance of nearly $60,000 a year, was not in court, but a local lawyer pleaded guilty to the charge on her behalf, and offered her apologies to the court. The Princess, who was given a summons by the police last Nov. 27, had been stopped for speeding twice before but had escaped punishment. She was believed to be the highestranking member of the British nobility to get into trouble with the law in modern times.

title: UNEMPLOYMENT FUND NEAR VANISHING POINT
2 Young Women Amateurs Enjoy Eventful Day Playing in Pro  Am
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 21Eddie Merrins, a club pro from Los Angeles and coach of the men's golf team at the University of California, Los Angeles, tapped his playing partner, Marianne Bretton, on the arm and said:

title: ALBERT F. FISHER
description: Albert F. Fisher, a retired General Electric Company executive, died Thursday at Phelps Memorial Hospital, Tarrytown; N.Y. He was 82 years old and a resident of Scarborough, N.Y. Mr. Fisher, who held a chemical engineering degree from the University of Rochester, leaves his wife, Dorothy L.; a son, Albert F.; daughter, Alice L. Foss, and five grandchildren.

title: Small Fire at Inaugural Party
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)A small fire broke out in a basement storage area of the National Visitor Center last night as President Carter was about to leave the inaugural party there, the District of Columbia Fire Department said today. The President's exit route took him past the area of tie fire, but the blaze was extinguished and damage was negligible, a spokesman said.

title: To Pardon, in the New Spirit
description: We ask those who feel offense in President Carter's unconditional pardon of the Vietnam draft evaders to give a hearing to the views of Robert C. Ransom, presented with moving conviction and reason in a letter below. Having lost a son in a war that the son deemed wrong and immoral, Mr. Ransom looks upon pardon as vindication of a nation compassionate and big enough to admit its mistakes. Grief tempered by charity for those who may be alive only because they evaded the call is a better guide to the future than vindictive demands for honor based on a stern refusal to forgive.

title: Purchase Brings Arrest
description: A 29yearold public school teacher was arrested on charges of purchasing $2,400 worth of electronic equipment with city money for his personal use. The fifthgrade teacher, Marc B. Wiskoff, was suspended from his class at Public School 269 on Nostrand Avenue, Brooklyn. The equipment was ordered from a Phoenix supply house allegedly through a Board of Education purchase order forged by the teacher.

title: A.T.&T. Offers Large Premiums For 4 HighCoupon Bond Issues
Virginia Effort to Vote On Equal Rights Loses
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 21 (UPI)The Virginia General Assembly dealt another blow to backers of the equal rights amendment today by defeating, 62 to 36, a proposed rule change to circumvent an unfriendly committee and bring the resolution to the floor for a vote.

title: Central American Loans Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)  The InterAmerican Development Bank approved today three loans for almost $50 million to help finance development projects in Guatemala, Mexico and Costa Rica.

title: American Double Standards on African Issues at the U.N.
description: Americans halie had a shortsighted view of African issues at the United Nations. Our ambassadors have contended that it is hypocritical for Africans to attack South Africa's policy of apartheid while committing genocide in their own countries. As evidence of double standards,Mozambique is often mentioned as a prime example of a :country that condemns apartheid and continues to trade with South Africa. Though superficially correct, this argument lacks historical perspective and misconceives the challenges facing the international organization.

title: Stars Name Frankiewicz
description: ST. LOUIS. Jan. 21 (AP)Casey Frankiewicz, former player and coach for St. Louis of North American Soccer League, was named the Stars director of operations today. Jack Galmiche, the Stars general manager, said Frankiewicz, the N.A.S.L, coach of the year in 1972, will be responsible for the club's business activities.

title: CARTER AIDES FAILED TO REQUEST A DELAY ON SHIP GUARANTEES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Carter Administration was offered a chance to request that the controversial application for $730 million in Federal guarantees to build seven superships be deferred until it came to power, but it declined to do so.

title: Demolition of Courthouse Urged
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 21Political, trade union and business leaders, arguing that current jobs were more important than past history, joined nearly 500, construction workers at a rally here today to demand demolition of the old White Plains Courthouse and permit the building of a $55 million shopping mall.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Books of The Times
description: GEOGRAPHY III. By Elizabeth Bishop. 50 pages. Farrar, Straus and Giroux. $7.95.

title: Chamber Musk Is Swedish Treat
Text of Carter's Statement on the Fuel Situation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)Following is the text of President Carter's statement on natural gas shortages:

title: No Comment From Ford
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Jan. 21 (Reuters)Former President Ford, who played in a golf tournament here today, refused to comment on President Carter's pardon of draft evaders.

title: Young, Carter's U.N.Nominee, PlansTrip to Africa
Australia Leads India
description: PERTH, Australia, Jan. 21 (AP)Mark Edmondson, playing in his first Davis Cup tennis competition, and John Alexander scared singles victories today, giving Australia a 20 lead over India in an Eastern Zone semifinal series.

title: Lyle Gains Semifinal Of MatchPlay Tourney
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Jan. 21 (AP)Eight players moved into the quarterfinals today after the fourth round of the $20,000 Professional Golfers Association national matchplay golf tournament on the 7,200yard Palm Course. Steve Lyles of Alexander City, Ala., won, I up, from Dean Lind of Northbrook, Ill. Lyles was scheduled to play James Logue of Canton, Ohio, tomorrow. Logue ousted Nelson Long of Purchase, N.Y., 3 and 2.

title: Race Cars Fight City's Traffic For a 5Day Pit Stop at Garden
description: The first racecar show in New York arrived yesterdayat 80 miles per hour through the Lincoln Tunnel.

title: Deaths
description: AGRESSJane, beloved wife of the late Jacob, loving mother of Geraldine, Phyllis Luff and Mortimer, devoted sister and adored grandmother. Fune, rat services Sunday, Jan. 23, 10 at the I.J. Morris, Inc. Funeral Home, 1895 Flatbush Ave. (1 block north. of Kings Highway), Brooklyn. Interment Beth David Cemetery.

title: Resistance Drive Reported In Soviet Labor Camps
description: MOSCOW, Jan, 21 (Reuters)Prisoners in scores of Soviet labor camps have staged hunger strikes and work stoppages as part of a resistance campaign against the camp authorities, according to a recently released dissident.

title: Soviet Union Widening Foothold In World of Far Eastern Shipping
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 21The Soviet Union is quietly and efficiently entering the Byzantine world of Far Eastern shipping, using many of the techniques it used effectively in penetrating banking finance and real estate.

title: Major Drug Dealer Is Given 5 Years
description: A 47yearold Chilean woman, described by authorities as one of the world's major narcotics dealers, was sentenced in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday to five years in prison.

title: Importing Algerian Liquefied Natural Gas Is Called Way to End State's Shortages Until the Year 2000
description: NEWARK, Jan. 21A spokesman for New Jersey's largest distributor of natural gas said today that recurrent winter shortages in the state could be stopped for the rest of the century by importing liquefied natural gas from Algeria.

title: General Foods' Coffee Price Hits Record $3.11, Up 20 Cents
description: The General Foods Corporation, the nation's largest coffee wholesaler yesterday raised prices for ground coffee by 20 cents to a record $3.11 a pound in the second round of increases in a month. The pricing action, effective Jan. 31, did not apply to instant or soluble brands.

title: Texts of Documents on the Pardon
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 21 (AP)Following are the texts of President Carter's proclamation and executive order granting pardons to drafe evaders from the Vietnam war era:

title: Nevada Refuses Immunity to Hughes Will Claimant
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 21The Nevada authorities have refused to give Melvin Dummar immunity in return for his story of what really happened in the production of the socalled Mormon will of Howard R. Hughes.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Judge Richard Owen sentenced 13 defendants in Federal District Court in Manhattan to prison terms ranging from two to 25 years for participating in a narcotics ring that had sold $200 Million of cocaine and heroin since 1968. The judge imposed the 25year sentence and a $50,000 fine on Frank Moten of Englewood, N.J., who was convicted with the others in a threemonth trial that ended Nov. 12. Federal prosecutors said Mr. Moten was reported to be the !eider of the Council of 12 responsible for decisionmaking at the highest level for black organized crime.

title: Cooke, at Reception on the East Side, Assails Abortion
description: Terence Cardinal Cooke, Roman Catholic Archbishop of New York, was the host, but the stars of the event were three children of unwed mothers.

title: Korean Lobbyist a U.S. Tax Target
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Internal Revenue Service says that Park Tong Sun, a central figure in the alleged bribery of United States Congressmen by Korean figures, owes the United States Government $4.5 million in back income taxes, interest and penalties.

title: New York City Consumer Agency Fictionalized Many Broadcasts
MSGR. R. J. TESTAGROSSA IS DEAD IN QUEENS AT 68
description: Msgr. Ralph J. Testagrossa, pastor emeritus of the Church of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary, Ozone Park, Queens, died Sunday at St. John's Hospital in Elmhurst, Queens. He was 68 years old and lived at the rectory of the church, at 10141 91st Street.

title: Carter White House, Opening Day: Staff Displays a DownHome Style
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21With a lopsided smile, Charles Kirbo tried to explain what it was he was doing today in the White House office of Jody Powell, President Caiter's press secretary.

ERWIN BENKOE
description: Erwin Benkoe, a toy designer, died Wednesday at a Pittsburgh hospital. Fie, was 54 years old and a resident of Los Angeles.

description: CROSBY NATIONAL PROAM

title: Price Rises Follow For Copper and Lead
description: Copper and lead price increases announced in the last few days by several major producers were confirmed yesterday by most of the other producers. Asarco Inc. took the lead on Wednesday and raised the copper price by 2 cents to 67 cents a pound for electrolytic cathodes of domestic origin.

SHIPPING AND MAILS
description: OUTGOING

description: MEN'S BASKETBALL

title: Brief Reports in China
description: PEKING, Jan. 21 (Agence FrancePresse)The Chinese press reported briefly today that Jimmy Carter had be. come the 39th President of the United States,

title: Vance Appoints ExHead of A.D.A. Cultural Affairs Chief at State Dept.
Concert: Speculum Musicae Presents Old and New
description: The old and the new were on the Speculum Musicae program Thursday night in Alice Tully Hall. Speculum Musicae is dedicated to contemporary music, but it also is geared to take a look at important avantgarde music of the early 20th century. Thus, Thursday night it presented, along with several works heard for the first time in this city, music by Webern and Schoenberg.

title: BROCK PLANS CORPS FOR TRAINING G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Bill Brock, the new Republican national chairman, has ambitious plans to rejuvenate his party by training a corps of 100 professional political organizers and sending them out to whip state party operations into shape.

title: Sad Line Mourns Its Lost Ballets
description: One of the sadder lines in town is at the New York State Theater, where the box office has been shoveling it out, rather than raking it in, as a result of the musicians strike at the New York City Ballet.

title: Governor Meets in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)Maine Goy. James B. Longley met today in closed session with members of the state's Congressional delegation to discuss the land dispute between the state and two Indian tribes.

title: EVADERS IN CANADA CALL ACTION A SHAM
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 21Spokesmen for Vietnam War resisters who fled to Canada reacted with bitterness today to the exclusion of deserters from the unconditional pardon extended by President Carter to draft evaders.

title: Most Exiles in Sweden Deserted
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 21  The overwhelming majority of the estimated 300 draft resisters and military deserters in Sweden are deserters.

title: Takes OneYear Lease
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., Jan. 21 (AP) Former President Ford will move next month into a secluded home in the exclusive Thunderbird Heights area across from the Thunderbird Country Club.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Jury selection in the murder trial of Joanne Chesimard in New Brunswick was suspended to await her appeal challenging a requirement that she attend court on Fridays, the Sabbath in her Muslim faith. The Federal Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit in Philadelphia has agreed to hear arguments Tuesday on her charge that her civil rights are being violated because court sessions are held on her Sabbath.

title: Maine Asserts Tribe Yielded Land But U.S. Lawyer Belittles Assertion
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Jan. 21 (AP)Maine's Attorney General today produced a document that purported to show that the Penobscot Indians gave up their land in Maine more than 200 years ago. It was later belittled by the top lawyer for the Interior Department.

title: Racal Tender Offer For Milgo Shares
description: Racal Electronics Limited of Britain announced that it had commenced a cash tender offer of $26 a share for any and all shares of Milgo Electronic Corporation, a Miami company that makes equipment for communicating computer data and voice signals over a telephone network.

title: Amtrak Tickets Will Be Accepted By Greyhound During Cutbacks
description: PHOENIX, Jan. 20 (UPI)Greyhound Lines will accept Amtrak tickets for travel on all its bus routes, the company announced Thursday because of cutbacks in train service as a result of the extreme cold.

title: LENDING RATE IS CUT BY BANK OF ENGLAND Reduction of  Percentage Point, Sharper Than Expected, Shows, Growing Confidence in Pound
Richardson's Ship Move Hailed in His Home State
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Closed End Funds
description: Unaudited net asset values of closedend bond fund shares, reported by the companies as of Friday, Dec. 12, 1976. Also shown Is the closing listed market price or a dealertodealer asked price of each fund's shares, with percentage of difference.

title: Misses fromholtz, Barker Gain
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)Dianne Fromholtz of Australia and Sue Barker of England, a pair of 20yearolds trying to reach their first tour final, won twoset quarterfinal matches today in the $100,000 Virginia Slims event.

title: New Democratic National ChairMan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21With diffidence but a measure of boyish enthusiasm, Kenneth Merwin Curtis assumed today what is almost certainly the most thankless frontline job in American politics these days: the chairmanship of the Democratic National Committee. As nominal head of his party, the former Governor of Maine is almost certain to be eclipsed, largely if not entirely, by the man who chose him, President Carter. No occupant of the White House in memory has ever tapped a national chairman with any potential for political rivalry.

title: Elections Aides Say They Will Need Help On Redistricting Job
description: Representatives of the New York City Board of Elections told the City Council's Districting Commission yesterday that their agency did not have the money or the personnel needed to prepare for the coming reapportionment of councilmanic districts as mandated by the new City Charter.

title: Dividends
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 21, 1977

title: Extension Granted 5 Special Schools For Pregnant Girls
description: Reversing an earlier decision, the New York City. Board of Education has decided to keep five special schools for pregnant girls that were scheduled to close. in February open for at least the remainder of the school year.

title: Rich Tanaka Ally Indicted In Tokyo Lockheed Case
description: TOKYO, Jan. 21 (AP)Kenji Osano, a millionaire associate of former Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka, was indicted today on a charge of perjury in the Lockheed payoff scandal.

title: Reserve Report
Colts Dismiss Joe Thomas, the Team's Master Builder
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 21 (UPI) Joe Thomas, whose tactics have brought him success in rebuilding three football teams but little popularity among players and fans, has lost a power struggle with Coach Ted Marchibroda and been dismissed as general manager of the Baltimore Colts of the National Football League.

title: Rising Demand Drives Up Prices For Houses in Cities and Suburbs
description: LA GRANGE,Ill.Appalled is the Word heard most frequently today when, real estate agents try to describe the reactions of prospeCtive home buyers when they bear the soaring cost of houses, especially if they are young and looking for their first home.

title: 1Day Strike Closes French Newspapers 15th Time in 2 Years
description: PARIS, Jan. 21The conflict between newspaper publishers and printers worsened today with another national newspaper strike, the 15th in two years.

title: Bridge:
description: The traditional advice about not are aware that it may be a Greek gift looking a gift horse in the mouth does not mean much to bridge players. They are aware that it may be a Greek gift horse, but even so, inspection of its teeth may be difficult if it resolutely keens its mouth shut.

title: F.P.C. RULES IMPORT COSTS ON GAS MUST BE SHARED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)Reversing a previous decision, the Federal Power Commission announced today that the cost of importing one billion cubic feet of liquefied natural gas per day from Algeria can be charged to all customers of the three importing companies.

title: CORRECTION
description: A headline in The Times on Jan. 7 erroneously stated that Liquor Authority Gets Injunction and Opens Drive Against 200 Clubs. The New York State Liquor Authority is seeking an injunction, but the court has not yet acted on the application.

title: Taking Off the Blinkers
description: ATHENSSomewhat to Its surprise and for the first time in almost a generation, NATO finds itself more threatened by events and potential events outside the geographidal limits fixed for it by treaty than it does by the immediate menace of Sovietbloc troops or Soviet nucleartipped missilea aimed at West Europe and the United States.

title: Hochschild to Close A Baltimore Store
description: HochschildKohn Company, one of Baltimore's leading department stores, will close its downtown store in that city in July and said it plans to open three new stores in the area in the next two years. Hochschild is a division of the Supermarkets General Corporation.

title: Bank America Reports a 13.1% Rise In Earnings for the Fourth Quarter
description: The BankAmerica Corporation, the parent of the nation's largest commercial bank, the Bank of America, yesterday reported a 13.1 percent rise in operating earnings for last year's fourth quarter.

title: ExP.B.A. Head Is Assessed $7,500 For OneMan Strike in September
description: For staging a brief oneman strike last September, Ken McFeeley, the former president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association was assessed more than $7,500 in fines and back wages yesterday and placed on probation for one year.

title: SAMUEL WEISSTEIN
description: Samuel Weisstein, president of the law firm of Weisstein & Weisstein, 326 Lenox Avenue, died Thursday in his home at 473 West End Avenue after a heart attack. He was 74 years old.

title: Mme. Kitty, Film on Nazis
J. BUCKLEY BRYAN DEAD
description: J BuckleyBryan, New York State Budget Director from 1941 to 1943, died Thursday in Glen Falls (N.Y.) Hospital after a long illness. He was 80 years old and lived in Glens Falls.

title: Rhodesian Cabinet to Hold Special Session to Discuss New Proposals by Britain
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 21 (Reuters)Rhodesia's Cabinet is to meet in special session over the weekend to discuss new British proposals for resolving the deadlock in the Geneva negotiations on the country's future, informed sources said.

title: STOCKS SHOW GAIN: AS VOLUME FALLS
description: Led by the chemical and auto issues, the stock market advanced moderately yesterday in reduced trading.

title: Cuomo Is Elected President Of Catholic Interracial Council
description: Mario M. Cuomo, the New York Secretary of State; has been elected president of the Catholic Interracial Council of New York. Announcement of his election was made yesterday by Robert F. Wagner, president emeritus of the council, founded in 1934 by the late Rev. John LaFarge.

title: Columbia Five Is 7674 Victor Over Cornell
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Jan. 21Bernard, Vaughn's 25foot jumper with four seconds of play fell short, allowing Columbia to post a 7674 victory in Ivy Laegue basketball tonight.

title: Justice Dept. Backs Purchase by Rhinechem
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)The Justice Department announced today it does not oppose plans of a West German company's United States subsidiary to acquire the Harmon Colors organic pigments business of the Allied Chemical Corporation.

title: PRESIDENT URGES 65 AS TOP HEAT IN HOMES TO EASE ENERGY CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Carter called on all Americans tonight to turn down their thermostats at home to 65 degrees in the daytime and lower at night to help cope with what Mr. Carter called an energy crisis precipitated by this winter's unusally cold temperatures.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Rose to 208.2 From 206.1 in Week
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials in the week to Jan. 18 rose to 208.2 from, 206.1 the preceding week.

title: Aqueduct Talks at Impasse
description: A showdown between the New York Racing Association and its parimutuel clerks appeared imminent early last night as mediation efforts to produce a new contract continued to falter.

title: 3, Including Cousin, Are Named By Carter to White House Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)President Carter today appointed his first cousin once removed to be his special assistant for White House administration and his former personal aide, Greg Schneiders, to be White House projects director.

title: New Zealand Gains Zone Final
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 21 (AP)New Zealand advanced to the final of the Eastern Zone Davis Cup tennis competition today by beating Indonesia in the doubles match for an insurmountable 30 lead in the threeoffive series. Brian Fairlie and Onny Parun defeated Gondo Wijoyo and Atet Wyono, 75, 64, 62. In the zone final, New Zealand will meet either India or Australia.

title: 10,000 AFFECTED NOW
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  President Carter granted a pardon today to almost all draft evaders of the Vietnam war era, but he left unsettled the status of those who deserted the armed forces in the long Asian conflict.

title: family/style
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21The matter before the New York State Legislature that is expected to draw most of the lobbying efforts of women'srights groups this session is one of equal interest to both sexes: the Marital Property and Alimony Reform Bill.

title: Sports Today
Warwick Eliminates Wilkison
description: HOBART, Australia, Jan. 21 (AP)Topseeded Kim Warwick of Australia defeated Tim Wilkison of Shelby, N.C. today in the quarterfinal round of the Tasmanian open. The young lefthander forced Warwick into a tiebreaker before losing the first set and won the second set easily, before Warwick regained control and triumphed, 76, 16, 62.

title: CORRECTION
description: A headline in The Times on Jan. 7 erroneously stated that Liquor Authority Gets Injunction and Opens Drive Against 200 Clubs. The New York State Liquor Authority is seeking an injunction, but the court has not yet acted on the application.

title: Article 1  No Title
In Poland, Church and Communists Are Both. Rivals and Wary Allies
description: WARSAW, Jan. 15The Roman Cathollic Church in Poland has perceptibly hardened its position toward the Communist Government lately. But top Communist officials continue to insist that they consider the church leadership responsible and deal with it in language of careful restraint.

title: First Flu Outbreak in U.S. Reported at Vanderbilt U.
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 21 (AP)An outbreak of flu, the first in the nation this winter, was reported today at Nashville by the national Center for Disease Control.

title: Judge Rules Cancer Patient Can Use Banned Laetrile
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 21 (UPI)A 75yearold man suffering from inoperable cancer was granted permission in Federal court today to import the outlawed cancertreatment substance Laetrile from Mexico.

title: On Giving Away CUNY
description: In its report on the City University, the Temporary Commission on City Finances quite correctly states that CUNY now faces an uncertain future. It describes accurately the traumatic events of the past year which have severely diminished the university's capacity to function as a municipal system of higher education. But after all the rhetoric is peeled away, what is left is simply that the city, under the threat of bankruptcy, should be allowed to wash its hands of the public senior colleges. Echoing City Hall, the commission asks that the state pick up the entire tab, now and ever after.

title: Ohio Retracts 24County Energy Emergency Order
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Jan. 21In a surprising move late today, Gov. James A. Rhodes retreated from his executive order imposins stiff conservation rules on a 24county area of southcentral Ohio after being advised by state attorneys that he lacked theauthority to enforce such an energy emergency.

title: Article 3  No Title
Store Sales Rise 6% in Week
description: Special to The New York Times

title: New York City Consumer Agency Fictionalized Broadcasts
description: For three years, the New York City Department of Consumer Affairs, which warns people against fraud, has itself fictionalized and embellished cases in many of its daily radio broadcasts.

title: 2 Newark Buildings Designated State Landmarks
description: NEWARK, Jan. 21An early downtown skyscraper and the former Newark mansion of one of the city's brewery barons have been designated as New Jersey landmarks worthy of preservation and added to the State Register of Historic Places, officials announced today.

title: Third Child at Moscow Embassy Is to Be Sent to U.S. for Tests
description: Moscow, Jan. 21 (AP)Another child living in the American Embassy building here will be returned to the United States for a medical examination because of a mysterious blood ailment.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON. Jan. 21Governor Byrne said today that he would be host at a luncheon in Houston on Tuesday for executives of 11 companies that have leases to drill for oil off the New Jersey Coast.

title: China Is Reviving Films and Plays Banned by Chiang Ching in 1960's
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 21In keeping with a pledge to create a new spring in art and literature, China's new leaders have recently, revived a score of films and plays banned by Chiang Ching in the Cultural Revolution and allowed some wellknown singers and musicians she disliked to reappear for the first time in years.

title: U.S. SUES TEAMSTERS OVER PENSION FUNDS
description: The chief executive of a small Long Island teamsters union was accused in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday of having taken $1 million for his services as a trustee of the union's welfare and pension funds.

title: Connors Defeats Orantes on Default As Chilly Wind Leads to Erratic Play
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Jan 21The first thing Jimmy Connors did after he awoke this morning was call the local weather service for the expected temperature range, a most unFloridian breach of faith. Then again, all week long, the weather here had been most unFloridian. Two days ago it snowed for the first time in Palm Beach, and the sharpies were saying that the fishing was greatif only you could cut a hole in the ice.

title: Elderly at Hearing Criticize Mandatory Retirement
Opposition in India Is Heartened By Relaxing of Authoritarian Rule
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 21India's political opposition reacted with delight today to the Government's moves to ease the authoritarian rule of the last 19 months.

title: Utah Enacts Laws For Barring Arabs From Takeovers
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 21 (UPI)The Utah Legislature today unanimously enacted emergency legislation in an apparent attempt to prevent Arab oil interests from taking over a company with major holdings in the state.

title: Korean Lobbyist a U.S. Tax Target
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Internal Revenue Service says that Park Tong Sun, a central figure in the alleged bribery of United States Congressmen by Korean figures, owes the United States Government $4.5 million in back income taxes, interest and penalties.

title: Bendix Negotiates SparkPlug Plant in Soviet
description: DETROIT, Jan. 21The Bendix Corporation, with headquarters in suburban Southfield, said today that it was negotiating with the Russians to build a sparkplug plant in the Soviet Union.

title: Eastern Gas and Fuel
description: Fourth quarter net income of Eastern Gas and Fuel Associates gained only 5.4 percent to $17.8 million, or 82 cents a share from $16.9 million, or 78 cents a share, in the 1975 final quarter, but revenues were up 13.4 percent to $191 million from $168.3 million.

title: Dissident Says Prague Fears Revival of 1968 Mood
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 21 (AP)Jiri Hajek, former Foreign Minister of Czechoslovakia, says the present Moscowbacked Government in Prague is cracking down on human right activists because it fears revival of the socalled Prague spring of 1968, when a liberalization of Communist rule was begun under the brief leadership of Alixander Dubcek.

title: Joseph M. Feinberg Dies at 69
description: Joseph M. Feinberg, a lawyer, died Thursday at Mount Sinai Hospital, Miami Beach, Fla. He was 69 years old and lived in Tamarac, Fla.

title: Miss Smith Posts Upset With Birdie at 18th Hole
description: FORT LAUDERALE, Fla., Jan. 21 (UPI)Lancy Smith of Snyder, N.Y., birdied the 18th hole today and upset Phyllis Preuss of Pompano Beach, Fla., in the first round of the 45th Doherty Challenge Cup women's. golf tournament at Coral Ridge Country Club. Miss Smith was four down after seven holes and three down at the turn.

title: 130,000 Signatures Given to C.A.B. In Opposition to Ban on Smoking
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)The tobacco industry told the Government today that more than 130,000 persons had signed petitions urging the Government not to ban smoking on commercial airline flights.

title: SUBURBAN HEAT COST FORCING SHIFT TO OIL
RESPONSE FAVORABLE TO CARTER IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21President Carter's inaugural address struck a favorable response here today among both prominent and average Russians.

title: A Cycle of Electronic Music
description: Ingram Marshall is one of a growing number of young cornposers who are attempting to reconcile the medium of electronic music with live performance. La Monte Young, with his Dream House performances for voices, instruments, and electronic sine wave drones, was among the first to follow this path, but the possibilities seem almost limitless, and Mr. Marshall demonstrated quite a few of them on Wednesday and Thursday when he performed his Fragility Cycles in a loft on North Moore Street.

title: Salvation Army Head Installed
description: Commissioner Paul Kaiser was installed last night as the 16th National Commander of the 110yearold Salvation Army in the United States before a capacity audience of nearly 2,000 people in the Centennial Memorial Temple, 120 Wort 14th Street. Also installed, in keeping with the organization's requirement that officer husbandwife teams share appointments, was Mrs. Kaiser, who became president of the group's women's organization in the United States.

title: Daley's Will Is Filed With Court, Leaving the Estate to His Widow
Maxwell House Sued For False Advertising
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Lawrence J. Goulden, 67, Dead
description: Lawrence J. Goulden, a steamshipindustry executive, died Thursday at Beekman Downtown Hospital in Manhattan after being stricken while swimming at the Downtown Athletic Club. He was 67 years old and lived in New Fairfield. Conn.

title: Hertz
description: The Hertz Corporation, the vehicle renting and leasing subsidiary of the RCA Corporation, set a fourthquarter profit record of $9.6 million, up 61 percent from $5.9 million in the 1975 final quarter. Revenues were $192.9 million, a gain of 8 percent from $178.5 million.

title: Puerto Rican Hails Statehood Bid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  Governor Carlos Romero Barce16 of Puerto Rico said today that he intended to keep his campaign pledge to work for the island's economic recovery rather than for its admission as the 51st state of the Union.

title: Eleanor D'Antuono and Bujones Invest Giselle With Fascination
description: American Ballet Theater is currently giving at the City Center 55th Street. Theater what is probably the oddest ballet program ever known to personkind. Two weeks of Copplia are now being followed by two weeks of Giselle

title: JUDGE SUSPENDS SENTENCE OF ADMITTED RAPIST
description: MORRISTOWN, Jan. 21 (UPI)A 20yearold Passaic County man, who admitted raping a woman after they met in a tavern, was given a suspended sentence today and placed on probation.

title: New York, Under the Carter Charter
World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: The Common Touch
description: People in the new Administration were quick to take the hint when President Carter startled all humanity by walking from the Capitol to the White House after his inauguration. This is why the President was disappointed when he called a Cabinet meeting and nobody showed up.

title: 700 Catholic Youths Riot Through Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 21 (UPI)Hundreds of Roman Catholic youths rioted today, burning buses and hurling gasoline bombs while retreating British troops exchanged sporadic fire with snipers.

title: Vance Assure's Turkey U.S. Wants Strong Ties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Secretary of Statedesignate Cyrus R. Vance assured the Turkish Ambassador today that despite the Carter Administration's request that Congress not act now on the pending bases treaty with Turkey, the United States wanted close relations with Istanbul.

title: Rising Real Estate Prices
description: An example of increasing real estate costs, this house in the Chicago suburb of, Hinadale, III., has been sold for the following prices, in thousands of dollars, in the past 12 years.

title: Liberalized Abortion Bill in Italy Passes in Chamber, Goes to Senate
description: ROME, Jan. 21Over the objections of the Vatican and the governing Christian Democrats, the Chamber of,Deputies tonight approved legislation that would give Italy one of the most liberal abortion laws in Western Europe. The bill. which now goes to the Senate for expected approval, would in effect allow abortion on demand.

title: 500 Bills on Family Life Await Action in Trenton
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21For much of 1976, New Jersey's 180yearold State Capitol Building was enlivened by women demonstrating in such bizarre costumes as barrels mid formfitting tights.

title: For Upstaters, The Snowy Winter Is Just Not a Big Deal
description: It provides employment for weathermen who predict it, statisticians who measure it, those who write about it, salt spreaders who melt it and plow operators who shovel it.

title: SHOTS FOR DIPTHERIA ARE ORDERED AT XAVIER
description: A special diphtheriaimmunization program has been ordered at 10 A.M. today for students at Xavier High School, 30 West 16th Street, after an instructor was reported to have been found to have the diease.

title: In ModernDay Czechoslovakia, Medieval Look Is Alive and Well
description: PRAGUEThe defenders of medieval Prague have won a new round against modernist opponents by legally blocking the erection of a factory chimney 550 feet high that would have marred the whole city skyline. The victory this month was regarded by its authors as partial compensation for a recent defeat the completion of the ugly new Maj department store on Wenoeslas Square. But we are very happy, Zdislav Burival said. Seen from this side of the river, that chimney would have stood right between the twin spires of St. Vitus Cathedral.

title: Music: Jessye Norman Impressive in Wagner
description: It was a big day for. Georgia, at the New York. Philharmonic and elsewhere. Jessye Norman, the magnificent soprano from Augusta who has been gathering a following for herself in New York as well as internationally in the last few seasons, returned to the Philharmonic Thursday night as soloist under Pierre Boulez's direction.

title: City College 59, York 57
description: Rich Silvera connected on a 25foot jump shot with two seconds remaining in the first overtime last night to lead City College to a 5957 triumph over York College in a City University Conference game at Hillcrest High School in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Winter Felt Not Always Thus
description: We shiver, look in awe at the thermometer again, and talk of an oldfashioned winter. We have had stabs of big cold in other winters within easy memory, but not day after day of it. Not weather that saps the heat and power that keep our offices, our factories and our schools running and make our houses habitable. The fuel shortages and power cutbacks all over the Eastern half of this country emphasize the fact that our newfashioned way of life can't dominate oldfashioned weather. We have complicated our living, particularly in the cities, to the point where we are beleaguered by winter.

title: 10,000 AFFECTED NOW
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  President Carter granted a pardon today to almost all draft evaders of the Vietnam war era, but he left unsettled the status of those who deserted the armed forces in the long Asian conflict.

title: Brooklyn 79, New Haven 78
description: Brooklyn College defeated New Haven, 7978, ast night as Elliot Williams scored 16 points and Robert Besigmano had 19. Guido Maurino had 14 rebounds for Brooklyn.

title: Survival Training For FuelLess Winters
Criminals At Large
description: P.N. Gwynne's FIRMLY By THE TAIL (Putnam's, $8.95) is a book that does not fall into an easily determined category. The locale is one of those new African republics, and the hero is a diamond buyer for a big British syndicate. So there is a great deal about diamonds. And, well into the bookabout twothirds throughthere is a diamond hijacking. So this is a crime novel.

title: Martha J. Fiddler Is Married to Lee Yaros
description: St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Martha Jane Fiddler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Robert Fiddler of New Orleans and Pass Christian, Miss., to Lee William Yaros, son of John Yaros of Lawrenceville, N.J. and the late Elizabeth Yaros.

title: Interval in a Free, Exciting Life No Longer Chasing Something New
description: EAST HAMPTON YOKO KIRISHIMA, a Japanese writer and television personality whose unconventional way of life as an unmarried mother of three and a roving journalist has shocked her countrymen, has come to eastern Long Island In search of the conservative, conventional life she knew as a child.

title: Red Smith
description: On a couch in John Condon's office in Madison Square Garden there was a body, mostly covered by a tan leather jacket. Where the jacket fell open, a swatch of red Tshirt showed. At this end of the body was a leather cap and at the other a pair of heavy shoes such as a fighter might wear For roadwork. Emile? a visitor asked uncertainly. A hand pushed the cap back and part of Emile Griffith's face showed, the part that smiles. Boy, he said, am I tired! I was up early to do roadwork and I haven't been back to bed yet. Have to do something for television and then go to the gym and I have to buy a tuxedo for the B'nai B'rith dinner because all my tuxes are too small.

title: Poland. Is Not An Exact Fit in Eastern Mold...
description: WARSAW2014;There is a notable difference between Warsaw's relatively lenient treatment of dissidents and the situation in much of the rest of the Eastern bloc. The reasons reflect the growing divergence in the everyday life of Communist countries beneath the taut surface of uniformity, just as the open appearance of even a tiny amount of opposition through Eastern Europe reflects growing unrest.

title: An Opera by Mahler With a Little Help From Weber
description: Why Gustav Mahler never wrote an opera has always been a puzzling question and one, like many of the enigmas surrounding this composer, that can never be adequately answered. Opera, after all, was at the center of his professional life as a conductor, stage director and general impresario. There were a few youthful projects that never left the drawing board, but after he began writing his cycle of symphonies, the question of opera scarcely ever arose again.

title: Stance, TwoStep, Kick Turn and Those Magic Words: Help Help, Help
description: The travel, fashion and sports sections of this and other newspapers paint an alluring picture of skiing, a picture that underscores the esthetic and the social and underplays the anaesthetic and the surgical.

title: When did citizens become strangers?; The Fall of Public Man By Richard Sennett. 373 pp. New York: Alfred A. Knopf. $15. Public Man
description: This is a most ambitious book: simple in theme, complex in theory and methodology, almost exotically diverse in illustrative material. Richard Sennett seems as much at ease with the diversity and significance of 18thcentury fashion as with the performing style of Liszt, the sociological insight afforded by the theatre d'art or the behavioral patterns involved in the Dreyfus case. Indeed Sennett's book is like a dazzling firework display illuminating the night; alas, a fireworks display leaves little behind, only burnt cartridges and charred sticks; darkness returns.

title: Cauthen's 6 Winners Tie New York Mark
description: Damn kid, a losing bettor muttered yesterday at Aqueduct as 16 yearold Steve Cauthen rode to a narrow victory in the first race.

title: Playwright Miguel Pinero Brings His Eyes To the Tombs
Pardon Brings Cautious Response From Some War Exiles in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 22Now that President Carter has pardoned the Vietnam draft evaders, how do fugitive American war resisters feel about going home after years of selfexile in Canada? A check among resisters today brought a variety of answers.

title: Trash Disposal: A Smoldering Issue
description: ROSLYN THE SMOKESTACK from the North Hempstead incinerator rises 269 feet above Roslyn Harbor and, like the steamboats that once brought prosperity to the harbor, puffs clouds of white smoke into the skies. The steamboats are long gone and, like the boats, the town's garbagedisposal system appears headed for obsolescence. Of the 1,000 tons of garbage that this, the most prosperous of Nassau County's three towns. generates each day, half is burned in the three furnaces of the incinerator and half is dumped into landfill sites at the nearby Port Washington sandpits.

title: ART
description: ROSLYN LARRY FRANK is no casual observer, on the contrary, he is a visual eavesdropper who tares in all that surrounds him; an interloper who assertively infringes on the American landscape; an irrepressible who tells all, leaving out no secret details.

title: Borg Defeats Panatta, Saving 3 Match Points
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Jan. 22Three times today Adriano Panetta had his opponent on the ropes, set up for the knockout blow. Three times he had Bjorn Borg at match point. Three times he saw the moment pass. Three strikes and you're out.

title: U.S. Seizes a Grounded Vessel To Collect for Avoiding an Oil Spill
description: BOSTON, Jan. 22 (Reuters)A small Britishowned cargo vessel that ran aground near shellfish grounds with oil aboard four days ago was impounded by the Coast Guard today.

title: Why Gas Is Out In the Cold
description: THE frigid weather that brought howling winds and subzero temperatures to much of the state last week caught the major power companies unprepared for the onslaught, which sapped scarce naturalgas supplies and caused thousands of workers to be idled when their plants were forced to close because of a lack of fuel.

title: INTERVIEW
description: WITH the Legislature scheduled to take up this week a measure designed to make New Jersey the 21st state to have a fulltime commission to stimulate motionpicture and television production. Sidney Kingsley, the playwright expected to head the commission, was talking the other day about promises and problems.

title: Quinlan Case Spurs Legislation
description: ECHOES of the Karen Ann Quinlan case will be heard in the State Assembly in Trenton on Wednesday, when a legislative committee conducts hearings on bills designed to give doctors added criteria to make a determination of death and to permit patients to refuse futile medical treatment.

title: Teamsters Report WriteOff of Loss For Pension Fund
description: CHICAGO, Jan, 22 (UPI)The principal pension fund of International Brotherhood of Teamsters has written off about $118 million in potential investment losses in the last two years as a result of the depressed real estate market, a Teamsters spokesman said today.

title: Giscard's View Of Daoud Affair
description: President Val00E9;ry Giscard d'Estaing of France, acting as if the best defense were a good offense, has directly and indirectly blamed West Germany for the Abu Daoud affair, while failing to respond to the accusations made against his own Government.

title: Hill, an Exception
description: Despite Governor Carey's clemency proclamation December, which proposed to close the book on the 1971 Attica prison uprising, John Hill, a prisoner serving 20 years to life for the fatal beating of a prison guard during the incident, has been denied parole. Thus Mr. Hill remains the only person still imprisoned from a crime directly related to the incident. The Governor's proclamation had made Mr. Hill eligible for parole immediately, instead of in 1994, as decreed in his original sentence. But the Board denied his release and said it would not reconsider parole until 1979. In response to angry statements from Mr. Hill's attorneys, who termed the denial an indecent and Inhumane act, Governor Carey said that the State Board of Parole was an independent agency, whose action did not involve the Governor.

title: CARTER IS UNDECIDED ON DIRECTOR OF C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  President Carter mixed the business of his new job with postinaugural hospitality today, presiding over the first meeting of his National Security Council and welcoming another long line of visitors to a chilly White House.

title: Foreman, Pummels Agosto And Stops Him in Fourth
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., Jan. 22 (AP) George Foreman smashed Pedro Agosto to the floor five times today and stopped him in the fourth round in Foreman's first fight, of 1977, a year in which he hopes to march back to the world heavyweight championship.

title: Property Taxes Forcing Many Small Airports to Close
description: I bought an airplane and needed a decent place to keep it, said Robert Freed, an Ohio real estate broker. So I bought an airport.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
Ashby Gore Wed to D.C. GodfreyThomas
description: Beverly Ashby Gore, daughter of Henry Grady Gore Jr. of Washington and Potomac, Md., and Mrs. Donald T. Oakes of Tannersville, N. Y., was married in Maldon, Essex, England, yesterday to David Charles GodfreyThomas, son of the Rev. and Mrs. C. S. G. GodfreyThomas of Maldon. The bridegroom's father performed the ceremony in St. Michael's Anglican Church, of which he is vicar.

title: Next Big Alaska Job: Selling Pipeline Equipment
description: ANCHORAGE, Jan. 22It will be one of the biggest sales in history.The merchandise, valued at about $800 million when new, ranges from 1,500 deluxe twohole outhouses that cost $10,000 apiece new to 1,357 trucks of all types.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Who ever invented mealybugs, anyway? They are the most exasperating, infuriating monsters to encounter on Plants. They never seem to give up.

title: Troubles of the City Ballet And the Cultural Cost
BRIDGE
SOVIET GROWTH RATE IN '76 BEHIND GOALS
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22The Soviet Union last year experienced some of its lowest growth rates in at least 25 years, according to 1976 statistics released today.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE NATION'S GROSS NATIONAL PRODUCT rose at an annual rate of 3 percent in the fourth quarter, compared with a 3.9 percent rise in the third quarter, 4.5 percent in the second quarter and 9.2 percent in the first quarter.... The Federal Reserve said that industrial production rose 0.7 percent in December, following an increase of 1.2 percent in November. . . . The rise in consumer prices last month was 0.4 percent, according to the Labor Department, pushing the Consumer Price Index to 174.3 (1967=100) to register an increase, of 4.8 percent for the year.

title: BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Add one more national championship (of sorts) to the list of bowl games that are played out In January: The Tournament of Business Schools.

title: Fiske Details Attack On Business Crime In Federal Report
description: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan are focusing special attention on business crimes, narcotics traffic and fraud in federally financed programs, according to a report yesterday by United States Attorney Robert B. Fiske Jr.

title: WALTER A. SEIDEL DIES CHURCH ADMINISTRATOR
description: Walter A. Seidel, administrator of Bethlehem Lutheran Church in Baldwin, L.I., since 1963, died yesterday at Mercy Hospital, Rockville Centre, following injuries in a fall a week ago. He was 56 Years old and lived in Baldwin.

title: Robert Henry Simpson
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 21 (AP) Robert Henry Simpson, who became a freedomofspeech folk hero by picketing the state capitol on behalf of various causes for more than a decade, died yesterday. He was 96 years old.

title: Leslie M. Plant To Wed in June
Realty News
description: New signs of life in the highrise residential construction field on the Upper East Side emerged last week as builders reported plans for three luxury apartment houses.

title: The Water Is Warm Because The Sun Shines
description: New York City is hardly a place where one goes around singing O Sole Mio, at least not with much conviction, But Dr. Zebukon Taintor and his wife, Mavis, have found that there actually is enough sunshine to heat the water in their Upper East Side brownstone.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Jan. 22 (AP)Johnny Majors, who guided Pittsburgh to an unbeaten football season, was runaway winner for the coachofthe year honors announced today by the Football Writers Association of America.

title: World News Briefs
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 22 (AP)Jaya Prakash Narayan, symbol of political opposition In India, flew here today for an emotional reunion with his supporters and to help plan a united front against Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in the March national elections.

title: Gail Meister Plans Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Irving Meister of Manhattan have announced the engagement of their daughter, Gail Beth Meister, to Marshall Jan Nachbar, son of Mrs. Irving C. Nachbar of Riverdale, the Bronx, and the late Mr. Nachbar. Mr. Nachbar is an assistant state attorney general.

title: Mr. Carter's Call For Personal and National Humility
description: Jimmy Carter has taken office as the 39th American President with an Inaugural statement different from most others: It explicitly excluded a grand design, even a rhetorical one, and it deliberately emphasized not only the new President's limitations as an individual but the nation's as a member of the world community.

title: A Marriage of Science and Art
Design
description: GALISTEO, N.M.A 15foot outrigger from New Guinea's Sepik River is docked in the middle of the bedroom. A Plains Indian war bonnet, suspended on a thin wire near the dining table, does a slow, hypnotic dance. An American bison head leers over the stark fireplace, and a baby Egyptian mummy rests in its glass coffin by the grand piano.

title: Both Parties Now Court Big Business
description: There is no Republican or Democratic method of collecting garbage or regulating traffic, Fiorello H. La Guardia used to say when he became Mayor of New York City a year after Franklin D. Roosevelt moved from Governor of New York State to the Presidency in 1933.

title: Article 4  No Title
St. John's Overwhelming In 7550 Rout of Princeton
description: The problems that the St. John's basketball team had been going through in recent weeks were just vague memories yesterday as the Redmen put together their best game of the season and defeated Princeton, 7550, before 3,167 persons at Alumni Hall in Hillcrest. Oueens.

title: EnvironmentClass Time
description: DELEGATES from every town and village in Suffolk County will be going to school tomorrow to learn how to carry out the state's new Environmental Quality Review Act in their communities.

title: Ice, Snow Crucible Of Floods
description: THE ice and snow that have brought such joy to New Jersey's skiers and skaters this winter may bring tears In March. A state floodprevention official says that the buildup of snow and ice has a potential for disaster this spring.

title: Helping to Find the Right
