I. du Pont de Nemours & Company said it would increase its monomer capacity by over 50 percent during the next 18 months by expanding the company's Parkersburg, W.Va., manufacturing facilities for fluoroplastics. The company said it also planned to expand its polymer and copolymer resin capacities in stages after the monomer capacity increase.

title: 11 Nassau Firemen Hurt
description: Eleven firemen were injured in two fires in Nassau County, 10 of them when a home in Bay Park exploded after it caught fire. Six of the volunteer firemen from East Rockaway were blown out of the onestory house while fighting the fire and four others were injured by flying debris.

title: Advertising
description: Total pretax income of black Americans will increase 13.2 percent this year to $87.3 billion, Andrew F. Brimmer, president of Brimmer & Company and former governor of the Federal Reserve System, predicted yesterday.

title: FIRST BOSTON INC. PROFIT ROSE 83% IN 4TH QUARTER
description: First Boston Inc., parent company of the First Boston Corporation, reported yesterday that its earnings for the fourth quarter of 1976 were $8.6 million, or $2.59 a share, up 83 percent from $4.7 million, of $1.47 a share, in the period a year earlier. Revenues totaled $39.8 million, up from $27 million in the fourth quarter of 1975.

title: P.S.C. Agrees to Consider A New, Fuller Application For Phone Rate Increase
description: The Public Service Commission, which last month rejected an application by the New York Telephone Company for a $393 million rate increase on the ground that the utility had not submitted sufficient data, agreed yesterday to consider an amplified application.

title: Fiat Gets Backing For Libyan Deal
description: TURIN, Italy, Jan. 27 (Reuters)Fiat said today that it had obtained all necessary ministerial authorizations for the planned $416 million Libyan capital participation and loan agreement with Fiat, and is awaiting only final approval from the Government's credit committee.

title: Figure in Reporter's Murder Links Mexico Escape Offer to Millionaire
description: PHOENIX, Jan. 27A confessed participant in the murder of Don Bolles, the Phoenix newspaper reporter who died after his car was bombed last June 2, testified today that he had been offered a chance to escape to Mexico with the help of Kemper Marley Sr.

title: ABC Took a Gamble With Roots and Is Hitting Paydirt
description: ABCTV has hit the jackpot with its gamble in scheduling Roots over eight consecutive nights beginning last Sunday. That pattern of presentation is rare in primetime television and risky, since ABC's ratings for an entire week would have been seriously damaged if the program had failed to capture the fancy of the viewers on the first night.

title: Gas Pipeline Planned
description: The Oklahoma Natural Gas Company said it would build a $10 million 66mile pipeline in western Oklahoma to carry additional reserves to customers in Oklahoma. The line, to be built in Beckham and Custer Counties, will take gas being developed near Mayfield, Okla., to the company's system in Custer County.

title: CAREY ISSUES ORDER
description: Confronted by dwindling naturalgas supplies and continuing bitterly cold weather, the Governors of New York and New Jersey declared states of emergency yesterday to cope with the worsening energy crisis.

title: Dallas Schools Pick Disputed Textbook For Biology Class
description: DALLAS, Jan. 27A biology textbook containing the New Testament concept of the creation theory of the origin of man was approved here yesterday by the trustees of the Dallas Independent School District for use as a source book by high school biology students.

title: Product Liability Burden
description: The soaring cost of product liability insurance has led small businesses to ask Congress to provide relief through a Federal reinsurance program. (Page D3.)

title: Cabaret: Bowyer and Bruggeman Demolish the Dance
description: The rise of cabaret in New York in the last few years has been based almost entirely on performances by singers, new singers breaking through with new material and new styles as well as old singers reasserting neglected styles. Within recent weeks, however, comedy has become the most provocative element in the cabaretsnot the superficial humor of standup comics who fire off a hopeful scattershot of one liners, but comedy that stems from situation or character.

title: 22 Are Missing in a Minnesota Fire
description: BRECKENRIDGE, Minn., Jan. 28 (AP)Twentytwo persons were unaccounted for after a fire swept an old threestory brick hotel in blizzardlike conditions before dawn today. The temperature was 23 degrees below zero.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A tender offer by the WallaceMurray Corporation for all the shares of Hydrometals Inc. was incorrectly described in yesterday's Times. WallaceMurray will pay $20.50 a share for common shares and $35.875 a share for preferred shares, or a total of $46.6 million. All the directors of Hydrometals have agreed to tender their shares.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28A reduction in farmers use of pesticides by as much as twothirds, with no loss in food production, is the goal of an electrostatic spraying system that was patented this week. It coats plants while leaving the earth and air unscathed.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: U.S. Shows Trade Deficit For Last Year of 5.9 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28  An export pickup, probably reflecting the end of strikes in the auto and businessequIpment industries, led to a narrowing of the American trade deficit last month, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: LowCost From Greece: A Medicine for Misery
description: ATHENSIn the Bacchae by Euripides, Tiresias recalls that Dionysus, the god of wine and revelry, first gave wine to man. Filled with that good gift, says the blind seer, suffering mankind forgets its grief. There is no other medicine for misery.

title: Plenty of Takers for Jobs Without Pay
description: The respect for the work ethicevery man should earn his own keep, the laborer is worthy of his hirehas always made anyone who insisted upon working without pay seem something of an anomaly.

title: Opera:Walkure of Leinsdorf
description: Wagner's Die Walkiire returned to the Metropolitan Opera repertory last night, with some changes. This is the production originally conceived by Herbert von Karajan, and he did conduct Walkre and Dan Rheingold in New York, but he never did finish the cycle, Nobody admired this Ring concept very much. It was dark, it had all the neoBayreuth clichs, complete with open and closed turntable, and it posed as many problems as it attempted to solve.

title: Letters
description: Schools: Predetermined H.E.W. Conclusions

title: OIL NATIONALIZATION IN VENEZUELA QUIET
description: CARACAS, VenezuelaA year after nationalization of Venezuela's $5 billion petroleum industry, the foreign concerns that built and controlled itprincipally ExXon, Royal Dutch/Shell, Mobil and Gulfare receiving approximately $1 billion in compensation and continue to provide marketing outlets and technological aid under contract.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A state appeals court upheld the 30year maximum jail sentence given to a Hunterdon County man who had pleaded guilty to murdering his aunt and uncle. The Appellate Division of Superior Court in Trenton upheld the sentence imposed on Brian J. Rossi, 20 years old, following his guilty plea to seconddegree murder in the 1974 deaths of Charles and Caroline Grund. According to testimony at the trial, Mrs. Grund was shot by Mr. Rossi during an argument over his request for money. Mr. Grund was shot when he returned to the High Bridge home the couple shared with Mr. Rossi.

title: Carey and Byrne, in Washington, Ask for Additional Gas Allocations
Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Golf
Adelphi Five's Season Resumes Next Saturday
Forecasters Say February Will Be Colder Than Usual
Budget Cuts Cool Some Hot Lines
description: Anyone contemplating suicide should not count on being talked out of it by a voice on the red telephone of the New York City suicideprevention hot line. Getting an answer at the longpublicized, 24hour number in not much more dependable than the hot line that television's. Mary Hartman operated for awhile from her kitchen table.

title: As If Imprisonment Itself Is Not Horrendous Enough ...
description: Sexual assault In jails and prisons remains an issue shadowed in fear and embarrassment.

title: Crop Spray Patented
description: An electrostatic spraying system for food crops that leaves the earth and air unaffected while coating plants was patented this week. A member of the University of Georgia faculty received the patent. Page 28.

title: A Proposal to Eliminate Unemployment
description: WASHINGTON  By one momentous act, President Carter and the Congress could eliminate unemployment in the United States, and with little, if any, impact on inflation. How? By passage of a Job Security Act that would provide a job at 75 percent of the prevailing wage for anyone who could not find work.

title: Parole Denied 5 Young Yonkers Men in Beating Case
description: Five young Yonkers men who had been in jail for conspiracy and assault in a baseballbat attack that left a Jordanian busboy partly paralyzed were denied parole this week after the prosecutor recommended that they be kept in prison.

title: Munari, in a Lancia, Wins at Monte Carlo
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, Jan. 28 (AP)Sandro Munari of Italy, with his teammate, Silvio Maiga, drove a Lancia Stratos to an unparalleled third straight victory today in the Monte Carlo rally and equaled the record. of four victories in this event.

title: Shell Lifts Net 6% and Splits Stock
description: The Shell Oil Company announced yesterday a 6 percent advance in earnings for the final quarter of 1976; a twoforone stock split, and a 5centashare increase in the quarterly dividend.

title: NEW U.S. AID FORMULA FOR TRANSIT IS URGED
description: City and state transportation officials appealed yesterday for new Federalaid formulas to keep New York's subways and buses running.

title: U.S. Policy on Soviet: A TwoEdged Attitude
BLIZZARD TIGHTENS ENERGY CRISIS
description: A fierce blizzard roared across the nation's already frozen Central States and into the East last night, nearly paralyzing vast areas with winds up to 60 miles an hour, blinding snow and drifts, desperate shortages of natural gas and shutdowns of factories and schools.

title: Freddie Prinze Wounded in Head
Yellow Pages to Run Planned Parenthood Ad
description: The New York Telephone Company decided to let Planned Parenthood of New York City run its full advertisement in the 1977 Manhattan and Bronx Yellow Pages after all.

title: Murder Retrial Postponed For Manson Case Figure
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 28 (UPI)  The retrial of Leslie Van Houten for the murder of a Los Angeles couple in 1969 was postponed today until March 28 to give a defense lawyer time to go through some 35,000 pages of testimony from the original trial.

title: Corporation Affairs
Frozen Image
description: The best thing to do on this bitter cold weekend Is to think ahead to the summer's heat. Not to feel better, but worse. There is no magic in shouting emergency and declaring disaster as schools and factories shut down along the path of the Arctic winds. We can spread the shortages of gas more widely to share the pain but years of neglect and irrational energy management cannot be corrected in a storm. The trick is to freeze this picture of alarm and devastation so that it will survive the mush of lethargy that always sets in with the first thaw.

title: Flames' Goal Earns 33 Tie With Rockies
description: ATLANTA, Ja. 28 (UPI)Guy Chouinard slapped in a.rebound off his shot tonight as the Atlanta Flames played to a 33 tie with the Colorado Rockies in the National Hockey League.

title: Bribe Case Figures Not in Top Jobs
RITA LIPMAN
description: Rita Lipman, widow of Herbert Lipman, founder of the Lipman Advertising Company, 600 Third Avenue, died Wednesday in the Long Beach Memorial Nursing Home on Long Island after a long illness. She had lived at the Nautilus Hotel, Atlantic Beach, L. I., and was 77 years old. Mrs. Lipman is survived by a son, Robert S.; a daughter, Audrey Ansel, five grandchildren and two greatgrandchildren.

title: List of 15 Dissidents In Appeal by Sakharov
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28Andrei D. Sakharov, in his letter to President Carter, listed 15 dissidents Who needed support. The list, with available information about those named, follows:

title: O'Shaughnessy Does Indoor Mile in 3:55.4
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Jan. 28 (AP)Niall O'Shaughnessy, an Irishman running for Arkansas, did the mile in 3 minutes 55.4 seconds tonight, the second best indoor mile on record.

title: Finder of Hughes Will Allowed to Leave Nevada
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 28 (UPI)Melvin Dummar was allowed to leave Nevada today after four days of questioning by lawyers in which he adhered to his account of finding at his Utah gas station Howard R. Hughes's purported Mormon will leaving him millions of dollars.

title: Deborah Eldredge du Pont Wed to A. Michael Hogan
description: Deborah Eldredge du Pont of St. David's, Pa., and Honolulu and A. Michael Hogan of Honolulu were married at the Colony Surf Hotel there yesterday. The Rev. Douglas Oldsen performed the Protestant ceremony.

title: Beersheba, Once Scorned by Israelis, Is Booming Amid the Desert
If It Isn't Too Cold, It's Too Hot
description: With no relief in sight, the heat wave has become the No. 1 topic of conversation in a midtown office building.

title: Terrorists Adopt Victim's Name
description: CUPERTINO, Calif., Jan. 28 (UPI)A terrorist group that claims responsibility for the bombing of an electrical power station has taken the name of a cold wave victim in Ohio. The Eugene Kuhn unit of the New World Liberation Front. in a message left for the police, said that ithad planted four pipe bombs that rocked a major Pacific Gas and Electric `Company complex early yesterday south of San Francsico, near San Jose. The polite Said that the message, which they found today. identified Mr. Kuhn as a 74yearold man who froze to death in his home because his utilities had been turned off for nonpayment of an $18 bill.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Bars Critic From Post
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 28Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government today embroiled itself in a new controversy with the legal profession by declining to appoint as Chief Justice of the Supreme Court a man who had taken a strong stand against the suspension of civil liberties here.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Heatless Building Typifies Miseries in Brownsville
description: Louise King has official letters that help attest to the miseries of a frigid winter in Brownsville. One, from the city, informed her that the $75 rent she paid for four rooms in a crumbling building could be reduced by half because of, as the form tersely stated, no heat or hot water.

title: An Invitation to Mondale For Visit to South Korea Reportedly Turned Down
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28The Carter Administration has turned down a request from the South Korean Government that Vice President Mondale visit Seoul during his current tour abroad, according to American officials and diplomatic sources.

title: Watson Tied For Lead In Coast Golf
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 28 (AP)Tom Watson, hoping for a second consecutive victory mastered the par5 holes on his way to a fiveunderpar 67 that put him in a threeway tie for the secondround lead today in the $180,000 Andy WilliamsSan Diego open golf tournament.

title: Miss Guthrie Enters Race
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Jan. 28 (AP) Final entries received today for the Feb. 20 Daytona 500 stock car race include Janet Guthrie and Donnie Allison. The official entry of Miss Guthrie marks the first time a woman has entered the world's most prestigious stock car race. She competed in the Firecracker 400 here last July and finished 15th after starting in 33d position.

title: People and Business
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 Roderick M. Hills, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, has submitted his resignation from the agency effective upon its acceptance at the pleasure of President Carter.

title: Seton HallHoly Cross Set for Garden Final
description: Seton Hall and Holy Cross renew their longstanding basketball rivalry today in the championship round of the annual Madison Square Garden Classic.

title: Notes on People
description: A hero's welcome was accorded Luis Corvalan yesterday when he arrived in East Berlin from Moscow. The Chilean Communist Party leader, released from jail in his native country last month in exchange for the release of a Soviet dissident, was received in East Germany in a manner usually reserved for a head of state or ruling party leader. Erich Honecker, the Communist Party leader, and the entire Politburo led tie thousands who greeted Mr. Corvalan at the airport. You have become a symbol for the antifascist resistance struggle of the Chilean people, Mr. Honecker told the visitor, who will be in East Germany for five days.

title: News Summary
description: A blizzard swept across the already frozen Central states into the East, nearly paralyzing vast areas with winds up to 60 miles an hour. The National Weather Service described conditions in the Central States as unmerciful. Temperatures were dropping in the New Jersey suburbs, but the weather service said the metropolitan area would be spared the worst of the storm. [1:6.]

title: LEADING INDICATORS FOR ECONOMY SURGE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28One of the Government's principal economic barometers, the composite index of leading indicators, showed its biggest gain in a year and a half last month.

title: Philharmonic's Kohloff Shines in Rake Timpani Solo
description: Roland Kohloff, the New York Philharmonic's principal timpanist, had a rare opportunity to perform as a soloist in the orchestra's Thursday night concert in Avery Fisher Hall. Mr. Kohloff, who succeeded his former teacher, the noted Saul Goodman, in 1972, was heard in the New York premiere of Franco Donatoni's Concertino for Strings, Brass and Solo Timpani.

title: News Summary
description: A blizzard swept across the already frozen Central states into the East, nearly paralyzing vast areas with winds up to 60 miles an hour. The National Weather Service described conditions in the Central States as unMerciful. Temperatures were dropping in the New Jersey suburbs, but the weather service said the metropolitan area would be spared the worst of the storm: [1:6.]

title: Ethiopian Students Attack U.S. and British Centers
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, lan. 28 (Reu ters)  Ethiopian students threw firebombs and stones at the American Cultural Center in Addis Ababa today, then attacked a similar British center and tried to set it on fire.

title: 6 Czechs Are Pressed to Emigrate
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 28 (Reuters)Six prominent Czechoslovak campaigners for human rights came under official pressure today to leave voluntarily for Austria in the next 48 hours, but dissident sources said all were resisting the move.

title: Nixon Must Give Up Tapes in Civil Cases, Appeals Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia dealt Richard M. Nixon another setback today in his efforts to keep his White House tape recordings out of the public domain. The court ruled that he must yield tapes in civil as well as criminal cases.

title: Czechs Retooling Skoda Plant for New Car
description: MLADA BOLESLAV, Czechoslovakia After 13 years of producing some 1.2 million cars of the same basic model, Czechoslovakia's Skoda Works are retooling for a new, more powerful car.

title: Ding Schoonmaker Sails To Another Bacardi Title
description: MIAMI, Jan. 28 (AP)James (Ding) Schoonmaker of Miami kept the 1977 Bacardi Cup for Star Class yachts today by placing third in the last of five heats. Schoonmaker, the defending champion, has won seven Bacardi titles since 1953.

title: India Batsmen Checked By England in Cricket
description: BANGALORE, India, Jan. 28 (Reuters) Another modest Indian batting display enabled England to establish control of the fourth cricket test here today. The pitch offered the bowlers little assistance after the sun dried up the early morning dew. But after Anshuman Gaekwad and Surinder Amarnath had added 93 runs in two hours for the second wicket, India slumped to 205 runs for six wickets at the close of the first day.

title: American Boxers Hope to End EightYear Jinx Against Soviet
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 28The ninth annual team boxing competition between the United States and the Soviet Union takes place tomorrow at Caesars Palace, where the series began in 1969, with the American team still seeking its first victory,

title: Caramanlis And Caramanlis
Dave Anderson
description: When the New York Jets signed Matt Snell several years ago, the fullback's adviser was Woody Hayes, his Ohio State coach. Woody Hayes was acting as a friend, not as a financier, but he laughingly asked Weeb Ewbank for a fee.

title: Spain Curbs Rights After 3 Policemen Are Shot to Death
description: MADRID, Jan. 28Gunmen killed three policemen here today and wounded three others in a new outbreak of violence, and the Government sought to cope with the rising challenge to its program of political reform by suspending two constitutional guarantees for a month.

title: Outlook Depresses Bank Stocks
description: Bank stocks sank in price yesterday after a leading brokerage house downgraded the group, citing uncertain earninge prospects for the industry. The Dow Jones industrial average, meanwhile, rose 2.99 points to 957.53 in a session of brisk trading.

title: SPRAGUE DENIES CONFLICT IN ROLES AS PROSECUTOR
Thousands Laid Off by Shortage
description: Utility companies in New York and New Jersey cut off naturalgas supplies to thousands of businesses and industries yesterday and New York City declared a health emergency, as brutally cold weather invaded the metropolitan region in the grin of a fuel shortage.

title: About New York
Nets Are Defeated by Warriors, 10684
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Jan. 28  Outmanned, outrun and outscored as usual, the New York Nets dropped a game to the Golden State Warriors tonight, 10684, before 5,042 fans at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: Cold Speeds Sales of Electric Heaters
description: With bitter, persistent cold plaguing the nation, manufacturers of portable electric heaters are finding themselves flooded with orders and say they may soon be hard pressed to meet the demand.

title: Hepatitis Liability Denied
description: TRENTON, Jan. 28 (AP)A blood bank cannot be found negligent if a patient contracts hepatitis after receiving a transfusion, the Appelate Division of State Superior Court ruled yesterday in the case of Ralph L. Moore Jr. of Woodbury, who was allegedly infected by serum hepatitis as a result of a blood transfusion during surgery. He sued the American Red Cross and the Interstate Blood Bank, several doctors and Underwood Memorial Hospital of Woodbury.

title: Economic Recovery Plan Offered
Bank of England Cuts Rate to 12%
description: LONDON, Jan. 28 (AP)The trend toward lower British interest rates accelerated today as the Bank of England announced that it was cutting its minimum lending rate 1 percentage point to 12 percent, effective Monday.

title: FLOYD SEARS DIES AT 80, A RETIRED TIMES EDITOR
description: Floyd Sears, head of the financial copy desk of The New York Times from 1956 to 1962, died yesterday of leukemia at South Nassau Community Hospital, Oceanside, L. I. He was 80 years old and lived on Glover Place, Baldwin. L. I.

title: President Resigns At United Brands Over a Policy Rift
description: The resignation of Wallace W. Booth es president of the United Brands Comaeof Boston was disclosed yesterday with the announcement that he is being replaced by Seymour Milstein, who has been vice chairman. Mr. Booth reportedly resigned because of a policy disagreement.

title: Abuses Studied at Juvenile Unit
description: JAMESBURG, N, J., Jan. 28 (AP)Investigators from the Department of Corrections and Middlesex County Prosecutor's Office are investigating allegations of brutality and sexual abuse of the Jamesburg Training School for Juveniles. State Corrections Commissioner, Robert Mulcahy, said that a report would be filed within a few days. The allegations concern reports that five female inmates attacked two other girls earlier this month and that guards beat juveniles and had sexual relations with them.

title: Junk Bond Mutual Fund
description: Drexel Burnham & Company is trying an unusual method of marketing a mutual fund that specializes in junk bonds. Page 28.

title: Spain Curbs Rights After 3 Policemen Are Shot to Death
description: MADRID, Jan. 28Gunmen killed three policemen here today and wounded three others in a new outbreak of violence, and the Government sought to cope with the rising challenge to its program of political reform by suspending two constitutional guarantees for a month.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Columbia Tops Yale
description: There were two significant events last night at Columbia University's Levien Gym. Columbia walloped Yale, 7144, in an Ivy League basketball game, and Alton Byrd, the Lions backcourt wizard, broke the school's singleseason assist record.

title: Bridge:
description: It is not uncommon for a declarer to examine the dummy when it appears and do a little grieving. He has reached the wrong contract, and is worrying more about what went astray in the bidding than how to make the contract he has actually reached.

title: Text of Sakharov Letter to Carter on Human Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28Following is the text of a letter written on Jan. 21 to President Carter by Andrei D. Sakharov, the Soviet dissident, and delivered to the State Department today. The original Russian was translated by Dr. Sakharov's wife and friends in Moscow and that English translation, which was given to the department, is repeated here with minor changes in the translation for clarification:

title: PHILADELPHIANS IDLE IN SHUTOFF OF GAS
description: PHILADELPHIA Jan. 28Thousands of Philadelphians personally felt the impact of the naturalgas shortage today as layoffs followed immediately after the city's, gas works told its 2,300 largest industrial and commercial users they could have no more gas for an indefinite period.

title: Storm Snarls Schedule
description: A blizzard that closed airports, blocked highways and intensified the energy crisis forceda major curtailment of sports activity yesterday, largely in the Midwest.

title: In Luxury Sinking
description: An English architect and writer, Martin Pawley, has invented something called garbage housing. This not meant as a pejorative term, but as a literal label for houses built of old beer bottles, cans and the general detritus of industrial and consumer society. The idea, tinged with a bit of Pop symbolism, is to beat the tyranny of costs and style with a simple act of conservation and ingenuity. Its avowed purpose is to find a rational approach to housing the poor.

title: WILLIAM H. JOHNSTON, 76, DOG TRACK OWNER
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 28 (AP)William H. Johnston, owner of dog racing tracks at Miami Beach, Tampa, Jacksonville and Orange Park and once known as a key man behind the scene in Florida politics, died at his home yesterday. He was 76 years old.

title: The Talking Band Starts CrossMedia Series at St. Mark's
description: The Talking Band, which opened a series of performances Thursday night at St. Mark's Church (the series runs through tomorrow at 8 P.M. and continues next Thursday through Sunday), is exactly what its name implies. It is also a most innovative, impressive experience, in whatever category you choose to place it.

title: Carey's Proposed Cuts in Relief Decried at Hearing in New York
description: Dozens of men and women on welfare, as well as a number of labor and civic organizations, told a group of New York State legislators yesterday that the impact of Governor Carey's proposed home relief cuts would be disastrous, and they urged the lawmakers not to approve such reductions.

title: Vorster Says British Plan For Black Majority Rule Won't Be Forced on Smith
description: CAPE TOWN, Jan. 28Prime Minister John Vorster told Parliament today that South Africa would not exert pressure on the Rhodesian Government to accept British proposals for black rule that were rejected earlier this week by Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: Jamaica and Kaiser Reach Accord
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Jan. 28 (Reuters) Jamaica will sign a $23 million agreement for participation in the operations of the Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation here next week. It will be the second such agreement following an accord reached between the Government and the Aluminum Company of America (Alcoa) late last year. A Mining Ministry official said a third agreement, with the Reynolds Metals Company, would be signed next month.

title: Sakharov Sends Letter to Carter Urging Help on Rights in Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28Andrei D. Sakharov, the Soviet political dissident and human rights advocate, has sent letter to President Carter through the State Department urging him to raise your voice on behalf of persecuted political and religious activists in the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe.

title: New Trend in Civil Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28The Supreme Court is on a new tack on civil rights. It is too soon to know the ultimate destination, but the Court seems to be veering away from the course in earlier years when it led the nation in fightingracial discrimination. ine early wake includes some sharp defeats for civil rights proponents in various cases. The decisions are causing serious worry, and some confusion, in civil rights circles.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A tender offer by the WallaceMuriay Corporation for all the shares of Hydrometals Inc. was incorrectly described in yesterday's Times. WallaceMurray will pay $20.50 a share for common shares and $35.875 a share for preferred shares, or a total of $46.6 million. All the directors of Hydrometals have agreed to tender their shares.

title: Pennsylvania Woman Dies in Fire
description: TITUSVILLE, Pa., Jan. 28 (UPI)A 54yearold woman was killed and her husband was injured early today when fire destroyed their twostory frame home in this Crawford County community.

title: Article 1  No Title
Illuminating State Government by Sunset Laws
description: ALBANY  New York State's continuing tight fiscal situation requires a hard look at the allocation of our limited resources. At a time when money for state programs is scarce, we must be certain that the programs we do have operate efficiently and deliver maximum services to the people.

title: Mondale Has Convivial Evening With British Hosts
description: PARIS, Jan. 28Vice President Mondale, who flew to Paris today from London, was honored last night by Prime Minister James Callaghan at a working dinner that turned into one of the most ebullient nights at 10 Downing Street in years.

title: Miss Pelen, 16, Takes Slalom Race For 2d World Cup Victory in Row
description: SAINT GERVAIS, France, Jan. 28 (AP)Perrine Pelen, a 16yearold French schoolgirl in her second international racing season, surprised the world skiing followers today with her second straight World Cup slalom victory.

title: As the Chilled Head for Cover The Earmuff Makes a Comeback
Bank Guard Helps F.B.I. Capture Holdup Suspect
Article 2  No Title
description: GIRL O MY DREAMS Peg O My Heart is back in town, now on stage for (reportedly) the first time in 30 years. The song of the same name, heard now and then, kept the title alive in recent years. And occasionally there is a revival of the Marion Davies movie, released in 1933, with most critics hailing the actress as the roguish colleen who invaded a stately English manor.

title: Pennsylvania Speaker Denies Guilt
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 28 (AP)House Speaker Herbert Fineman, one of the most powerful men in the Pennsylvania legislature, pleaded not guilty today to Federal charges that he has extorted money from parents to get their children into professional schools. He was arraigned before Federal Magistrate Edwin Nathons. The Speaker is accused of blackmail, bribery, conspiracy, obstruction of justice and mail fraud. He was allowed to remain free under a $50,000 bond.

title: SHIPPING AND MAILS
description: OUTGOING

title: Beersheba, Once Scorned by Israelis, Is Booming Amid the Desert
description: BEERSHEBA, Israel, Jan. 25Not so many years ago, urbane Israelis liked to put,down this now booming town in the Negev Desert in much the way Manhattanites might make snide remarks about Brooklyn or the Bronx.

title: No Shutdowns or Mergers Seen at City U.
description: The chancellor of the City University of New York said yesterday that the system did not plan to shut down any city colleges and that he thought it was unlikely that any institutions would have to be merged for reasons of economy.

title: Norway Ousts 5 Russian's, Links Them to a Spy Ring
description: OSLO, Norway; Jan. 28 (UPI)Norway ordered five Soviet diplomats and newsmen out of the country today in what the Government termed the breakup of an espionage ring involving a Foreign Ministry official.

title: Cutoff of Gas for Some Homes Draws Near, Schlesinger Warns
Strike Threat Eased
description: The threat of a strike on the Staten Island Rapid Transit system was eased when the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court in Brooklyn granted a temporary restraining order against Local 922 of the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. It had appeared earlier that a strike was impending after Justice Irwin Brownstein of State Supreme Court ruled that he lacked jurisdiction to grant a temporary injunction against the local. The injunction had been sought by the parent Metropolitan Transportation Authority. The Appellate Division made the temporary restraining order returnable next Tuesday.

title: Borowiak and Stockton Add Upsets in Tennis
Sakharov Sends Letter to Carter Urging Help on Rights in Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28Andrei D. Sakharov, the Soviet political dissident and human rights advocate, has sent a letter to President Carter through the State Department urging him to raise your voice on behalf of persecuted political and religious activists in the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe.

title: 8 Bombs Set Off in London
Boyle's Murder Conviction Is Upset Over Denial of Defense Testimony
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 28The Pennsylvania Supreme Court today ordered a new trial for W. A. Boyle, the 74yearold former president of the United Mine Workers of America who was convicted almost three years ago of ordering the murder of a union insurgent, Joseph A. Yablonski, and his wife and daughter.

title: Dispossessed by Cold, Families Are in a Housing Limbo
description: NEWARK Jan. 28A group of parents and their children sat glumly in an improvised lounge of the Lincoln Motel here this morning, wondering where they would go next. They had to leave their apartments last Tuesday night after their pipes froze and burst in a building that had been without heat since Jan. 14.

title: Disney Film Forces Fun Harmlessly
Indianapolis Black School Preserves 50Year Identity
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 27The alumni. of Crispus Attucks High School are returning here for the weekend to join with students in the celebration of a rare event the 50th anniversary of a school that has remained black in its orientation.

title: Tobin Joins Pro Eleven
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Jan. 28 (AP)After 10 years as an assistant at Missouri, Vince Tobin is leaving to become defensive coach for the British Columbia Lions of the Canadian Football League. I felt it was the right opportunity to make a change, he said today.

title: State Agencies Offer Assistance In WeatherRelated Difficulties
description: As residents of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut braced for the rigors of a frigid weekend and the critical energy problem, there were a number of things for them to keep in mind if they should need aid in fuel and weatherrelated emergencies.

title: Consumer Notes
description: The State Insurance Department's Consumer Affairs Division has issued a free guide on auto insurance advising consumers on what to look for in policies and the kinds of coverage available.

title: Trenton Topics
Sadat Tours Cairo, To Little Applause
description: CAIRO, Jan. 28In an unusual gesture, President Anwar elSadat rode through the center of Cairo today, waving to people from an open car after attending Friday prayers.

title: Soviet Assailed By a Defector
description: LONDON, Jan. 28Rudolf Barshai, the noted Soviet chamber orchestra conductor, said here today that he left the Soviet Union earlier this month because he could no longer stand the way he was treated by the statebooking agency.

title: INTEREST OF ASARCO IN REVERE IS SOUGHT BY NATIONAL STEEL
description: The National Steel Corporation, the nation's third largest steel producer, an flounced yesterday that it was holding discussions with the Revere Copper and Brass Corporation concerning purchasing the 33 percent interest in Revere Copper and Brass Corporation owned by Asarco Inc.

title: Agee Sees Long Legal Fight Over British Ouster Order
Noon Till Three,Western Satire
Hoffa Foster Son Given OneYear Jail Term
description: DETROIT, Jan. 28 (UPI)  Charles O'Brien, the selfproclaimed foster son of James R. Hotta, the former teamsters president, was sentenced to a year in jail and a $2,500 fine today for a Federal labor law violation.

title: Outbreaks of Flu Reported In at Least 23 States
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 28 (UPI)Midwinter outbreaks of influenza or flulike illnesses, striking mostly school children or young adults, were reported in 23 states today by the National Center for Disease Control.

title: Burt Mustin Dead
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 28 (AP) Burt Mustin, one of Hollywood's oldest and busiest actors, died today at the. Glendale Manor Hospital in Glendale, a family spokesman said.

title: Joffrey Cancels Spring Season
description: In a surprise move, the Joffrey Ballet announced yesterday that financial We hope to expand that season to its scheduled spring season at the City Center 55th Street Theater.

title: LEADING INDICATORS FOR ECONOMY SURGE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28One ,of the Government's . principal economic barometers, the composite index of leading indicators, showed its biggest gain in year and a half last month.

title: Parishes Threaten to Defy Teacher Voting Order
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan 28 (AP)Citing the principle of separation of church and state, pastors of 228 Roman Catholic parishes in the Philadelphia Archdiocese say they will defy a Federal order concerning union representation for some lay teachers.

title: Jury Acquits Aide At Holiday Magic Of Fraud Charges
description: A former employee of a bankrupt cosmetics company, Holiday Magic Inc., was acquitted last night of charges that he had participated in a pyramid promotion scheme that allegedly obtained millions of dollars from thousands of investors throughout the country.

title: Stevens Students Ask Arbitration To End Walkout by 57 of Faculty
The Underwear Solution
description: President Carter has fumbled his first chance at effective leadership. Faced with a heatingfuel shortage, he proposes that Americans set back the thermostat to 65 degrees. What he should be doing is calling on his countrymen to achieve underwear parity with the Soviet Union.

title: Times Plans to Sell Music Unit To Freddy Bienstock Concern
description: An agreement for the sale of The New York Times Music Corporation to Freddy Bienstock Enterprises, a leading music publisher, was announced yesterday by Sydney Gruson, executive vice president of The New York Times Company. The price, paid in cash, was not disclosed.

title: Fire Case Withdrawn
description: An application for an injunction to block the transfer of Rescue Company 2 from Fort Green in Brooklyn to the Northside section of Williamsburg was withdrawn from the State Supreme Court in Brooklyn. Doron Gopstein, assistant corporation counsel, told Justice Irwin Brownstein that the city had now decided against moving the unit.

title: Doctor Is Indicted
description: A Brooklyn doctor was indicted on six counts of selling amphetamines and barbiturates to undercover Drug Enforcement Administration agents. United States Attorney David G. Trager identified the suspect as Dr. Joseph Dollinger, 66 years old, of 190 Dover Street. He said that Dr. Dollinger sold 2,000 of the pills to the agents between last Nov. 1 and Jan. 4. Dr. Dollinger was arraigned before Judge Henry Bramwell of Federal District Court and was released in his own recognizance pending trial. If convicted, he could be sentenced to five years in jail and a $15.000 fine.

title: Skiing
description: AT BURKE MOUNTAIN, VT.

title: People in Sports
description: The New York Mets, who signed nobody in the recent gold rush for free agents, say they are miles apart in contract talks with Dave Kingman, an outfielder who led the club with 37 home runs last season and batted in 86 runs. Kingman reportedly wants a multiyear pact.

title: Trudeau Calls for a Quick Vote On Independence Issue in Quebec
description: QUEBEC, Jan. 28  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau called on the people of this Frenchspeaking Province today to make up their minds quickly and finally on the issue of independence so that we can get on with the pursuit of happiness for the men and women of this country.

title: Carter's and Pollster's View of Public May Slow Administration's Tempo
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28  President Carter and his 26yearold campaign adviser on public opinion polling, Patrick H. Caddell, have continued their running seminar on the mood of the American people, and their conclusions will probably do much to shape the Carter Administration.

title: College Results
description: MEN'S BASKETBALL

title: BLIZZARD TIGHTENS ENERGY CRISIS
description: A fierce blizzard roared across the nation's already frozen Central States and into the East last night, nearly paralyzing vast areas with winds up to 60 miles an hour, blinding snow and drifts, desperate shortages of natural gas and shutdowns of factories and schools.

title: St. Louis Symphony Offers Unfinished Mass by Mozart
description: Mozart's unfinished Mass in C minor is a problem that can never really be solved. Most performances nowadays content themselves with offering the music that Mozart actually completedKyrie, Gloria, Sanctus and Benedictus. A few go on with somebody's reconstruction of the Credo and Incarnatus, which were left in fragmentary form by the composer.

title: 5 Northwest Utilities Win Round In Air Quality Fight With E.P.A.
description: BILLINGS. Mont., Jan. 28 (AP)A consortium of power companies has won at least a partial victory over the Environmental Protection Agency in a battle to subject them to strict new air quality standards in the construction of a $1 billion power complex in southeastern Montana.

title: The Strain in Spain
description: Sometimes there is nothing more to do than to wring hands, the same hands that were so recently applauding Spain's rapid march from autocracy toward parliamentary government King Juan Carlos and Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez deserve American sympathy and encouragement as they seek to contain the violence of left and right extremists, the direct descendants of those who destroyed the Spanish Republic 40 years ago. There are not many other democracies aborning.

title: Barge Grounded Off Bay State Leaking Oil, Coast Guard Says
description: BUZZARDS BAY, Mass., Jan. 28 (AP) A barge carrying 3.3 million gallons of home heating oil ran aground today in Buzzards Bay and began leaking oil from her damaged cargo hold. The Coast Guard said the vessel was in danger of sinking.

title: Article 4  No Title

Article 5  No Title
Dividends
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 28. 1977

title: Professor, 38, Raped and Robbed In 21Minute Attack on IRT Train
State Agencies Offer Assistance In WeatherRelated Difficulties
description: As residents of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut braced for the rigors of a frigid weekend and the critical energy problem, there were a number of things for them to keep in mind if they should need aid in fuel and weatherrelated emergencies.

title: 1st Carter TV Talk Set for Wednesday
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 (UPI)Presldent Carter will hold his first televised report to the nation Wednesday night to outline the problems he faces in his first year, a White House spokesman said today.

title: Raleigh Descendant Dies
description: TORQUAY, England, Jan. 28 (AP)Comdr. Walter Raleigh Gilbert, a descendant of Sir Walter Raleigh, died at his home near here Wednesday. He was 88.

title: Screen Actors Issue Resolution Deploring TV Shows Violence
description: A resolution deploring excessive vio. lence in television programming has been passed by the board of directors of the Screen Actors Guild. The union has 32,000 members, many of whom appear in socalled action shows.

title: DISSIDENTS BID WEST STAND BY SAKHAROV
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 28Four Soviet writers with links to the dissident movement today asked leaders in the West, including President Carter, to express their support for the dissident physicist Andrei D. Sakharov, who has come under new official pressure.

title: Budget Cuts Cool Some Hot Lines
description: Anyone contemplating suicide should not count on being talked out of it by a voice on the red telephone of the New York City suicideprevention hot line. Getting an answer at the longpublicized, 24hour number is not much more dependable than the hot line that television's Mary Hartman operated for awhile from her kitchen table.

title: High Tides Around New York
Article 3  No Title
Charity Begins When Workday Ends For Many of New York's Volunteers
Thousands Laid Off by Shortage
description: Utility companies in New York and New Jersey cut off naturalgas supplies to thousands of businesses and, industries yesterday and New York City declared a health emergency, as brutally cold weather invaded the metropolitan region in the grip of a fuel shortage.

title: A. L. Owners Will Meet To Discuss Realignment
description: American League owners will meet in Tampa, Fla., on March 24 to consider a proposal that would realign their 14 clubs into three divisions starting with the 1978 season, a league spokesman said yesterday.

title: BANKERS AND HEADS OF CITY UNIONS MEET
description: Leaders of municipal unions and the major bankers in New York City met with Mayor Beame yesterday and held what they said was a constructive discussion that nonetheless did not lead to any resolution of their dispute over outside control of city finances.

title: Personal Investing
African Woodstock Overshadows Festival
description: LAGOS. Nigeria, Jan. 28The most exciting part of the Second World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture is not the scholarly papers being read at the colloquium, with titles such as Dravidian and NegroAfrican Ethnic and Linguistic Affinities. Or even the drama and dance staged in the new National Theater, which is airconditioned, heavily euarded and sparselv attended. It is rather the nightlyparties and tam sessions Caking place at Festac Village, a barracksstyle housing development for 22.000 people six miles out of town that has become an African Woodstock.

title: Trading in Futures Delayed in Chicago By Severe Weather
description: The opening of trading in farm commodities on the Chicago Board of Trade was delayed for 30 minutes until 10 A.M. yesterday because of the bitter cold weather prevailing in the Midwest. All (futures contracts opened strong but some apparent speculative liquidation later in the day turned prices downward.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Bergland Sees U.S. Taking Farm Price Role Globally
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28Secretary of Agriculture Bob Bergland says he believes the United States can negotiate global agreements on buffer stocks and price corridors to protect the world's farmers and consumers against wild gyrations in supplies and costs of food.

title: Portugal Converts an OldLine Company
description: LISBONC.U.F. was one of the symbols of the old regime and as such had to be destroyed, says Antonio Vasco de Melo, president of Portugal's Confederation of Industry.

title: MORE PLANTS CLOSING
The Icy Impact in Dollars and Cents
TAX REFUND FRAUDS COST I.R.S. MILLIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 29In Detroit the Internal Revenue Service lost at least S250.000 to a band of 30 con artists.

title: Germany's Sales of Nuclear Reactors Sparking Discord
description: BONNChancellor Helmut Schmidt and President Jimmy Carter appear headed for a showdown this year over the sale of potentially dangerous nuclear technology to developing countries.

title: Congress Faced With Tough Decisions on Clean Air Standards
Pro Football Pact Talks Relieve Anxiety Slightly
description: They're talking. That was the only crumb of news that swept through pro football last week. It was grabbed because the sport is so ridden with anxiety among management, players, wouldbe players and agents. All parties are awaiting the outcome of the longstanding negotiations between the National Football League's Management Council. representing theowners, and the Players Association,

title: Computers  and Communism
description: VIENNANot that it's the sort of thing that's easily misplaced, but an International Business Machines System 370 computer was .delivered to an Austrian affiliate of a West German concern recently and, presto, disappeared.

description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 29President Carter summoned his Cabinet to an emergency weekend meeting today to urge them to work collectively and individually to employ the resources of the Federal Government in assisting areas of the country suffering from severe winter weather and the fuel shortage.

Questions/Answers
description: How can I encourage coffee beans to develop on my plant, which is four feet tall? G.L., Clifton, N.J.

title: Traffic Innovations, Western Style
description: PORTLAND, Ore.Portland has become one of America's most innovative cities in dealing with the automobile, but the engines of change have caused internal combustion for many a driver.

title: Making Paper That Sings
Why Austrians Don't Strike
description: VIENNAWhen the Austrian state radio reported recently that another general strike had started in neighboring Italy, the announcer commented, But that is hardly news.

title: Youth Who Prefers the 880 Captures Mile at Armory
Paris Attracts Munitions Buyers
description: PARISThe biggest selling point for French arms is Paris and France itself. a Western diplomat remarked recently. People love to come to Paris or live on the Riviera.

title: Soviet Ads  Why Try Zip and Flair When a Fact Will Do?
description: MOSCOWHigh above a building on Gorky Street here stands an immense electric billboard that would do nicely in Times Square. Covered with thousands of colored lights, it is designed to radiate animated, commerical messages to drivers and pedestrians below.

description: The grass continues to get greener (literally) for executives outside of the United States.

title: How Grumman Recruits Uncle Sam
description: WASHINGTON is the center for grown men who collect model airplanes. Dozens of offices throughout the city house impressive plastic warplanes and spaceships that any 12yearold would be proud (and lucky) to own.

title: Trade Negotiators Look to Blumenthal
description: GENEVAThe world's trading nations are at a crossroads, warns Olivier Long, director general of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, where each is tempted to ease the pressures on its own economy by protecting home markets,

title: Population: Winning the War
description: There is evidence that the population bomb is being defused.The number of human beings on the planet reached 4 billion last year, but population experts, for years longfaced with gloom, have been sounding optimistic lately, if not downright cheerful.

title: Combat in the fictional zone
description: The unfortunate Garboesque title of this book conceals an impressive first novel. Ingrid Bengis is the author of Combat in the Erogenous  Zone, an excellent feminist book, half of which is on the subject of manhating; surprisingly, this new book is an extremely sensuous love story. _ But the contrast between the two books is not as marked as one might assume. In Combat, Bengis asserts that women tend. to lose their independence and identity in love, and that this is specifically female behavior from which men are exempt. This is true to what occurs in her new book.

title: Where Time Stands Still
description: Hidden on a small plateau in the deep interior of central Peru, 8,000 feet above sea level, surrounded by steaming jungle and snowcapped mountains, stands the ancient Inca city of Machu Picchu. No one lives there. No one works there. And no one knows why it was built.

title: Cotton Mather, On Fire and Ice
Pragmatism
description: CARACASThe trend toward joint venturesrather than outright nationalizationis easing the bitter confrontation between government and foreign investors in Latin America.

title: Carter and Cold Weather Economics
description: WASHINGTONIt's come out of the blue, the frigid blue, and is now snowballing the economy much as the OPEC price increases and oil embargo did three years ago.

title: Marriage Announcement 5  No Title
description: Kathleen Kenny Betrothed

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Donald Black to Wed Jean Ellen Thomson
description: The engagement of Jean Ellen Thomson to Donald Turner Black has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. James C. Thomson of West Chester, Pa., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Donald M. Black of New Canaan, Conn.

title: Two Plays Bow Off Broadway This Week
description: MARCO POLO SINGS A SOLOAnne Jackson, Joel Grey, Madeline Kahn and, at the rear, Chris Sarandon and James Jansen are in John Guare's play. The comedy, which takes place on an iceberg in 1999, opens Saturday at the Public. Mel Shapiro directed the New York Shakespeare Festival production.

title: Where Are The Stakhanovites?; Productivity Is a Weak Spot In the Planned Soviet Economy
description: MOSCOWOn an August night in 1935, a coal miner named Aleksei G. Stakhanov hewed 102 tons of Ukrainian coal14 times his normal quotaduring a single shift. His feat was choreographed by Stalin into the Stakhanovite movement calculated to make Russians work harder.

title: Squabble Over a Job in Suffolk
description: THE Suffolk County Legislature's Democratic majorityor at least 11/12ths of itis squaring off for a fight with County Executive John V. N. Klein over what the Democrats consider to be their right to appoint a new police commissioner without Mr. Klein's approval.

title: Sudden Diplomacy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 29In one of his major foreign policy speeches of the election campaign, Governor Carter told the Foreign Policy Association in New York (June 23) that the time had come to get rid of the secretive and amoral policies of the past, and to introduce a new diplomatic posture.

title: Peter W. Wood to Wed Susan Scanlon, Lawyer
description: Mr. and Mrs Walter J. Scanlon of North Tarrytown, N.Y., and Lexington, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Jane Scanlon, to Peter Wynn Wood, son of Mr. and Mrs A. Wilson Wood of Cleveland Heights, Ohio.

title: Middle Class Tries A Penny Saved
description: Outwardly, the village of Chesham Bols, Buckinghamshire, population about 3,000, appears much as it has over the last 30 years. A prosperous suburb 30 miles northeast of Central London, it has a church built about 1200 A.D., a quaint village green, a treefilled common and narrow treelined roads with solid spacious homes and prestigious country cottages.

title: Notes: Cuba Angles For U. S. Travelers

description: OVER the years, Suffolk Democrats have often accused the Republicans of politicizing the County Police Department. It has been a political department, Floyd S. Linton, the Democratic chairman of the Suffolk County Legislature, said last week.

title: A New SALT Pact: The Last 10 Percent Is the Most Difficult
description: WASHINGTONIn his Inaugural Address, President Carter said, We iirill move this year a steptoward our ultimate goalthe elimination of all nuclear weapons from this earth. He was in effect promising to conclude negotiations with the Russians by the end of the year for a new treaty limiting strategic arms.

title: Naming of Luxury Passenger Liner Will Be a First for New York City
description: The pomp and circumstance of launching and naming a luxury passenger liner is something that has never taken place in the port. Something close to it, minus the launching, but with due and princely ceremony is scheduled to talte place in New York March 29 when a new Cunard line cruise ship is to be formally named the Cunard Princess. Honors will be done by a real princess and a prince or tae church, Princess Grace of Monaco and Terence Cardinal Cooke, Archbishop of New York.

title: N.A.S.L. Division Setup Altered Slightly
description: With the loss of the Boston and Philadelphia franchises for this season, the North American Soccer League realigned its division slightly yesterday for the 1977. season, which opens April 8. The most significant change is the move of the St. Louis Stars from the Western Division of the Pacific Conference to the Northern Division of the Atlantic Conference.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: ONE thing you can say about this miserable weather we've been having is that people seem to be talking to one another again. You have to say that.

title: White Fear of Black Mayors: Unjustified But Persistent
description: Manhattan Borough President Percy Sutton mentioned race only once last week when he announced he was candidate for mayor of New York City. But Mr. Sutton's colorhe is blackclearly will be an important, perhaps the most important, issue in the compaign.

title: Sports Today
description: City College vs. Lehman, at Mahoney Gym, Convent Avenue and 138th Street, noon. (TelevisionChannel 13, noon)

title: Finding the Milers
Stacey Roth Fiancee Of Jeffrey Bachrach
description: Stacey Gaye Roth and Jeffrey M. BachKach, seniors at Princeton University, plan to be married June 12 on the Princeton University campus. Mr. and Mrs. Henry J. Roth of Wyckoff, N.J., have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lee Bachrach of New York and Southbury, Conn.

title: East and West Meet in Turkish Steel
description: ISKENDERUN, TurkeyPeriodically, a bus pulls up in the center of this pleasant port city in southern Turkey and unloads a group of shoppersscarcely a noteworthy event but for one thingthe shoppers are Russian technicians who are helping to build and operate a huge steel mill 12 miles north of town.

title: Aqueduct Goes On, but Fuel Is Reduced
description: Several jockeys called it senseless to run horse races in 6degree weather, but they went out in woolen facemasks and rode, anyway yesterday at Aqueduct.

title: Douglas Queen to Wed Jean Worthington
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Worthington of New Canaan, Conn., and Truro, Mass., formerly of New York, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Jean MacLane Worthington, to Douglas Murray Queen, also of New Canaan. He is the son of Mrs. Gerald Queen of Detroit and the late Mr. Queen.

title: Headliners
description: For the first time in 13 years, Archbishop Makarios, leader of the Greek Cypriot community, and his Turkish opposite number, Rauf Denktash, have conferred in an attempt restore stability to the divided Mediterranean island. Mr. Denktash offered to restore to Greek Cypriots some of the 40 percent of the island that the Turks have held since the July, 1974, invasion, but Archbishop Makarios still insists that the division should follow the ethnic balance, SO percent Greek and 20 percent Turkish. Nevertheless, both he and Mr. Denktash called last week's meeting a breakthrough.

title: Design
description: They exist only in models, drawings, archives and designers fantasies. But they tell us a great deal about our tastes, standards and values.

title: Holy Cross Rally Downs Seton Hall in Final, 8277
description: In a basketball game that had a little bit of everything, including fisticuffs, Holy Cross came back from the brink ,yesterday to defeat Seton Hall, 8277, and win the Madison Square Garden Classic.

title: Food: A Battle Won, Not the War
description: The world food crisis, a phrase that a year or two ago regularly lifted the curtain on scenes of bloated bellies, matchstick arms and outstretched hands, is seldom mentioned today. The reason, of course, is that the crisis has gone away. At least for the moment.

title: Quality or Conspiracy in Color Television?
description: TOKYO  Most Sunday mornings Taisuke Watabe poses in front of his color TV, golf club in hand. Like many Japanese executives, he is a serious student of golf and says the televised lessons that dominate early morning and late night programming here have been a great help to my swing.

title: Nancy Dussault, ABC's Winsome Blooper Girl
